review_content:
I've been traveling around the world and your hotel is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Your rooms are so antiquated and the beds are so hard. You have only one(1) electrical outlet in the room. How can a hotel room have only one(1) electrical outlet. You can't even provide adapters for us to use with HK outlets.

The lounge service is terrible, The lounge opens at 12nn and it closes at 8pm, which is kinda stupid since it's supposed to be a meeting area for your guests any time of the day. When you pass 745pm. They would tell you to leave and we should leave our unfinished drinks on the table. When we wanted to get water and bring them to our room, They would not allow us, they informed us that we should call the front desk to ask for water. When we called the front desk for six(6) bottles of water to be brought up to the room, they refused, they will only provide us four(4) bottles. Is that how you treat your hotel guests? If we didn't stay at your executive floors, How poorly would you treat your regular guests.

Your drinks selection are terrible. How can you serve cheap liquor to your VIP's.

Your Buffet area is big but the food is unappetizing and unpalatable.

Overall, It was a horrendous experience for me and my children. I refuse to stay in your hotel in the future. There are so many hotels that would give us way better quality and service with the same amount of money.

Good Day!

The hotel location was so convenient. You are in the middle of the eateries and shopping area. The staff spoke fluent English. The rooms was a bit dated but still nice and quite big
. The bed was comfy.

date: Kazemi li wrote a review Jul 2023
review_content:
本人於agoda.com 訂了一間房間, 由於系統問題 導致系統幫我訂咗兩間房在同一日， 而且不能取消或退款。 已經立刻跟agoda聯絡, 但他們堅持係本人嘅問題無法取消。 到check in當日跟前枱同事解釋, 很可惜前枱你們嘅同事joyce， 好似機械式咁樣答覆, 沒有解決問題。 幸好遇到你哋嘅客戶體驗經理Dennis， 非常之耐心聽我講解情況。 我都作出相對嘅跟進， 我明白booking有問題並非你們的責任。 但至少我見到Dennis 你真心了解我嘅苦況， 並作出相對的安排。 令到我覺得你哋嘅服務唔係機械式, 而係有為顧客著想。
To Dennis: Really appreciated your prompt reply and action under my situation, your excellent service is worthy of recognition and praise. Thank you for give me a wonderful day at Regal hotel.

The room aircon was 17 degrees as I believe they were trying to get rid of the damp old carpet smell. Everything's very old, dark, damp, the wall was wet due to the aircon being on 24 hours a day at a low degree to fabricate the bad smell. The room has a dark energy and it feels like in a horror movie. I stayed for only 1 night and left, nobody wants to refund me any money. I booked for 5 nights. This is a scam, it should be a 0 star. Extremely unhappy 🙁. I'm warning…

review_content: First time to stay in the hotel, I requested a Happy birthday wording or greetings or a simple fruit display as a sign of birthday greetings to my lil sis but nothing at all. We call housekeeping to change the coffee,sugar,cream sachet holder bec it was dirty, some dried food left over on it. It took them about 30mins to get it change. .

review_content: Stayed Room 2214 from 28 to 31 May The room needs refurbishment. Compared to my stay last Sep, it’s worse. Washroom door unable to close fully. Aircon is not cold even set at 18 degrees. On the other hand, we appreciate the room cleaner (29 May), she’s helpful and courteous. date: Elsa L wrote a review Apr 2023
review_content: The hotel has serious security issues and things are broken and the management does not have a capable system to deal with customer's feedback, like fixing a door. Day 1 we arrived at the hotel, the bathtub tap knob fell off when we turned it on. We just arrived from a long haul flight and waited patiently for the maintenance team, there were 3 staff sent to deal with this issue. I thought ok, this hotel is old, but they were fast to react. Didn't change room. We went out for dinner and came back, a cleaning lady reminded us to check our door. It is those usual card key locks (which normally you don't think much about how it works and it just closes and opens with the card) and indeed it was not closed properly. We thanked her and saw that the door was not fitted properly and…

The room look clean comfortable and wide area. Good service in the front and housekeeper. The restroom has a meduim jacuzzi. Best the location easy to walk to MTR. For totally I like your hotel with this price it is not to high but more convenient to stay in a short time.

The senior the guys here theofe obnoxious they believe they ajev to be... Had a lousy checkin experience and the manager made it real difficult. Its an ancient hotel masquerading as a 5 star. Simple things like AC control not working or unusable, power switches, as far away from bed as possible... Never coming back to this hotel.

I am glad to be back again after the epidemic period. As usual, I love to meet my old friends there and enjoy the happy hours with beer and snack. Room condition is good and cleanliness is up to standard. Appreciate the hard work of housekeeping staff who always contribute a lot. Front desk is always busy but professional. I definite had a nice time again in my second home.

Its been quite awhile that i stayed in this hotel. It used to be one of the better managed and friendly hotels at Causeway Bay . From my years with Tripadvisor I never gave negative reviews. This is my only time. First let me tell you about the room. The carpet in the room is not glued tightly so the surface is uneven. For a 64 year old person with tired legs , i almost stumble a few times. So beware. The smell of mothballs all over the room. Not true? Come to my room and smell it yourselves right now. The only consolation is that the room is bigger than most new hotels in the area. Now about the service. The people at the reception are quite rude. We booked with Agoda not on a what they called a ‘long term package’ . Did the confirmation say that we were booking a long…

No one ever answer the phone at the reception and the first floor cafe. Wi-Fi connection is slow. Service level at the cafe is poor. Short of House keeping staffs and mostly over worked. I have stayed here for a few months, so I fully experienced the bad service of this hotel. Many areas have to be improved.

Room It shows a sign of ageing. It desperately needs a total renovation. Basically everywhere you look in the room, you could see torn and worn, althought the room size is decent. Amenities There is a functional gym which your room card could not be used to access. You need to go to the front desk to register first every time you want to…

review_title: The good thing about this hotel is the location
review_content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. The decor is dated but the rooms large. The good thing about this hotel is the location - the MTR, tram station and bus stop are all nearby. If you enjoy shopping, Sogo and Tines Square are nearby. There are also many eateries nearby that open until late at night. However, the food served during breakfast is mediocre and the reception staff who checked me in was not the most polite person in the service industry. Nonetheless, the rooms were kept clean. When I checked out after a week’s stay, the front desk was polite (different lady) and the concierge was helpful.

review_content: I was stuck in a massage salon which only accepted cash. I was not forewarned and I ended up in an argument with the manager, who called the police. I rang the hotel. I was desperate. Kathy Chan the Manager, offered to settle the bill for me from her own private account. I am so grateful. Kathy and the entire hotel staff are always happy to help. Kathy went far beyond. Hotel is very comfortable, spacious and close to everything. I’ve been coming to HK for 25 years and stayed in some great places but the Regal is now my HK haunt.

review_title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed! Be careful!!
review_content: One of the worst hotel I have ever stayed! Fake “5-star” hotel with very old conditioned, poor maintenance, poor wifi room. I have checked in on my first day. Then suddenly a contractor knocked my door and wanted to complete the painting (please refer to photo). I was shocked and had to request them to postpone their maintenance (how can they check in a guest when maintenance of the room is not done? Can you imagine stay in the room with the smell of paint for whole week?). However, the worst is yet to come. They don’t have iron and iron board in the room so I requested for it. When it was delivered, I tried to iron my clothing. When I was preparing and left the iron in the cushion for 2-3sec, it left a mark on cushion. I was shocked (as it happened so fast) and I quickly lifted…

review_content: Everytime our family decides to travel to Hong Kong, we choose to stay at Regal Hong Kong. And our visit this September 28, 2022 was no exception. It was a homecoming of sorts after 3 years of no travel due to the pandemic. Regal Hong Kong never fails to deliver - its proximity to almost anything (good food, shops, easy access to all kinds of transportation, etc.), its ambience, and the warmth, helpfulness and efficiency of the whole hotel team make it always the HOTEL OF CHOICE for us. My recent 17 day stay at this hotel with my daughter was made more comfortable and hassle-free by the care and concern given us by the abled, warm-hearted and efficient Ms. KATHY CHAN, Guest Experience Manager, who made sure that our needs were well-attended to. Ms. Lucy of Housekeeping was also…

The next day, when I returned to the hotel at around 1am, the entire lobby was filled with water, and there was only one elevator could be used for the next two days. On the third day, COCKROACHES were found on my sister's bed and by the TV cabinet in the morning. I politely asked the cleaning…

date: Claudia Harrison wrote a review Jun 2022
review_content: All the staff at the Regal are absolutely wonderful and so cooperative. Especially the manager Kathy is extremely kind and has a great attitude, she is extremely helpful and overall is amazing. This is without a doubt an excellent hotel with the best service. I cannot express how great the staff are!

review_title: Don't book here and don't EVER use Booking.com
review_content: Made a reservation through Booking.com then discovered that the pool was undergoing renovation (its in the very small print..) When I went to cancel the booking because the whole point of the staycation was to chill around the pool, was told, No Refund, and directed to Booking.com who then replied that I had to contact the hotel to get a refund. Spoke to an agent at the hotel who then directed me back to Booking.com. Again, no assistance, even when I asked if I could change the date or even reinstate the booking; nope, had to make (and pay for a new booking). The most disgraceful piece of buck passing and lack of accountability and care factor I have experienced in 25 years of managing hotels myself. Wont be recommending this hotel and certainly wont EVER use Booking.com again.

The regal reward programme is near useless. Had a gold membership, one of the benefits will be earlier check in. Earlier check in almost never ever happened in regal hk hotel in cwb. Always asked to wait until 3pm. May i suggest management team to review this. I think it is related to receptionist training.

date: ML M wrote a review Jun 2022
review_content: Hktb Package 2022-06-18 to 2022-06-19 includes one night stay, semi breakfast buffet and dinner buffet. Thanks to hotel, upgraded to executive floor with semi sea view, and free food and 6 cans of soft drink and beers in mini bar. There are lots of mirror inside the room and it is excellent for those who like to enjoy their whole night with their partner (i guess). Bathtub design is good, water is hot enough. Lots of unlimited served seafood in dinner buffet. Greentea warm cheese cake and roast duck is perfect! Paddington bear is a gift in this package. A father's day cake is free for a table in buffet. Breakfast is ok because we are too full and we cant eat much in the morning. Swimming pool is closed, which let us feel a bit disappointed. But we can enjoy the gym room during…

date: Xianne Mariz wrote a review Jun 2022
review_title: Graduation Dinner in Regal Hong Kong Hotel
review_content: My school celebrated our graduation dinner on the 3rd June 2022 at Regal Hong Kong Hotel and everything went well. The staffs were very friendly and the food was excellent!! For the buffet, we had requested halal food since we have Muslim students and teachers, and Anson Yau was very kind and very patient with all of my requests. He was also very clear about all the details. I strongly suggest having your graduation dinner here! I'm sure that you guys will enjoy it at Regal Hong Kong Hotel. Other than the graduation dinner, some of my friends also decided to book a room and stay overnight in the hotel. The room was great for friends to chill and drink hahaha. The one I booked had two double beds and it was perfect for my friends and me cause we won't have to squeeze in... The…

Gross. Absolutely gross. I stayed there for 2 nights. And after I checked in, I wanted to take a hot bath after shower. When I turned on the tap, many black dirts came out along with water from the tap. That was absolutely GROSS and it was not what I expected to experience in a five stars hotel.

date: jessie n wrote a review Apr 2022
review_title: Clean and tidy accommodation with convenient location
review_content: The room is clean and tidy.. the location is very convenient , The hotel is located in Causeway bay which is at the center of Hong Kong. Just walked to the shopping malls in few minutes from the hotel. It is my first choice if I choose the hotel in CWB.

date: Rafael S wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: We went there for a friend’s birthday and The Deluxe Suite is really nice, spacious and comfortable. Me and my friends enjoyed it. Thank you to DENNIS DULAY the Assistant Manager at Front Desk for being so helpful and accommodating. He’s very professional.

date: Svenja E wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: My partner and I booked the deluxe room for the weekend and were so thrilled that we even extended it with a spontaneous night. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean and the extra bathtub was a very luxurious feature. But what definitely stood out the most was the thoughtful service. Always with a warm smile on the lips, you were greeted daily by the management and even the room service. Along with complimentary snacks and cocktails, they always tried to make your stay as pleasant as possible, especially through the kind guest service manager Mr Dennis Dulay. Thanks to a good online deal, the price-performance ratio was really outstanding. I can only recommend the hotel to others.

date: Chu D wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: A Mr.Dennis Dulay helped me to check in during a very busy session of Hotel Regal HK in our of my stay in April as he found out I am a very frequent platimum card customer for the last two n half years. He was very passionate to help n very effecient to get the room card n check in forms for me to sign within 3minutes. Additionally he also rectified my rewards points in my stay in March , (I stayed 8nights but the rewards statement only showed one night.) Ever since that, if I have any difficulty to book the room , (I usually call the reception),or anything,I will ask for his assistance n he will handle for me personally with utmost professionalism. I would command your hotel to have recruited such an efficient and friendly oriented manager...

date: Angela S wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: This review is worth writing for the experience I had staying at Regal Hong Kong Hotel. Special thanks to Mr. Dennis Dulay, the Guest Experience Manager by the time I stayed. As he helped me all the way to have a weekend staycation worth. I double booked from Agoda, but he helped me cancel the second booking I did. It was ok for me if it hasn’t been cancelled because it was my fault, but Mr. Dulay really helped me to get it refunded. It was a first that it was done for me and really a very hospitable experience. My overall experience in the hotel was superb! From the check-in, the spacious room, great breakfast, location, and most especially the staff. It is all worthwhile and will definitely book for another stay.

Little misunderstanding with my booking at check-in, but Guest Service Manager Dennis was able to address my concerns swiftly and definitely elevated my overall experience. Would very likely to return for an other stay.

date: Mei Jai wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: This is an excellent hotel with fabulous customer service. The staffsare nice and easy to talk with especially Dennis Dulay the duty manager. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. I won't hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends and relatives.

Staying for 60 days. Staff are very accommodating and friendly. Feels at home with the kind of service they provide. Special thanks to Dennis Dulay, their Guest Experience Manager, for an awesome team and great hotel service!

date: Jo Irish Dimpas S wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: Our stay was fabulous,the room and bed was just perfect and comfortable to stay with...the staff are very approachable and friendly specially sir Dennis Dulay,i would surely recommend this hotel to other friends and family...

Hello Mr. Dennis. Thank you for asking, I stayed in your hotel because I have been there couple times alreadt thats why on my birthday I chose Regal Hotel personally to celebrate it. I enjoyed the room that I checked in. The view from the window is spectacular, the room is clean. But just want to suggest if you could provide an iron for clothing so in case guests has some gathering to attend to..they can iron their clothes and be presentable to the occassion but other than that, is ok. Will recommend your hotel ti my friends and hope to stay again in Regal Hotel..thank you. To Mr Dennis Dulay guest experience manager at regal hotel hongkong thank you sir ,till next time

date: Howie ちゃん H wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: Overall, hotel is neat and clean with reasonable price range, the staff was very helpful, as we had a last minute adjustment and Dennis had helped us to sort it out very quickly. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Room: Room was great, we had a Family Room that allow up to 4 ppl, very roomy, with the Easter package, the in-room decoration and toys was great, and our kid was very happy during this Easter holiday. Location: CWB, urban area with great restaurant nearby, and a famous bakery right next to the hotel.

date: S L wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: I have spent a night in the hotel between 16 Feb and 17 Feb and it has been a fantastic experience. The room is clean and the size of the bathtub is incredibly impressive, considering the affordable price of the room.

date: Noreen A wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: we enjoyed our stay. The staffs were amazing specially Mr. Dennis Dulay he made sure we had everything .as for the room,it was excellent and surprisingly comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others .

date: Smile Lui wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: Quick check in, helpful reception that he answered our questions quickly , good services , Nice manager with good attitude who help us on phone or face to face , quick response , The room is spacious and comfortable

The receptionists were friendly and were exceptional at handling guests especially Dennis, the guest experience manager. The room was very pleasing to the eyes, had an amazing view of the city below and seemed very clean. It was a very pleasant experience.

Room was spacious and the view was wonderful. Staff were kind. Very grateful for The guest experience manager Dennis Dulay for being friendly and helpful. Location is convenient with many restaurants nearby

review_title: Good service of the duty manager Gary Or
review_content: Good services of the duty manager Gary Or .Deputy Manager Gary Or is helpful as always .As Platinum Member and loyalty guest in Regal Group .I am totally satisfied on the services .he provided and really enjoyable to stay in here. Anyway , the hotel services was good .the executive lounge was also relaxing. BUT , the ROOM not very clean because dusts had gathered in corners and edges.

date: J. A. wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: We recently had an amazing stay at the Regal. The facilities and ambiance was great. The rooms were spectacular. The staff were super accommodating and friendly. Particularly Mr Dulay, his hospitality another level. He and his team will certainly go out of the way to ensure a tremendous stay.

date: Yuhong L wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: 酒店房間環境舒適 遺落物品尋回的通知及處理都讓我非常滿意 服務人員Dennis的態度也讓人非常滿意 態度非常誠懇 辦事非常有效率 感謝協助處理個人問題 DENNIS is a very nice person and very helpful. He cares about the customers a lot and always try his best satisfying the customers.

date: Mark N wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: One of my favourite places to stay, it has good service and a wonderful bathtub with a very reasonable price, and the very helpful duty manager dennis provide good service when my friend when he lost his identity card, I will definitely choose to stay here again next time.

Stayed for just one night on a visit to town, the booking was made very late and was a fantastic deal for a family room. We arrived fairly late as had been to an event, but the staff were great, very accommodating, in particular Dennis was very attentive - the hotel was quiet due to travel restrictions and we benefitted from an upgraded room which the kids loved. Shame the pool and lots of other facilities are closed, but that's common in all hotels in HK at the moment

review_title: Convent and decent 5 stars hotel in Causeway
review_content: It is located in Causeway Bay that is very convenient for shopping, restaurants and traveling around at her areas. The room is spacious, clean and most importantly the view is very good. You will see part of the Victoria Harbour and the nice park! Bathroom is clean and spacious with a nice bathtub. Overall, it was good stay.

review_title: Convenient location, friendly staff. Great bath!
review_content: Convenient location near shops, restaurants and Victoria Park. High ceilings and tasteful decor make this a calming environment, in a welcome contrast to the busy local area. Front of house staff are polite and respectful (especially Dennis!), and helpful whenever I needed anything. Rooms do not have very modern furniture, I guess older/more ornate style is what you’d expect from a “regal” hotel! Utilities/facilities are all there, except do not remember seeing robes. The large corner bath is a highlight for me, nice to have it separate from the shower too! As someone who looks for a clean room, comfortable bed and friendly staff, I will definitely be booking to come here again!

date: Merna A wrote a review Apr 2022
review_content: Me and my friends had a great fantastic time ever. The place was clean, awesome and lovely. I would like to express my thanks and appreciation for the service and care we received at Name of Mr Dennis Dulay. Looking forward of coming back again 😊

date: Chan S.Y. wrote a review Mar 2022
review_content: The room seriously needs SERIOUS cleaning. I’m not talking about the Housekeeping Staff. They have done a great job with making sure the room is clean and all that. However, there is a strange smell coming from the carpet. It’s like when someone steps on poo and then walks around the clean carpet. I noticed the smell on Day 1 and it really sucks that I have to bare with it until Day 7. I even bought myself a multi-purpose cleaning spray to get rid of the nasty smell but it just keeps coming back. Housekeeping helped Carpet has to be changed for real. Really embarrassing to have my friends come visit me with the smell. Also, the wifi is so SLOW. It keeps disconnecting. I can’t have proper online meetings. My view gets pixelated and I can’t properly finish a movie/series from…

date: Lok Chen wrote a review Feb 2022
review_content: The room fair enough tidied but long queuing was annoying. I am suffice on the hygiene facilitated by the hotel. Every patrons must scan the QR code for access and I had found the takeaway signage notice outside for food collection. The lobby installed plenty of sanitisers and plastic partition were uprighted at reception . In the midst of current virus battering moment , most of the facilities were suspended which tinged a bit disappointment to me . Overall content on every details especially the hygiene , cleanliness and hospitality postures tally to the brand .

I’ve been a long-standing customer at this hotel, having stayed here the last two trips to HK for 11-12 months. I’ve always felt a warm atmosphere, which is why it pains me to realize the hotel actually don’t care about me at all. I’m just a number. At the time of this writing, HK is in the middle of winter and in the midst of the worst COVID outbreak ever. In response, the hotel refused to accept food deliveries or allow them to be placed inside the hotel waiting area. Instead, food is kept outside, where it’s publicly accessible by anyone (see photos). When I brought this matter to management’s attention, the “Director of Front Office Operations” assigned the blame to me. He told me that’s just the way it is and it’s the hotel policy and he does not accept any responsibility…

date: Grace C wrote a review Feb 2022
review_content: Good service. staff is nice and explain detailly. Tea set is igable and beautiful. the suitcase presentation is impressive. the room decoration is captureable. especially the bus bed and the whole wall backdrop. overall is a good experience.

date: Apple Lee wrote a review Feb 2022
review_content: Great service. Nice decoration. The Paddington Bear decorations in the room were so impressed. My friend and I had so much fun taking photos. There are backdrop in the restaurant and in the lobby too. Clean and tidy room. Good facilities. Average food.

date: drake o wrote a review Jan 2022
review_content: Staff are generally friendly and helpful. Air flow is weak probably from the aging exhaust vent system, can't dry clothes easily. Surprisingly, this hotel do charge local calls that are generally free for other hotels.

review_title: Old hotel with slow service and poorly designed room
review_content: The hotel and room are overall dated. Hotel lobby was hot and the check in area was temporary. Process was slow and the queue time was long even at 6:30pm. My room (twin) wasn't ready so staff offered an upgrade to 32/F room, which was a double bed, and was a bit inconvenient but was glad I had a room before 7pm. The room only had the basic and fridge was not working well. We needed ice to chill a wine we brought so we called room service but the phone was never answered. I had to go back to that check-in area and queue, again, at 8:30pm. There was no wine glass in the room as well even though the staff said there should have been. Since the hotel looked quite old, i really couldn't comment on the cleanliness of the room. However, there was some grease stain on the window…

Reservation was made through booking.com where we found similar rates to what they were offering directly on the hotel website. Check-in was quite slow compared to most hotels around the city. response_content: Dear Tokbutt, Thank you very much for your review. I would like to express my sincere apologize for your unpleasant experience at Regal Hongkong Hotel. By reading your comments, I could imagine how frustrated you felt during your last visit. I take note on every point you have mentioned in your review, I also inspected the room you’ve stayed. I fully agree with you there are few areas no up to a reasonable expectation which we will take immediate action to rectify. At the present situation around the globe, hygiene is the highest priority in every aspect especially for a hotel. In addition, maintaining a good condition of room’s fixture also play an important role for us to compete with other hotels within the area. Apart from the above, we are sorry about some delay on your requested service which is adding more disappointment to your experience. We always invite our guest to share their staying experience with us, it is a very good tool for us to understand the needs directly from our customer. It also help us make correct response to the issue raised. We are not just looking at good comments, we also treasure the bad comments as good customer will spend time to write us these constructive opinions. The team and I strive to provide our guests with the most comfortable stay accompanied with the highest quality service. Clearly in this case we have fallen well short of our intention as well as your expectations. With all that said we still wish to be able to your host again in the not too distant future. Yours sincerely, Christo Diamandopoulos General Manager

review_title: Disappointing stay with so much to share…
review_content: Chose this hotel for my birthday celebration as their suite was on a deal and close proximity to where my friends were but that was a start to a nightmare… Hygiene - huge concern! The photos speak for themselves… the handle for the bathtub was horrifyingly disgusting. Full of damp moulds that looks like it hasn’t been cleaned for decades. Then turning on the bath tub when the water ran out it was yellow and not until a while later it resumed back to clear!! Then those little pieces of brown bits came out… What are they…!? Blood stains - blood stains and brown-ish matters on the walls. Again, what were they?! Stains on sofa - their suite’s sofa was white and full of stains, found an old head band tucked in the side of the sofa…probably from some guests left behind10 yers ago. …

The problem arose when I tried to book a room reservation online on the hotel’s website and tried to enter my membership related information. However I was unsuccessful because the IT system did not accept the membership related information. Nevertheless I went ahead with the reservation (at a higher price) hoping that I could speak with hotel management after check…

review_content: We stayed at regal Hong Kong for 2 nights. The hospitality and service were amazing. We opted for breakfast at the hotel, it was sumptuous. The breakfast was the highlight. The staff at this hotel are very courteous, smart, prompt and genuinely interested in guest comfort. The hotel is centrally located and is a walking distance from most of the malls and restaurants. We also took advantage of a tour of Hong Kong from the hotel. The shuttle to the airport train is also worth keeping in mind. The Uber drivers in Hong Kong drive very fast hence the shuttle was a more comfortable option for us.

Hotel rooms & bathrooms are showing their age and should be updated but the staff and service are excellent so I just kept coming back to this hotel. I would suggest to pay a little more for the executive rooms because the executive guest service is just excellent and the rooms are better. review_title: It was a very good hotel
review_content: as the title says, it was indeed a very good hotel, maybe a little too bit "regal", nearly imperial style, but now the room furniture is old, scratched and outdated. The positive note is the cleanliness and the helpful service, but for the price they ask you during the exhibitions, there are better choices in Hong Kong. Located in Causeway Bay, not far from the MTR and even closer to the tram. The most negative note is the room temperature that even without aircon is freezing. And for "safety reasons" the windows can't be opened. The handles are blocked. When I told them that I would have not committed suicide if they had open a window, but I would have died frozen if they could not do anything, they brought a heather in the room...

review_title: Uncontrollable room air-conditioning made me freeze
review_content: The strongest point of this hotel is a connected (but not a part of the hotel) famous Taiwanese restaurant "Din Tai Fung," which saves your time for finding where to have a nice dinner. The facilities are a bit old-fashioned. The uncontrollable room air-conditioning made me freeze. There is no furniture for sitting down in the lobby. The concierge is not so attentive that we went to Stanley Market that has already closed. The location is very good for people using public transportation but due to the heavy services of buses and trams around the hotel, a colleague of mine failed to catch a car called through Uber. A Japanese department store "Sogo" and a large local supermarket "Welcome Superstore" that opens 24 hours are within a short walking distance.

review_title: Great location. OK hotel but missing some basics which could make it better.
review_content: Fantastic location in Causeway Bay. It is a tired hotel and that is reflected in its pricing as a more competitively priced hotel so that's fine - I'm not expecting 5 star opulence. However there are just simple basics which really shouldn't occur. For example - no iron in room (this was a common theme amongst my group who also stayed there), great pool deck on top floor which would be perfect to relax in and enjoy the view - but not heated so the water even in April was icy and there is nowhere to sit in the lobby unless you are willing to buy a drink or have something to eat. The rooms are tired/dated but I can live with that because of the price range of the hotel, but its just those other little things above which I mention that left me a little disappointed in general with…
response_title:
Response from Regal_Hongkong_Hotel, Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Oct 24, 2019
response_content: Dear, Adamo, Thank you for your very valuable feedback. I was very sorry to read your comments. I must apologize that you were left disappointed and that we did not meet your expectations. We are indeed in the generation of Hong Kong hotels that could be described as “older”. We hope that this is seen as what once used to be called “Grand”. We work hard on the upkeep & maintenance of the hotel to ensure all the facilities are first class. You are correct, we do not have and iron & ironing boards in the rooms, because we offer a 24 hr valet pressing service. Iron & ironing boards are available should guest specifically require them. I was glad to read you enjoyed the views from our 35th floor swimming pool. To have such a pool in the heart of the city, with views of the Harbour is something unique and something we are very proud of. I am sorry the water was not to your liking, as is common with most swimming pools in Hong Kong, due to generally high year round ambient temperature the pool is unheated. There is plenty of seating in the lobby, I am sorry you were put off by some of the signage, that is purely advisory for none hotel guest, due to our location we do attract a lot of walk in visitors. We try to prioritize the lounge for the use of hotel guests. Again, please do accept my sincerest apologies. We pride ourselves on exceeding, rather than disappointing guest expectations. We have a number of very exciting upgrade programs planned for the hotel. I hope that as you found our location such a positive draw you will come back and try us again. Please contact me when you do. I very much look forward to welcoming you back. Kind Regards. Andrew Andrew Hickey General Manager.

review_content: I had some problem opening the door with the door key after check-in, and the receptionist said that the electronic door "ran out" of battery so I couldn't open the door, which was a pretty strange reason for me. But apart from this, the experience was pretty ok. The room was neat and tidy; decoration was quite old-fashioned and looked worn out (especially the bathroom); considering it's been around for decades it is not too bad. Service was fine, location was great. It's good for a quick stay if you do not ask for too much and convenience is your priority (eatery; shopping malls; convenience stores; MTR and bus stations).

date: richard t wrote a review Sep 2019
review_content: 6th September 2019 If you need to go Hong Kong during this crazy period of time, Regal Hong Kong is the safest to stay, away from the riots and craps! Super near to the popular Causeway Bay shopping stretch and many local authentic eateries, there's even a all-day dim sum restaurants and dessert stores. The best part about the hotel is the roof top outdoor pool. Its beautiful. Classic European interior design and full amenities in the room. Breakfast is horrible and expensive, so please skip that. Right outside the hotel lobby is the pickup stand to the Hong Kong Express Train station. Its a free shuttle which runs every 20mins. Thats all.

review_content: We booked into the Regal Hotel Hong Kong for two nights after a stay in the Regal Airport Hotel. Unfortunately the Regal Hotel Hong Kong is not on par with the Regal Airport Hotel. Rooms are much smaller and not on par while the excecutive club are not as nice as other Hotels. The breakfast service is the worst. The first day I had to skip breakfast due to fact that my bus were leaving and I already waited for more than 30 min after I ordered. The next day I immediately told them I am in a hurry and although there were only 4 people for breakfast on the executive breakfast area they still took more than 25 minutes to produce a normal bacon and egg. Really poor service at Regal Hotel Hong Kong

(Perhaps that went well with the "regal" theme of the hotel) except, that in some ways it really feels like a modern building. Many of their guests use it for business- saw a lot in office wear. review_title: Standard rooms are really old and run down
review_content: We stayed at the Regal (Causeway bay) on the basis it was close the the shops, MTR, had airport transfers and it's value for 3 person bedroom. Other than that, our room was really old, the wall paper was pealing off, thick layer of dust on the windows edges, carpet was stained everywhere, grout on the bathroom tiles, the marble was cracked and poorly patched up. The service we received was very minimal in the 10 days stay, was only greeted on the day of check in and the day we left due to the airport transfer. Little things like, when we arrived we had 3 fruits in our room, we didn't touch it and after a week they started to rot, the cleaners didn't replaced or thrown it out. I wouldn't say it was family friendly or a 5 star hotel.

review_content: Although the decor is a little over the top for current Western taste (think early 80s), this is a very reasonably priced hotel in a great location in Causeway Bay. The staff is very friendly and helpful - Really appreciate the front desk team giving us a couple of tips on some local restaurants we weren’t familiar with. Room was spacious, clean and super comfy - as it was our last few nights in HK, we upgraded and it was worth the few extra dollars. The view from the restaurant is stunning - and the food was great - not quite Michelin-star, but beautifully presented and tasty too! Love that the chef came out to make sure everything was okay and recommended a fab wine (great wine list to choose from). Definitely recommend and will be back next time in HK.

review_title: Fine food in a sumptuous setting with an incredible view!
review_content: The restaurant in the Regal was a real treat! With a superb view of the Harbor the setting of the restaurant is excellent. The decor is lavish and a bit over the top, but it is sumptuous and guaranteed to put you in the mood for a feast. We had the chef's tasting menu, which ran the gamut from a delightful carpaccio to an absolutely delicious desert. The chef is French, but specializes in Italian cuisine. Each dish in the tasting menu was well-proportioned - not too little; not too much. The plating was excellent, so that the meal was a visual feast as well as a tasty one. The wine selection is substantial and the sommelier was quite knowledgeable. In short, well worth a visit!

review_content: We know Hong Kong Island pretty well and wanted to give this hotel a try because of the beautiful pictures shown online. We usually stay at another hotel if we're in Hong Kong. We arrived in Hong Kong very early at 5ish AM so we took our sweet time in claiming our luggage and taking the bus A11 to the hotel. We arrived at the hotel around 7ish AM. We went over to the reception and a lady receptionist greeted us with no smile, which was our first disappointment as this is a 5-star hotel! She explained that check in time was 2PM (which we already know) so there were no rooms available for us and told us to check back at 2PM. We said, no problem. We needed luggage storage so we could go out for breakfast. She told us to over to the concierge which we did. Our second disappointment…

review_content: It's an old property but well maintained. The location is great, in causeway bay near victoria park. Staff are very helpful and courteous. It's a busy hotel. The breakfast spread is very good but quite expensive. Some more in room amenities could be provided - more drinking water, cookies and fruits etc. Because of the location, there are lot of food options in and around the hotel. Being a busy location, availability of taxi during the morning peak hours is a challenge though the hotel staff try their best to get taxi for the guests. Causeway bay MTR station is very close. Buses are also very good in Hong Kong. If you have an octopus card, life is even simpler

I was checked in by Tina and I have to say of all the hotels that I have ever stayed in, this was the best ever experience during a check in. I was made very welcome by Tina and was given a complimentary gift as well. The room was excellent and was on the 34th floor and became my second home for the past week. Breakfast was served in the executive lounge and there was lots of food available without having to go to the main restaurant. I was able to use the executive lounge during the day of my departure. review_content: My family and I stayed at Rm1614. After one night I felt I had bites on my legs(May 2-3) and thought nothing of it. I thought they were just mosquito bites. Then after 2 nights my legs were full of bites! They were bed bugs. I told the concierge but it was too late. After researching, found out that you don’t really feel the bites on the first two days. So now I’m back home, my legs are gross at least 20-30 bites per leg and dying of itchiness. I emailed Regal Hotel to give them feedback and the only response I got was sorry, please come back again to redeem themselves. Why would I go back? So lucky my husband and child didn’t get bites(my husband didn’t, my daughter got around 5.) I have to wear pants or long skirts for the next 2-3 weeks until these bites subside. I feel like…

date: Lisa T wrote a review Apr 2019
review_title: The Worst Hotel in the World
review_content: The worst hotel Ive stayed in. Booked an Executive room at the Regal Hotel & it was far from Executive. I had booked via my work website & payed $390 AUD. They were suppose to charge me upon arrival but had taken the money out before I had left Sydney for Hong Kong. Arrived at the hotel after 8pm. I had messaged the hotel the previous day to arrange a shuttle pick up (which advertised as free on the website when you book an Executive room) to know reply. I had to travel on the MTR then onto a free H3 Shuttle to the hotel. The shuttle driver driving was terrifying & he had no care for safety. He drove that fast that we nearly crashed into a merging vehicle. He was driving so fast around the corners I thought we would tip. I was relieved to finally arrive at the hotel. …
response_title:
Response from Regal Hongkong H, 總經理 at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Apr 24, 2019
response_content: Dear Ms. Taylor, Thank you for taking your precious time to share your feedback with us. We're very sorry to hear that you had an unpleasant experience at Regal Hongkong Hotel and please know that we investigate every review seriously and accept responsibility when we as a hotel genuinely get our experience delivery wrong. First of all, please accept our sincere apologies for the unsatisfied experience regarding the mishandling your credit card authorization. After review there was a delay from our side, once we received the reservation, to process payment – and this resulted in the team member at Front Desk asking for credit card verification again upon your arrival at the hotel. It was a failure from our side to process the reservation properly. It was not intentional but I fully appreciate the confusion that we created with this situation and the concerns that you would experience with the feeling that you were being charged twice. This would never happen – but I accept the perception would have been quite real in this case. The credit card authorization amount requested upon check has been sent back to the bank for cancellation. Secondly, our Engineering Team has inspected all the air-conditioning system and adjusted the temperature of our guestroom in accordance with the guidelines. Your review helps us constantly enhance our services and facilities. Thirdly, I would like to assure you that I have personally addressed the issue of the service attitude to our concerned staff and will ensure that they receive the necessary guidance to perform better to avoid a similar recurrence. In future our Assistant Managers will escalate serious guest concerns, particularly involving payment issues, so that our guests’ stay are trouble free when they have paid in advance for journey. Ms. Taylor, thank you again for sharing your thoughts. It is only through constructive feedback such as yours that we are able to continue to improve our service. Please accept our sincere apologies for the unpleasant experience. We do hope we will have the pleasure of welcoming you back to Regal Hongkong Hotel again in the not too distant future. Warmest regards, Peter Martin General Manager

review_content: We booked 2 rooms by email, one that holds 4 people and one that holds 2. At check in were told that we have 2 rooms with 3 people in each. One of the rooms had two single beds and the other had a king size bed plus a single sofa bed. I asked how we could have three people sleep in two small beds and the clerk said "That's what you booked, and that's what you're getting." I then asked to see his supervisor. A "manager" named Jimmy came out of the back room armed for a fight. He was arrogant and militant. I asked if he could put a rollaway bed in the room with two beds and he said, "We don't have rollaway beds," After a few minutes of heated discussion Jimmy said that he could put an "extra bed" in the room for 575 Hong Kong Dollars per night! I told him that we had booked…

Clean, but miniscule, twin room on the executive floor for four days was a challenge. Bathroom was adequate, but included the dreaded "shower in the bath" - if you are "mature", short, overweight or suffer from balance or flexibility issues - avoid like the plague. For this trip, we weren't in HK for the hotel room and the location allowed for easy walking. Hotel seems very tired and in need of some serious maintenance. Overall though, it was safe, secure, cheerful and clean.

review_title: Ageing hotel at its last hoorah
review_content: We booked Regal through a package with the airline (Cathay Pacific). The hotel is located slightly off from Causeway Bay MTR (Exit F1), about 5 mins walk. The bonus is that you are away from the massive working crowd and tourists that throng the area while still close enough to SOGO and Hysan Place. Minimarts 7-11 and Circle K are just a few mins walk away, as are Decathlon (sports shop), Ikea, Windsor House, H&M and a cinema. Opposite is Pacific Coffee and there are two cha chan teng (local eateries) just behind the coffee chain. In short, the location is great for those who like the convenience of having everything around you. The hotel itself, while grand on the outside (afterall, its name conjures royalty) is an ageing structure on life support. Still, it was buzzing with…

review_title: The only good thing is the location
review_content: Stayed for 2 nights at close to SGD280 per night. At the rate you'll be paying, much better off staying elsewhere. Far from a 5 star hotel. First, there's no lounge / waiting area for one to sit. My travel companion had to stand at the lobby for more than an hour. The cafe on the ground floor imposes a minimum spend. Second, check-in too an extremely long time. There were only two counters, and a queue of 5 to 6 people took over an hour. Granted, the room has two large queen beds and was more than spacious. But the room was dated, and so was the bathroom - no detachable shower and tap was a little mouldy-looking. Have to say though, great concierge as they went out in the rain to flag taxis for the guests. Certainly not a 5-star experience.

date: Two Shackles Bill wrote a review Nov 2018
review_title: Ageing Beauty, But Still A Jewel
review_content: The Regal Hong Kong must have once been the "Jewel in the Crown" for the Hotel Chain.However whilst it is still a very good hotel, there were minor signs of wear & tear in our room e.g The toilet seat in our Executive Suite was broken & it wouldn't lift up. It took 3 days & 5 people to fix it. The Nepresso Machine didn't work & despite reporting, it wasn't replaced, the spa bath didn't work & the titles around the large spa bath were "No Gapped" up with silastic gunk. Besides those little hiccups the 8 day stay went well. Would I recommend the Regal Hotel Hong Kong? The answer is yes, however to be an authentic 4/5 Star Hotel there needs to be a spruce up. The Hotel cannot survive on location, location, location although it is a GOOD LOCATION.

date: Mark B wrote a review Nov 2018
review_content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. It’s close to everything you may want: bars, restaurants, shopping and entertainment. Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and had a great experience. From the airport transfers which were included in our nightly rate to the staff always having a smile. We stayed in an Executive Room on the 33rd floor which was spacious but a bit dated. The bed was fantastic and the Wifi and Air Conditioning (a key in HKG) worked perfectly. Staying on the Executive Floor allowed us to have breakfast in the lounge as well as evening cocktails. Breakfast food offerings were more then adequate and the evening cocktails included the necessities. Overall, I would not hesitate staying here again.

review_content: The Hong Kong Regal has been a pleasant surprise. We managed to secure an executive club room with complimentary soft-drinks/beer, breakfast and clubroom access all for about the same price as many other comparable hotels are offering for a basic no frills room.The regal is well located, being situated in causeway bay, a major shopping precinct. The free airport shuttle can drop you at the front door, and the MTR/trams are both nearby too. The executive rooms are well appointed, and the coffee pod machine was a welcome addition. Other reviews have noted that there are not a lot of powerpoints available but we found a 4-way extension hidden behind the desk which we were able to use. Perhaps instead of hiding the extension plug adaptor the hotel could make its location obvious.…

Told again that my room is being cleaned and would be ready in about one hour. This is a joke. Check in time at this alleged FIVE STAR hotel is 2:00pm. No apologies from the front of house staff who to be honest have a very poor level of English. And they are treating the Mandarin speakers even worse. The only people being treated with any courtesy are the Cantonese speakers. Prices for today are twice the usual going rate as it is high season (public holiday). Therefore it shouldn't be a surprise to management that it's busy. Perhaps with the…

date: Michelle T wrote a review Sep 2018
review_content: If you’re looking to stay in the hub of Causeway Bay it’s hard to go past this hotel. The room rate is very good and the hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the shopping district, adjacent to Victoria Park. There is a great gym in the basement. Breakfast (from a westerners perspective) is a little average but there is a great coffee shop right across the road. MTR station is less than 5 minutes walk and only three stops to Central. The rooftop pool is food too (not that I got to use it because it was raining heavily). I would definitely stay there again.

review_content: We stayed at the regal Hongkong Hotel on our first stay to Hong Kong and we were very happy with the location. Right next to the trolley, and close to lots of shopping and restaurants. Very safe location and a good spot for a first visit. The hotel was clean and sufficient, but dated. The decor was definitely older and lack of outlets. We were a little turned off by the extra costs - to sit in the lobby while we were waiting for our room to be ready (as we were about an hour early), we were required to buy expensive coffees/teas. Water bottles in the room came with a charge. The concierge was not overly helpful to try to help us find restaurants and activities.

review_title: Customer service - Regal hotel does not understand customer service
review_content: I have booked for 6 days next week and I booked one of the better rooms with breakfast which I agree was a good deal at the time. I also paid extra for the flexible option which allowed me to make changes if required.I use booking.com for all my bookings and wherever I travel throughout the world I never get a problem with this service, as sometimes my schedules do change, which I dont mind paying a fair price to change. But this hotel does not care about customers, and this is a problem as I have not even arrived yet The management in this hotel seem to only want me to cancel my full booking and rebook again at a price which is 25% more expensive. I find this repulsive, as I am still staying the same number of days, and all I want is to arrive 1 day later and leave 1 day…

date: Sarah W wrote a review Aug 2018
review_content: I stayed at the Regal Hong Kong for 3 nights and the experience was very good. Location was fantastic and it was close proximity to the MTR station, major shopping malls and plenty of eateries and restaurants. It was located right in the heart of Causeway Bay. The room was fairly large as compared to most hotels in Hong Kong. It was spacious and clean. But one thing is that there were plenty of mirrors in the room which I find that it was a bit too overwhelming. It’s like you are looking at yourself all the time while in the room! There was a separate shower and bath tub. I don’t use the bath tub so to me, having a separate shower area works best for me. The bed was also comfortable and the best was the air conditioning in the room! It was Summer and weather was hot so we…

review_title: The hotel allowed me to check in early.
review_content: I stayed in Regal from 6/25/18 until 7/6/18. My flight was early and I arrived at 6 am on 6/25/18. The hotel usually does not allow checking in until 1400. I was very tired upon arrival. I called the hotel and I spoke with Jophy who initially told me that there is no room a/v. I arrived at the hotel around 8 am thinking of just unloading my luggage and waiting till 2 pm to get in my room. Jophy (who was on the phone with me earlier) registered my info and told me that they have a room for me early. it happened that Jophy and her manager Thomas had worked very hard to get my room ready so that I can check in early. I am extremely grateful and impressed by their excellent service. Thank you Jophy and Thomas for your excellent services!!!

review_title: Convenient, not luxurious but not awful, good value for money
review_content: If you do not want to spend $400 on a luxurious hotel but cannot stand cheap hotels, Regal Hong Kong is a nice compromise. If I have extra cash, this hotel will not be my first choice. But if I feel guilty from splurging too much, I'll pick this as my hotel in Hong Kong. This hotel has a very convenient location in Causeway Bay, which is my preferred area to stay while in HK. Most of the guests are Chinese from the mainland. Check-in area is very small and can be crowded and chaotic. The room decor is gaudy. They try to have French motif but the materials are obviously very cheap. Having said these, the hotel is relatively new. The building is nice and the lobby is bright with shiny marble floors. Even the cheapest rooms have bathtub. This hotel is also right next door to…

review_title: Average Hotel, in need of an upgrading
review_content: Location was good, as it is easy access to many shopping areas, MTR, and eateries. However, the lobby is in need of an upgrading as the furniture is abit outdated. Check in was slow. Took about 25 mins despite there are 3 guest services staff on duty. Room was okay however the mattress and the pillows are too soft to my liking. I stayed in an non-smoking room but it still smelled bad when i reached my hotel room. Really need a dehumidifier system as there is a bad smell on the lift lobby whenever i stepped out of the room. The plus point is there is a shuttle bus that can ferry you to the airport but you need to book before hand.

review_content: Spacious family room with 2 queen beds for 4 persons to sleep comfortably. Room comes with bathtub and big wardrobe with safe, slippers and window seating. Our room was at a corner and location was fabulous. Hotel has a rooftop pool about 1.2m deep. 3 mins walk to Causeway Bay Sogo, 10 mins to Times Square. Ding Tai Fung eatery is right below and McDonald nearby. There is a local wet market and Jardine Bazaar stone's throw away. Many local eateries there for porridge, noodle, HK cafe types, dim sum, etc. During one of the nights, we go across the street fo watch movie. The hotel provides free shuttle with own coach to airport but you have to book beforehand. Would like to stay there again during next visit.

date: Leslie F wrote a review May 2018
review_content: My wife and I spent a wonderful 8 days at this hotel and can't thank the staff enough for their kindness. We recommend the Executive Level, Floors 31-34 and the views from the rooms and the restaurant are excellent. There is a lovely swimming pool available to all guests on the top floor, again with magnificent views. This is the second time we have stayed here and the location is just ideal, being right outside the tram and bus stops to travel easily on Hong Kong's amazing public transport system to anywhere on the island or further afield to Kowloon and the New Territories. We always buy our Octopus Card as soon as we arrive and enjoy travelling effortlessly. We would particularly like to thank Becky, Canby,Bonny and Cherry for looking after us so well.

review_title: An average hotel in a convenient location
review_content: The location can't be beat. The Regal Hong Kong Hotel sits in Causeway Bay and within close walking distance to the MTR (subway) and tram stations. It's proximity to SOGO is a huge plus for shoppers and foodies like myself. That said, the hotel is quite standard and starting to show its age. While the room itself was clean and a good size compared to other newer hotels, the bed was a tad too firm for my taste and barely acceptable. The service was not quite attentive as I'm usually accustomed to but was satisfactory given the price for the room. Overall, this establishment provides basic and clean lodging for travellers on a budget whom do not require too much.

review_content: Very disappointed with this hotel, already booked executive room paid for an extra upgrade to a suite, definitely not worth the extra money. Stated free mini bar yet items removed except for 4 cans of drink and the tiniest packet of nuts. Suite was also on a lower level compared to executive floor room hence more road noise. Executive club lounge served warm champagne, is this to keep their cost down so people wouldn’t drink it? Not to mention the poor cleanliness of the room. Dishonest and misleading!

response_content: Dear Mrs. Anna, Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback on Tripadvisor following your recent stay with us at Regal Hongkong Hotel. While we constantly strive to maintain the highest standards of customer satisfaction, regrettably, on this occasion, we have fallen short of our key objective. I therefore wish to extend to you my sincere apologies. Regarding the mini bar items setup which is our hotel standard. I would like to assure you that I have personally addressed the issue of the service from the Executive club lounge and will ensure that they receive the necessary guidance to perform a much better service improvement to avoid recurrences. It has been a great pleasure serving you and we really look forward to your much valued patronage again in the very near future. date: Michelle A wrote a review Apr 2018
review_content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my husband and 2 kids. We were upgraded to a suite which was very spacious and we were very happy with. The hotel was in such a central location and was perfect for buses, trams and mtr transport. It’s right in the heart of Causeway Bay so is perfect for shopping and Victoria Park (which has some lovely playgrounds and walkways). Only downside was the sofa bed which even by HK standards was quite snug for 2 kids. However I’d definitely stay here again.

review_content: The rooms are huge by HK standard. Love the long bay windows which gave us ample space to stack my bag plus shopping. Check in was quick and efficient and the room assigned ticked all the boxes on my request list. We asked for twin beds and and though the bed was side by side there was room for bedside table each. Bathroom have a separate bath and shower area and ample storage places to store my toiletries. Plenty of nice eateries around - turning right about 10 minutes away bring us to the quiet neighbourhood of Tai Hang with nice cafes (even a highly instagramable Hello Kitty cafe) and roof top bars. On the right along Yee Wo road are many good local eateries including a very good claypot rice restaurant and a well known chain of roast meat restaurant. Will definitely stay…

review_title: Some bits great, but not quite the luxury you might expect from a 5* hotel
review_content: Lots of gold around the hotel - everywhere they can put it! Feels a bit dated in style and some of the amenities are a bit run down - bath tap broken for example as well as the rooftop hot tub next to the swimming pool, and bathroom sink. I have been in other 5* hotels in HK that felt they have more. However rooms were big enough size, including a bath and beds were very comfy. Breakfast was decent in nice airy cafe rivoli, service efficient throughout. Surprised at the lack of bar in lobby, or indeed the real lack of an entrance lobby. A nice enough hotel but not the luxury you might expect from 5*, so only just gets 4/5 rating

review_content: I have to express a major complaint concerning my stay this time. When checking in to my first room once the aircon was turned on I noticed a foul and moldy smell coming into the room. I requested and was granted a room change, however again once the aircon was turned on the same foul and moldy smell came into the room. In order to sleep, I had to turn off the aircon, which stopped the smell from flooding into the room but made my sleep uncomfortable due to the room being hot. I suggest you look into this issue. Thank you!

date: David D wrote a review Apr 2018
review_title: Still one of the best hotels on Hong Kong Island
review_content: This is my preferred hotel when in Hong Kong but last year I checked out another hotel to compare. Well - the result was that the Regal is still the best in Causeway Bay. From the registration to check out the staff are fantastic and go that extra "mile" to make your stay as the most comfortable experience as possible. The rooms are spacious and although there are more modern hotels in the area, the rooms at the Regal are very clean and elegant with most amenities available. There's a great breakfast available and of course the surrounding area has a wonderful range restaurants and shops. So in my opinion there's no need to check out other hotels in the area. The Regal has it all.

ROOM: spacious and clean with a large comfortable bed. Looked at so many hotels before booking and unless you pay an absolute fortune, the rooms were all tiny!! No issues with the en-suite and decor. FOOD: only ate in Cafe Rivoli once but it wasn’t great, so we ate out for the rest of our stay. So many wonderful restaurants within walking distance and very reasonably priced, with good service. SHOPPING: all I’ll say is you can shop until you drop for almost anything you can think of! TRANSPORT: easy to walk to restaurants and shops, or hop on and off quaint little trams as you please. When calling housekeeping for an adapter I got told to go to the reception, even though it says in the info-book that you have to contact housekeeping. review_content: 1) Hotel I've got the hotel via corporate rate, hence, the price that I paid is lower than the internet or rack rate. This is still my favourite hotel, for the price paid and the location. The room is spacious and comfortable. There's bathtub and all other amenities. 2) Service Service can be slow as this hotel is always quite pack. I love the airport transfer option from the hotel, although the frequency of airport transfer can be increased. 3) Location Location is really a plus here for shopping lovers. This hotel is less than 5mins walk from causeway bay MTR and Sogo. There's so much around the hotel and it's also easy to flag a cab from the taxi stand in the hotel.

review_title: 3 night stop over, dated but pleasant enough
review_content: We stayed at the Regal Causeway Bay in December as a 3 night stop over between Australia and the UK. After reading the reviews in the run up to our stay we were prepared to be instantly transported back to the mid 1980's in relation to the decor, if you are in to the likes of Liberace and Dynasty then the interior here will be right up your street. The room we had was covered in mirrors, you certainly never lack somewhere to check your hair! The room was clean and comfortable enough, TV channels are limited for a major international city hotel, but you are there to explore really and not sit watching TV. The toilet was clean although water pressure not the best. You could even have Christmas music played in the bathroom with the flick of a switch which amused our son for a…

With that said, I actually found the hotel to be very pleasant with service fit for royalty. The front desk is pleasant and efficient, the concierge is polite and incredibly helpful with directions and suggestions, and the bellhops even came scrambling out when they saw us struggling up the sidewalk with our stroller. review_content: I like the location where you can find good shops and restaurants just few steps away. Close to SOGO, Time Square, Lee Garden, and even street market. Very helpful concierge staff for direction and they have maps readily available to share. Very convenient if you want to go to Hong Hum station, just take bus 116 or 108, it takes 3 stops and you get off after the bus crosses the tunnel. The hotel room is expensive but worth it for the location and the big room.

Great value!

review_content: The Regal Hotel in Causeway Bay is handily located with shopping centres everywhere. The hotel is quite old with a very small reception area and no actual room to store luggage even though they will hold it for you. Rooms are adequate and they have furnished them quite well. Staff are excellent and very willing to please. If you really prefer the newer hotel, this one may not be for you. But if you are looking for somewhere well located to lay your head, then this is for you.

review_title: If you are coming to Hong Kong find another hotel
review_content: Where do I start? As I am typing I can smell cigarette smoke leeching through the ac system into my room even though I am on a non smoking floor. It appears people think that smoking in the bathroom is OK. This happens on a daily basis. The aircon has a life of its own. Secondly, and this may just be a cultural thing, guests shout all the time to be heard but because the room are not adequately sound proofed and the doors to the halls are certainly not sound proofed you are awoken frequently as drunk revellers return from whatever they are doing.If you must stay here bring ear plugs. This morning I woke up to no hot water, no note under the door rather I had to phone down to find out what was happening. Five hours later I was offered a temporary room to shower, The water in…

Room is of decent size with queen bed, window seat and desk chair. Bedding is too soft, obviously well worn. Noise from adjacent rooms and lobby can be easily heard but insulation was good from outside traffic noises.Bathroom had corner bath and separate shower. First time using the shower, the tap handle flew off, had to control water flow so managed to put it back on with great difficulty. date: Jackson J wrote a review Oct 2017
review_content: I stayed here for a few days. The room is big and there is music in the bathroom. the location is also good. just next door there are 2 michelin star restaurant (fu xing and din tai fung) and they are really good. Not so far there several other michelin or recommended Michelin stars restaurant such as ramen jo (which is SUPERB). There is a supermarket nearby, malls around the hotel and there is a direct bus to the airport too I believe (I took the MTR though which is also walkable). In my 2 weeks trip in HK-MACAO-China, they actually let me left some of my luggages in the hotel for a max 7 days (longer than that there is a daily small charge), which makes my trips a lot more convenient since I have to boat / fly around.

review_content: Very well placed hotel. Metro station is near, Times Square is in a close vicinity, it even takes about 20 minutes to walk leisurely to the bay quay. Excellent lobby with huge (3 stores?) ceiling, columns and glass facade. Breakfast is diverse, with some touches of Indian, Chinese, Japanese and Western cuisine. The rooms are spacious, looking even bigger because of lots of decorative mirrors. Beds are strong-resilient; much better for my tired back than soft ones. Complimentary tea is tasty, especially the pu-erh one. I'd like to have more electric outlets in the room, but I had a multi switch socket with me, so it was all right. Receptionists and door keepers are extremely helpful and welcoming.

review_content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel and I was pleased with the overall experience. Upon arrival at the hotel, I was ushered up to the 31st floor where the club reception was located. The check-in process was quick and efficient and the receptionist was very friendly. My room was very neat and clean, although the decor did seem somewhat dated. The breakfast buffet had a diverse selection including western and Chinese options and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There is also a cocktail lounge where complimentary beverages and snacks were provided to club guests. Overall, my stay was very pleasant and I would have no hesitation in selecting this hotel again for future visits to Hong Kong.

On the upside: great location for shopping/ escaping from the unseasonable humidity/heat, nice rooftop pool and handy gym (although located in the basement, so no windows), huge bed and room and invigorating shower pressure. On the downside: strange smell in the corridor of level 20 (we suspected some sort of mould problem, there was a machine working overtime and the room itself didn't have any smell issues) and generic toiletries. Overall, worth considering if you can find a good deal!

Food, both at the main breakfast room and executive lounge is sub standard. One would expect much better from this hotel. One positive, available shuttle to and from the airport that is very far.

review_title: Not the best place to stay
review_content: I was disappointed with my family's stay in Regal Hongkong Hotel. We booked for four nights, but stayed only for 1 night because of the typhoon which was going to hit it on the day of our flight back home so my husband and I decided to forego our stay. We only stayed for a total of 18 hours. In our stays at many hotels in other countries, they try to make your stay special, if not convenient, but not in this hotel. The food in their executive lounge was so-so and not much choices. We also had to pay for the printing of our new plane tickets. The free bus service to the airport was every two hours so we weren't able to avail that. There was only one person that stood out. It was our bellman. He spoke very good English and he was friendly and helpful. I wish I remembered…

review_title: Above average hotel in Causeway Bay
review_content: The Regal Hong Kong turned out to be a wise choice. We had received various recommendations about locations to stay in HK but am glad we settled on Causeway Bay. The Regal is clean and well appointed and our deal of 2+ nights upgraded us to a Deluxe room on level 25 which was very quiet. The free shuttle bus to the airport was also a bonus. The staff are polite but fall just short of providing friendly service. Plenty of shopping and eating options in the area - also has the feeling of old Hong Kong and not ultra touristy.

date: Stephanie M wrote a review Aug 2017
review_content: Good location hotel. Ask to be on one of the HIGH floors i.e. higher than 25 floors otherwise you look out onto tatty buildings. The hotel is a good old style 4* property. No new frills or additions. Needs updating but is solid for what it is. Decent breakfast at an extra cost but worth while to get you going for the day and a good selection. The bedroom was pretty spacious for Hong Kong as I was sharing with my 2 young daughters. Wifi worked well. The swimming pool on the 34th floor was delightful and we would make good use of it every evening after a day out in the city! It is a worthwhile hotel if you can get a good accommodation rate. I would stay there again if I got a decent rate but I would 'shop around' for rates in the area. I am glad I selected this hotel as opposed to…

review_title: Value for money and nice staff
review_content: The Regal is probably not the best location in Hong Kong and the hotel harks back a little to old Hong Kong, but the staff try hard and the service is very good. I missed the airport limo transfer due to delays at the airport but the management were super kind and upgraded me to the executive floor for the inconvenience, making me feel very special. The rooms and general decor at the hotel are very nice if a little 'tired', (the place has hardly changed in the last 7 years, but everything works. Its position in Causeway Bay means you can feel a little disconnected, especially from Central, and taxis can take a while to pass by but then getting round HK is fairly easy. On the other hand if you want to feel the bustle of HK you'll get it here! Breakfast on level 1 is ok too with…

review_content: Having watched the famous TV series Dynasty (in the late 1980s), upon my entrance to the Regal hotel I was immediately transfered to the Carringtons villa! :-) Seriously, the hotel may be a bit dated in style, but the sense of luxury is still there, and the value-for-money is excellent. The hotel lobby is in full marble, with high ceilings, brass fittings, frescos, and life-sized marble statues. Rooms are very spacious and luxuriously furbished with marble and oil paintings. The breakfast spread is very rich and diverse (English/European/Asian/Indian). Everything is very clean, sleep quality is excellent (we were at the 15th floor with a wonderful view of the harbour). The rooftop pool (at the 34th floor) is the icing on the cake. The location of the hotel is another big plus…

Shower over the bath with no ventilation in bathrooms so mirrors steam up and you need to dry yourself shave etc in the main bedroom. Breakfasts are $512 for 2 people here which gets a below normal breakfast with a good selection but eggs not cooked and hygiene questionable with in particular cold meet items smelling bad enough not to risk it. Location is good and while the actual hotel restaurants did not appeal there is a Michelin star restaurant in the same building which is very good. In…

review_title: A nice hotel at a good location, offering really good service
review_content: One may argue whether it is better to stay on Hong Kong Island or in Kowloon. If the choice is for the former, the Regal hotel location is simply great. The hotel is nicely decorated. We particularly loved the classical mix of marble, wood, and bronze. Hotel service is second to none. The reception, housekeeping, and the concierge went out of their wat to assist whenever needed. Hotel management too was attentive, and when we shared with then that our room had no sufficient storage facilities for the long duration (8 days) of our stay, we were offered a better-suited room. There is a very good restaurant on the top floor of the building (Alto88). It is not where breakfast is served and we tried it once for dinner. The food was very good (say 8 out of 10) but the price…

review_title: Pathetic hotel to say the least!!!!!!
review_content: We landed into hongkong on 26/6 and reached the hotel at about 1230pm and the line to checkin at the hotel was huge i.e. a 30 minutes wait. Our booking for the hotel specifically said two queen size beds and because of the miscommunication between booking.com and the hotel we had to bear the brunt of paying extra at the time of checkout. We were also very very clearly told by a man at the reception by the name of Ceaser that wifi was free for two devices.  With regards to wifi we had with us one Android phone, one iphone and one ipad. Our assumption was that when we needed to login to more than the two devices that we were already logged into we would disconnect one and connect the other device. Again at the time of checkout, we were told to pay 800hk dollars for extra usage…

review_content: Regal Hong Kong Hotel is nicely located in the busiest Causeway Bay area, with lots of restaurants, shopping and most importantly you can blend in with the locals and experience their way of living. 50m from the hotel there is the tram stop which will take you either to Central or North Point. Hotel is 34 storey high with roof-top swimming pool, friendly staff and always welcome to help. I was lucky to stay in the executive room on the 33rd floor and the view there was amazing, although it's not facing the Victoria harbour but I have the mountain view which will definitely take your breath away, especially with the mountain mist early in the morning. There are on-site restaurants, Chinese, Italian & Fusion cuisine and a coffee shop at the lobby which is perfect for meetings.
