review_content: The hotel is located at Central HK, in a corner st. It is past its grandiose days, what with the vaulted ceiling, magnificent chandelier and Old World design. The front desk staff can converse in English but we had difficulty with the concierge guys. The room is clean and adequately sized for the three of us, 2 twins and a pull out sofa bed. The mattresses feel lumpy and itchy (bed bugs?). Personal care products are available in the T&B. The shower area is tiny because a huge space is occupied by a tub. Regarding breakfast, the same fare is being served everyday. It would have been better if there is a different menu per day. There is a Michelin restaurant on the 30th floor (?), Alto for those who like a very fancy meal. And also a Din Tai Fung on the first floor. The hotel is…

review_content: As others have said the location is very convenient. I particularly appreciated the close vicinity of many varied restaurants. From market cafes to traditional family restaurants to western steak houses, you will not be spoilt for choice in eating. There was a problem during check-in with payment that took over an hour to resolve. Throughout all my frustrations, the staff were patient and helpful. Ok, it might have been helpful to have some more flexibility around the payment options, but the staff were faultless. There is one thing that would have to change before I book again. This is the piped music in the bedrooms. It's only in the bathroom and barely audible, but you need to be able to turn it off. Grrr.

review_title: Great location, staff but beware wifi charges
review_content: Location - great, walking distance of causeway bay MTR station, right next to the tram stop and convenient for the light public buses to Aberdeen, Stanley and the south parts of the island. It is surrounded by shops, restaurants and of course Victoria Park, which if you have kids is brilliant with lot of playgrounds. Rooms - Ours was a large double with good views of the city, bath tub decent size, bed excellent and room spacious. Couldnt be faulted. staff - excellent from top to bottom. Leisure facilities - Gym was decent size in the basement and the rooftop pool was excellent if a little short to do any serious exertion. The staff up there were brilliant too. Slight issues - Wifi is limited to two devices per room during your stay but if you have two adults logging in on…

date: Richard T wrote a review May 2017
review_content: This is a upscale hotel with attention to details and great service. Clean, comfortable and with good views. Good housekeeping who check our "key" when we returned and they were in the room. Minor issues follow, but we would certainly return. Limit of four devices on Internet even for a room with three people. All but four chairs on the ground floor are for the lounge and carry minimum cost for use. This is frustrating when people are checking out and waiting for rides when the lounge is closed so there are dozens of empty chairs but guests must stand or sit on the floor. Not easy to iron since I could find only one available wall socket. I am always irritated by TVs locked down so I can't connect my iPad or laptop.

review_content: The Regal Hong Kong is quite attractive in an art deco style. However, the room smelled a little musty, there was some mould around the shower, and the air conditioning was noisy. In general the 'deluxe' room could have done with a refresh. That being said, it was comfortable enough. Breakfast was expensive, but a wide choice was available. Staff were pleasant. There is a nice rooftop pool, and the hotel is in a good location, close to some major shopping opportunities and to the MTR. The hotel says it has free wifi, but this is limited to two devices (a fact not stated anywhere obvious) and you can't change devices for 24 hours. An extra two devices costs HK130 for 24 hours. I think this is unacceptable in this day and age - the cheapest B&Bs in the UK now generally offer…

It is a very short walk to the Hong Kong Stadium so is an excellent location for the HK 7's.

review_content: I stayed this hotel from 13 April until 20 April 2017. I really surprise you call this 5 star. Lets we review regarding house keeping, they don't change your bed sheet every day. they change it every other day! Why do I know? because when I slept I always left blood stain near the head or pillow. when we come back during evening the blood stained still their. There is one time we were go in the morning and come back during noon time. When we entered the room, very surprising the bed already clean but the rest of the room they haven't clean it at all. The hotel is elegant but felt aged.

We stayed in Excelsior when we came to Hong Kong last month. So we can really compare the service and the rooms. To be honest, we are really pleased and appreciate that the manager, Dickson has arranged an early check-in for me when I wrote in to inform him just one day arriving Hong Kong that we will be reaching very early. Upon arrival, the check-in was fast and we were told that there will be complimentary international buffet breakfast for us during our stay. That was a pleasant surprise. Although there was a little hiccup for our first room, the shower room was choked, the issue was quickly resolved…

The staff at Regal river side are not trained well and do not know the meaning of hospitality. This hotel is probably 30-40y old and is screaming for renovation. The ceiling in the reception lobby is falling apart. I felt like i have entered North korea after staying here as the staff also work like robots and do not listen to anything that you say. Requested for extra water and the front desk were up for a war. Good things are, if you get room on the front side the views are good and room that we stayed in was decent. With rest of the things try your luck as we will not recommend this hotel to any one. Regards Best of Luck

review_content: Me and my partner spent our Easter holiday in Hongkong, our third time in the city. Before, we have stayed in Mongkok and Central. This time, we wanted to try Causewaybay. So we decided to try Regal Hongkong Hotel. When we did the booking, we noticed the advantages of the executive rooms and booked it. We really enjoyed the excecutive services, for example the breakfast in Alto88 with great panoramic views, the evening drinks/snacks in the lounge, but foremost the great, warm and friendly service of the executive floor staff. They very always so helpful. The rooms are big and fully equipped with the amenities you need. Some interior details could need an upgrade. Overall the hotel facilities are very good. The roof top pool on the 35th floor is great for relaxing a sunny day. We…

review_title: Stayed here during the Hong Kong Sevens event
review_content: The best thing about this hotel is location, location, location, especially if you are visiting for the HK Rugby 7s as it is in easy walking distance to the stadium. Positive: generous buffet breakfast, free shuttle to the airport (if included in the room rate), large bath tubs for soaking after a long day. Negative: badly needs electrical upgrading. No sockets near the bed for chargers for phones. No USB sockets. Slowest elevators in the world (or so it seems). Lobby wait staff struggled with orders in English. Expensive for what you get - you pay for location.

date: Evi Y wrote a review Apr 2017
review_content: We stayed just for one night , and the hotel was choosen because the location is in Causeway Bay. The hotel located near Sogo, just a few minutes walk. The room just oke, a bit old. If you plan to shop a lot in Causeway bay, I recommend this hotel to stay. So you can come back to hotel to put your things and shop again. And they also have free shuttle to Hongkong Central Station, every 20mnts. So you can save around 65hkd if you use taxi. And from Hongkong Central Station you can buy mrt ticket to airport (100hkd) , city check in, check in your luggage, and go directly to airport without any large luggage.

review_content: The Regal Hongkong Hotel's location was perfect for me as it was close to everything. There's a tram station right across. The Causeway Bay MTR station is a 3 minute walk away. Sogo, Timesquare, Hysan Place and many other shopping malls and areas are all within walking distance. There is a Din Tai Fung at the ground floor of the hotel. The free shuttle bus from Hongkong Station (H3) stops at this hotel. The shuttle also stops here if you wish to go back to Hongkong Station (usually 30-minute intervals). The hotel was grand but dated. The lobby was always very busy. This is probably one of the most popular hotels back in the day. The staff were friendly. The deluxe room was bigger than a typical Hongkong deluxe room. Our room was clean and I was satisfied. I'm not a fan of…

It is a mere 5 mins walking distance and is home to many designer branded flagship stores (Cartier, Chanel, LV etc.) It also has very convenient links to public transport. The hotel is also a stop on the shuttle bus service from HK International Airport. With regards to the hotel facilities, the rooms are very outdated. While everything was functional and clean, it was apparent that nothing had been updated for 10+ years. This having been said, the rooms were very large - in comparison to most city hotels. The views from the roof were amazing, while the pool facility itself was very bare and minimalist,…

Price is very reasonable and at the executive rooms ie level 32 and above, some rooms have sea view and the moment you step into the room you would definitely feel like a king. Although many locals have told me that it's very old but now I understand they don't mean it's not maintained and run down, they just mean it's one of the oldest HK hotel for many many years. One downside is the breakfast, to me it's not up to standard but breakfast can be found easily outside of the hotel. So if you have an option to include breakfast in your stay or not, I suppose you can just skip it and explore the local breakfast out there.…

They also have a stop at the hotel for the airport express shuttle bus. Check-in took over 10 mins. It was the slowest check in i have experienced anywhere. DESCRIPTION OF WHAT WE DID: We took a deluxe room with breakfast. The breakfast was quite worth it. They do charge extra for late check out but they gave us 1 hour free which we didn't end up using. But you can keep you bags after checking out. GOOD: Location Room Package BAD: Check-in

Hotel looks very lavish on the outside making a good impression, the interior reception area, huge, very cold with air conditioning and no bar area, helpful front of house staff, but mainly Asian clients and not quite up to Western standards. Room was small, completely over the top in its decor, TV incased in a mirror frame, in fact, mirrors everywhere. Shabby, needs updating. Good shower. Very busy street area, noisy traffic,we were on the 23rd floor, but quiet in the hotel from 11PM and although our room was near the lifts, we were not disturbed too much. Clean comfortable beds.

At no time during my five days in the hotel did I see a Manager come into the "supposed" club floor.... staff did their best but this is not the experience I expect from a hotel that claims to be 5 star. Room was dated and despite assurances that heat would be turned on ( it was cold even for Hong Kong and I lived there for several years) , it was not. date: Joyce Ho wrote a review Jan 2017
review_content: Stayed for 3 nights. Hotel is quite old but reasonably clean. Size of room is acceptable, at least I can open 2 luggage. Charging sockets are already fitted with international adaptors which I love! Breakfast is not included but there are plenty of eateries nearby like Tsui Wah. Hotel is only 5 mins walk from Causeway Bay station so I took a train from the airport upon arrival. One thing to note: when changing trains from Hong Kong station to Central station, take only the extreme left elevator at the platform. It's much easier as you'll be walking underground throughout. Sogo and Times Square are also within walking distance.

Likewise, you can take those shuttle buses (one in every 20min) from the hotel to the HK station when you leave for the airport. b) Location:The hotel is a 10min walk to the Causeway Bay MTR, but be prepared to battle the eternally heavy human traffic in this area. review_content: A nice hotel in a great location. However a funny quirks, there is no lobby seating, only a paid lounge, that is funny. The Fridge was locked and when I asked for it to be opened, the cleaning lady brought a plastic bag and cleared out all the drinks from the fridge and inspite of me trying in English to tell her to leave them , she did not understand and took all the drinks away. A nice breakfast spread. Language is definitely an issue as everybody does not understand English.

date: Lisa L wrote a review Dec 2016
review_content: We enjoyed our stay at this Regal, Causeway Bay. MTR, Tram bus service and major shopping centers are within walking distance. "Ding Tai Fung" the popular dumplings restaurant is just next door. The room is big for Hongkong standard - well kept and clean. The hotel is well organized for bad weather. We were there on the day when Typhoon 8 happened. The day before we received circulars from the hotel with the Dos and Don'ts. We also received "Emergency Room Service Menu". As we have not experienced Typhoon, we felt safe and comfortable knowing that the hotel is well prepared and care for their guests. We would like to thank the hotel and the staff for their care

review_title: Fantastic Service, clean and top notch!
review_content: I stayed here for 4 nights and they were the best 4 nights stay I have had anywhere. The location of the hotel is brilliant. You are located right next to one of the many shopping districts that Hong Kong offers. The Rooftop Pool is exactly what you need after a full day of shopping too! I did the hop on hop off bus tour in Hong Kong and the stop is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. I was checking out to fly home on a really wet day. I was able to store my baggage at reception and they offered me access to their gym facilities to change from my wet clothes into dry ones for my trip. My car got delayed due to the weather so they prepaid a cab to take me straight to the airport so I would not miss my flight. As I said, unbelievable service and would recommend if anyone is…

The services and amenities at the hotel were efficient and good. The restaurant/cafe serves a very decent spread of breakfast in the morning and prices reasonable. review_title: Lots of space, helpful staff, central location, wish there was a bar
review_content: I have been here a few times now, and find this hotel very convenient for business trips. The most recent time I was on 27th floor; the room and bathroom were both a good size, bathroom with a big corner bath as well as shower, and AC/lighting etc were flexible and effective (all controlled from a bedside unit). I had breakfast included: it's a very extensive international buffet and well worth it if you are a big eater! The hotel has an airport shuttle bus which works just fine but it is not a 24-hour service. Takes about 45 minutes. One drawback of this hotel is the lack of a bar. There is a sort of coffee shop downstairs but this is closed in the evening. For eating, there is the big buffet which is about HK$500 for an evening meal (again, good value if you are a big eater).…

A 5 minute walk from the Causeway Bay MTR station, and a tram stop is directly outside the back entrance. Staff were very helpful, spoke good English and responded quickly to adhoc requests. Pricewise; a 3-star fee for a 5-star room, definitely worth it, would definitely stay again.

review_content: Stayed there in August. My first mistake was I agreed with the receptionist with a free upgrade to a smoking room on a higher floor, lesson learn, never opt for a smoking room, it really smells bad. Nothing much to say about Regal, 3 star hotel, badly in need of maintenance, I took some pictures but decided not to have it published, it was just not right to do it. The room walls, furniture, carpet, are in bad shape and needs to be maintained. Amenities are average, room size is small, taxis are so hard to get, so if you are leaving for office and airport, do it early. Stay at Regal at your own risk. My advice, pay a little bit more and stayed at some better ones.

Lounge had decent pastries and drinks, while the breakfast was above average, though i would prefer if the selections were changed daily (i had the same sausages, bacon, hash brown, porridge for 2 days running). Rooms were clean and comfortable and i particularly loved the choices of pillows. Room deco was a little peculiar though with mirrors front, back ad sides (being a chinese, it's a superstition to have a mirror facing in front of the bed). It does however make the, otherwise small room look larger! Areas to improve would be TV channel…

date: John P wrote a review Oct 2016
review_content: The degree to which a hotel anticipates and is responsive to a client's needs is a decisive factor in predisposing the client to return. The Regal is very good in this respect and I shall indeed be returning there next year. In fact, this is almost two hotels in one. The lower floors are occupied by a large number of tourist groups, often but not exclusively from the mainland: the top floors above level 31 are the Exec Club area and this is where I stayed for ten days. It is very well run. Rooms are ornately and comfortably furnished. Views on the harbour side (x06 - x11) are wonderful. The Club Room is small, but a pleasure to use, either for a hot drink, a snack or, from six to eight p.m. for cocktails and small chow - all provided as part of the package. Breakfast is taken on…

review_content: My wife and I left Hong Kong last night after a truly memorable first visit to this vibrant and interesting place. Our visit was made all the more memorable thanks to the staff at the Regal Hong Kong but specifically to the receptionists on level 31 at the executive welcome check in. The staff we interfaced with were extremely helpful in providing us with really pertinent information on how we could get about the city in a way that maximised our time effectively. On the day of our departure we were provided with a late check out facility and arranged for transfer to the airport in time to catch our flight to Sydney in the evening. Always courteous and friendly we could not have asked for more. The room we had enjoyed fantastic views from the 34th floor and was kept very clean…

date: andy p wrote a review Sep 2016
review_content: The hotel is quite well located and the rooms are a good size for Hong Kong and the staff are helpful. However, this not a 5 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination and nowhere in the hotel does it suggest that it is. The rating used is either self rated or the rating has been given by the chinese government, definitely not from a recognised body. The hotel lobby is actually quite dirty and the rooms are very dated and need of renovation. The main problem is the price. You could actually book a good quality 5 star hotel for the same price. This hotel at best would scrape 4 stars. In short, it's a rip off.

review_content: I visited Hong Kong, particularly at Causeway Bay, on a business trip. I must say this is one of the practical hotel around the Causeway Bay. The hotel looks like it's been on service for so long, judging by its design and utilities. Clean rooms and good service from staff. They got a shuttle that'll take you to the airport every hour. The only reason as to not giving this hotel a 5-star rating is because it is really difficult to get a taxi from this location. And if you are in a hurry to get to airport, like I was, you couldn't wait for an hour to take the shuttle bus. I had to find the nearby metro to get to airport.

review_content: We were very disappointed with the Regal HongKong Hotel. Our experience was much like LeyburnSteve's. The sewage smell by the taxi rank remains a problem with the smell filtering back into the Hotel reception. Again the rooftop pool was closed for maintenance for the first few days. The rooms are tired with for example the shower tap in our bathroom falling off and not being able to re-fixed. Despite there being a large foyer, the area is sub-let to a cafe thus leaving no seats for hotel guests to use whilst waiting for fellow guests or transport. Lastly the food served by said cafe was stale. Even in the Hotel's dining area, we needed to take 10 butter containers in order to find 2 that were not stale.

date: Michael B wrote a review Aug 2016
review_content: Booked in for a day while we stopped over and had a 15hr wait for our next flight. Check in was fine. We got to our room and it wa a pigsty! Obviously have forgotten to clean, but it had disgusting, unhygienic things in there - amazing how some people leave hotel rooms. After some words with reception, they upgraded us to a suite. The suite was big, clean and tidy. Fairly modern as well. We ate in hotel as well. Buffet was excellent but a little expensive. Gym and spa facilities are great as well. Got off to a shaky start but overall was a pleasant experience. All staff was very friendly, polite and helpful. Its a pity about their initial mistake. Would stay again if we were stopping in HK.

Please do not hesitate to let me know your plan of return, letting us well prepare your upcoming visit with more pleasant experience again. Yours sincerely, Dick Wong rhk.dofo@regalhotel.com

review_content: Have lived in and visited Hong Kong many times and thought I would stay here due to the location in Causeway Bay. Hotel looks good but when you stay six days you realise it is getting very tired and the decor is rather garish with too many mirrors, gold and some pretty aweful paintings all over the place. There was also a pretty bad sewage smell by the taxi rank which filtered back in to the lobby for our complete stay. First day we were there we got a letter saying the rooftop pool was out of action until further notice which was very disappointing.

review_title: Staying in Hong Kong with Regal
review_content: Very good accommodation even if in the single standard room. Clean, organized and a very good bed. Every single collaborator always able to help with good tips about where to go, where to eat, how to go, etc.. Room service very good but could have more options in the menu. Breakfast complete and wonderful, but also could be cheaper. However, if comparing to the average of the city, it is fair. Well located and easy to go out by feet, train or bus. In general, a very good place to stay.

review_title: Average Hotel with a good location
review_content: Check in Lobby - small & crowded with not much space to stand around Hotel Design - outdated Room - we had an adjoining room arrangement. Although a non smoking room but 1 of the 2 rooms was filled with cigarette smell. Hotel staff said it was room fragrance!!?? It was obviously cigarette smell! But they did put in an air purifier & the smell was gone after we came back from an outing. Door knobs were oxidised. Need upgrades. Room amenities - adequate but housekeeping did not refill sugar sticks. Coffee in room was too sour to drink. Location - near Sogo as well as shopping areas like Hysan Place. Also near to MTR station - Causeway Bay.

review_content: The hotel is quiet expensive but good. The stayed in the 25th floor. The room is spacious with a nice view. Bottled water for 4 is free everyday. The king size bed is so big that it can surely accommodate 3 persons or maybe 4. The breakfast is good with a lot of choices. There was even a chef that will make omelett or noodle soup for you. The subway is just a walk away. Free shuttle bus to the airport but the waiting time is long. We need to wait more than an hour for our shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. If you love shopping then this hotel suits you. There are lots of shopping centers in the area. The only thing I think is not good in this hotel is that there is no place to sit in the lobby. You just have to stand while waiting for your room to be ready during check…

review_content: It was very difficult booking a connecting room in Hong Kong as I was travelling with my family and I found Regal Hotel!! So a big plus already. Regal is located just a couple of minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Causeway Bay. So location is definitely 5 stars. It is a hotel I think so the lobby is quite small and the lifts take some time, but I really appreciate the efficiency and hospitality of the front desk staff and the cleaning lady on our floor who never fails to greet us with a smile. Also, the rooms are huge for Hong Kong standards. Pity I was travelling with my family so I did not have the chance to check out the gym. But I really think this is value for money and location is very very good (Airport Express bus stops here). Definitely will consider coming back…

They came back quite late (passed mid night) and they closed the doors very loud without considering others. Besides, there seems to be no noise reduction installed and whatever they said, you could hear...

date: Cassius T wrote a review Jul 2016
review_content: Spent two weeks at the regal. A very grand foyer with banking staircases rise up to the restaurant or down to the hotel banqueting suites. Don't spend too long lounging in the many sofas or you will catch a chill from the fridge like air con. Hotel rooms are a little 80s with grand expanses of glass and mirror. A console of buttons gives you ability to adjust lighting and air con. A switch by the bathroom gives you option of music whilst you sit on the loo 😀 Large screen TVs offer an odd selection of tv channels with options to watch films etc but it's a little clunky and eventually the lack of availability generally means switching off. But then there is more to see outside so why would you anyway. A reasonable sized pool on the roof offers time for a spot of bathing and…

review_title: July 11 for 4 nights. 1st time stayed, wonderful
review_content: Have been staying in 5s hotel in causeway bay area few times before. Regal hongkong is most competitive in price. Location is excellent. Just 3mnts walk to shopping area like fashion walk and mtr station, a few walks later to sogo or windsor. A few more walks to hysan place and times square mall. Many cheap good food near hotel also like nam kee or wing kee if mcd is not your preference. You can shop for supplies in the indonesian supermarket across the street or 7/11 on the other way Room is big for hkg std. Clean every day. Amenities and bottled water filled every day. The bathroom although rather small but complete and very clean. The tap water and shower is the best part. Service also excellent. Staffs i met speaks english very well and understand very well. Their…

review_title: Nice room, Warm hospitality and Very Good service
review_content: We were well treated since airport pick up @hotel desk at arrival hall. Escorted to Regal Airport Hotel to take airport shuttle and driven to Regal Hotel Causeway Bay, after a few minutes stop at Regal Kowloon. Check-in process was so efficient and room was quickly arranged as request at the front desk. I was a bit worried considering this hotel is pretty old, but surprisingly, room was still in very good condition (last time visited was 4 years ago or so). Beds and sheets were very clean, bathroom was well maintained. No smell at all. In the morning I visited the gym in B3 level. The equipment were just adequate, but who would pay attention? All staff was very helpful and warm hearted. I will come back for sure...

What I WASN'T told that I had to pre-book for the entire duration - I had a stay of 6 nights; it is unreasonable to expect one to have to pre-book for the entire duration. Some level of discretion from the front desk would have been helpful. Otherwise room was comfortable, except for the poor maintenance level of some of the furniture.

My friends arrived first and did all the check-in for the group on Friday 17 June afternoon. Somehow, the hotel front desk staff did not ask for a credit card guarantee. None of us was aware. Saturday late night, at 11 pm., I got a call from the front desk, Mr.Nathan, indicating that they made a mistake by not asking for the credit card guarantee upon check-in. And asked me to come down to pay for the one triple room RIGHT AWAY. Yes, at…

If you are looking for accommodation around that area then you will probably consider this hotel. That being said, this is definitely not a 5 star hotel (despite what they claim), so if you are wanting that, I suggest looking elsewhere. HK is really easy to get around using the MTR so no need to stay in one particular area. The check in process was average, not overly friendly or helpful. There was luggage lining the walls all around the check in area like a hostel. The room is ok, decent enough but old and not clean. The bathroom was mouldy in the shower and the carpet was filthy - we wore shoes inside the whole time to avoid the dust sticking to our feet. There is a…

Low points were main hotel areas ... Service at reception was slow, left luggage pre/it's check in meant all suitcase stacked up I reception as no left luggage room. There is no real bar to speak off (there is a lounge - but if you order a drink, you'll be the only one!) but the restaurant is not too bad for breakfast. Oh - and if you like mirrors, you'll love this place - every bedroom is decked out with so many, you feel like you are in the Hall of Mirrors in Versailles!

We had a clubroom reserved do to some benefits such as access to the lounge. I'll realise now it was a mistake, more about that later. We were directed to the club floor reception on the 31st floor, and was gladly welcomed of the kind club houstest. We were lucky to have a room direct, it was a smoking room, I'll had a booking for non smoking, but it was ok one of us is a smoker. The club room are quite spacious, and high to the sealing, walls decorated with gold and mirrors, the furniture are old? and dirty so are the carpet. When I'll sat down on the bed side it flipped…

review_content: The location in the heart of Causeway Bay (5 min walk from MRT station) is perfect for both sightseeing and shopping base. The rooms are HUGE for Hong Kong standards. All the basic utilities are in place, including kettle and free water and free newspaper each morning. The breakfast is tasty and includes a selection of Chinese, Japanese and Western style dishes. The room is clean, bright and full of mirrors, which makes it even bigger than it already is. You can even be spared from blocking money on your credit card: just refuse to use the payed services when checking in, and the fridge in your room will be locked, and the TV will be switched off, -- that's all.

review_content: We were Hong Kong First-Timers, travelling as a family of four. We were immediately drawn to this hotel as it promoted inter-connecting rooms, and given the frequent comments about room-size in HK hotels thought that an inter-connecting door would help if the rooms were a little pokey. As it was, we need not have worried. Both rooms were generously sized, clean and quiet. We tried the pool at night - 32 floors up seeing the neon of Hong Kong was pretty spectacular, and compensated for the less than warm pool water. The breakfast ran until 10.30am and was a relaxed buffet affair with plenty of choice. As a location, we preferred Hong Kong Island to Kowloon ( we returned to Hong Kong a couple of days after leaving this hotel) even if it is slightly further from the airport. The…

There is NO waiting area for guests (we visited in march, so no xmas or easter display) i now have photo proof that there is none. The location of the hotel is ideal and strategically situated near the MTR / causeway bay shopping area and loads of good eateries. The service of the hotel is simple but provides essential needs. date: Alex Si wrote a review Mar 2016
review_title: Regal Hotel HK in Causeway Bay -- conveniently located near restaurants, shops, tram stop
review_content: The Regal Hotel Hong Kong in Causeway Bay is conveniently located near many fine restaurants, shopping areas, tram stop. Ding Tai Fung, a restaurant with branches in many South East Asian countries is right beside the hotel. Sogo, a large Japanese department store, is obliquely across the street. Many branded shops selling garments, shoes, bags, etc. are right beside Sogo. The tram stop is almost in front of one of the side entrances of Regal Hotel. The MTR Station is a 10-minute walk away.

review_content: - We picked this hotel because of it's location and we weren't' disappointed. Right in the middle of the action with shopping and restaurants. - it's also easy to get from the airport. You can take the airport express to HK station for 100 HK$. Then free shuttle bus from the HK station to the hotel. It's called shuttle bus H2. - we stayed in a family connected room which many hotels didn't offer. So it's good if you travel with family of 4 or 5. - the Room is fairly spacious - the concierge guy with glasses was really helpful. - the bus in front of the hotel can take you to Repulse Bay, Deep water Bay, and Ocean Park. - the hotel gives free wifi for 2 devices per room. Although i would note: - the hotel looks fairly dated, which i guess that's why the price wasn't so…

date: Christopher B wrote a review Feb 2016
review_content: Centrally located for virtually anything you would want to do in Hong Kong, the Regal is quiet, comfortable and the staff is exceptionally accommodating. The basic rooms, all I ever need, are generous for Hong Kong. Bathroom is clean and well equipped with toiletries. The staff couldn't have been more genial or helpful. Right outside the door is the bustling and trendy Causeway Bay neighborhood, and you're a 5-minute walk to the MTR, which can get you almost anywhere. Plus, cabs are not expensive from most anywhere. Breakfast in the Cafe Rivoli is very good and reflects the international flavor of the clientele. Everything from eggs and bacon to congee and fish. Plus, if you're lucky enough to meet Sandy there, she'll remember you from year to year. Feels like visiting a…

review_content: My booking started out badly - I had booked a shuttle to the hotel. At most airports that I am used to, the shuttles have the name of the hotel destination on them. Not so Hong Kong. So lost an hour's time and missed the shuttle. Transportation in Hong Kong is very good so I got to the Hotel via the transport system. The hotel was very sorry about this and made amends by upgrading me. The room (on one of the executive floors) was impeccable with a magnificent view. The only negative thing was a distinct mildew smell by the entry door / bathroom. The ladies up there treated my family wonderfully and even played with my 1 year old twins so my wife and I could enjoy a well deserved cocktail during happy hour. Long story short, because of the ladies at the concierge level we will absolutely stay here again. A+++ service

review_title: Conveniently Located Hotel with a Great Gym
review_content: Our family of four stayed at the Regal Hongkong in January 2016 and found the accommodation to be acceptable. The fit-out of the rooms is a little dated, but can pass for "old-world" charm with a little imagination. Positives: 1. The basement gym is one of the best hotel gyms I've visited. It has a great selection of weights and cardio equipment, showers, towels and even minor toiletries. 2. The hotel is very conveniently located at the edge of the Causeway Bay shopping area. 3. The housekeeping staff were friendly and were prompt to respond to the issues we had (see below). 4. Free wifi. Negatives: 1. We found the bedding to be a bit flimsy and my wife and I kept rolling into the middle. 2. The cornice and ceiling over the shower cubicle was mouldy when we arrived and…

For some reason, the key cards reset every 24 hours so you'd have to have the front desk do something with the keys before you can re-enter your room on the second / third / fourth day. Breakfast is served in a separate restaurant that is a Italian restaurant at night. The views are superb for breakfast and the food provided is of good quality. The rooms have complimentary drinks including beer, hot beverages and some exotic fruits. The views of the city are good with us normally seeing Victoria Park. Toilets are clean and comfortable. review_content: We paid the extra for the executive rooms and were treated wonderfully. The room was lovely and checking in was so relaxing rather than having to queue up in reception. Breakfast was plentiful and Emilie totally made our stay constantly offering ideas and helping us navigate Hong Kong. Plus I went to the gym which has all equipment you would need but the benefit of no one else being there. Only downside would be that the pool isn't heated, I did try but it was so cold. One for the warmer months, but an incredible view from the rooftop. Ohhh and there isn't a hotel bar, which means once the executive room shuts at 8 you can't drink in the hotel.

review_title: One of the best of the best hotels in Hong Kong
review_content: All round excellence best describes this hotel. Currently the hotel offers an upgrade for a modest fee to their executive floors and what a bargain with free breakfast, drinks and snacks and beautiful rooms with magnificent views over Hong Kong coupled with the excellent personal service of the staff on the 31st floor. A wonderful experience the only problem being you don't want to leave the luxury of the room for the streets of Causeway Bay. The cafe Rivoli and for that special treat Alto 88 offer excellent dining coupled with great personal attention, so thank you for making this a wonderful stay. OH one more the roof top pool is a bit cold in winter but who need a pool when the room had a twin size bath.

review_title: A good hotel, slightly let down by some avoidable failings
review_content: The Regal Hongkong is, on balance, a good hotel, and certainly good value in this expensive city for a short stay. The strongest features of the hotel are the bedrooms, and the staff. The bedrooms are large, comfortably furnished, well equipped and with a good bathroom and shower. My room was fairly newly refurbished and smart. The bed was - for a European - very firm, but this is the Asian style and no doubt reflects the mainly Asian clientele. The only real failing in the room was that the aircon was noisy and not very effective. The staff both at reception and on the concierge desk go out of their way to be helpful and genuinely seemed eager to please. Other plus points are the roof-top swimming pool, which is very acceptable (though not heated and a little brisk for a…

A really irritating automatic, self playing piano in the reception area nearly drove us mad and my wife considered unplugging it, to shut it up. Very useful free bus transfer to and from the airport- we were the only passengers both ways. Nice small, basic rooftop pool but very few seats and only room for about 10 people (although there were only ever one to two people using it) Plenty of restaurants in the area as the hotel seemed VERY costly for what it was. There were a number of disconcerting looks from the same doorman, who disliked the fact my two children were walking between where I was standing (i.e next to our parked luggage) and my husband at check in. I agree that there is a time and place for children to mess about but given it was a very quiet afternoon for the lobby and the check in took about 20mins in total I would be very surprised if any child under 5 could keep still in one place until all the hotel paperwork was done after a 15hr flight! The rooms itself were very large and clean. The bathroom was a good size with both a shower cubicle and a separate corner…

review_title: Still a Great Hotel in a Great Location

review_content: Have been staying at this hotel for many years now and the staff are very friendly. It feels like home away from home. Namely Tiffany, Christy, Iris, Stephen, Miggie, and others. Breakfast at 1/F Regal Café have a good selection of Asian and Western food and service are great. Same as concierge, bell service and housekeeping. They all do their best to make my stay as comfortable as possible which is great with a hectic traveling schedule. Location is excellent as very close to MTR, tram & buses. Hotel is a bit dated but the great service makes it worthwhile.

date: Dan A wrote a review Oct 2015
review_title: A room definitely not worth your money... And worst of all: cockroaches.
review_content: I know hotels in Hong Kong can be pricey, but you can totally get better value for money in town. The hotel is poorly maintained and disappointing on so many levels. The rooms are for sure not designed for business travellers, with only one power socket next to the desk. Internet is very slow and limited to two devices. The bathroom was derelict, with the shower head falling, because it wasn't properly screwed. The toilet paper hanger collapsed too. But my worst surprise was when I discovered a cockroach on the tea kettle stand. From then on, everything just looked and felt dirty. Tip to the management: your propriety is in serious need of refurbishment. Using it as cash-cow because of its location (which is very convenient, must admit this) works only up to a certain point. The…

Check in chap refused to believe that the room was paid even after seen the email that said it was paid so he duly charged my card. 1207 was my room. I was transported to 1970s. The AC barely worked. Old smell in the room. There was a great big silver seventies console that controlled the lights etc. Nothing really worked. review_title: Just started using Regal Hongkong Hotel
review_content: Having stayed at another hotel close by for the past 3-4 years, Regal is a comparable hotel in many ways. Not quite as well located, but the amenities and service compare. On my first visit I was in a normal room, which I had no complaints about, (although maybe the beds are a little too firm!) and this last visit I was booked in to the Executive Floor. This offered a more pleasant experience from check in to check out, including breakfast at Alto88 and access to the Club Lounge. For the price the rooms are spacious and well appointed. I've not had an opportunity to use other facilities such as the pool or gym.

review_content: Billeted here for 3 nights for work and was pleasantly surprised with a Club floor upgrade. Service was excellent from the doormen to the wait staff and the concierge. I appreciate the welcome fruits, the vanity kit from L'Occitane, the nespresso machines, and the turndowm service. I loved the cocktail lounge and the complimentary breakfast spread, which, in my 3 mornings there, did not have more than 5 guests at a time. date: Madame Travel wrote a review Sep 2015
review_title: Sumptuous Luxury you deserve get treated like a Queen here
review_content: Book the luxurious executive suite and receive many privileges to experience the true hospitality and exceptional service of Hong Kong at its very best. Nothing is too much trouble. You will be whisked up to the executive suite teams reception suite and receive complimentary drinks while your personal assigned guest relations manager attends to your every need. The rooms are fantastic and the view from our 33rd floor looking out over Hong Kong Harbour is sensational.! A delicious bottle of wine and fresh fruit were awaiting our arrival, all compliments of the house, recognising our special anniversary . Experience this gorgeous, customer focused hotel for a truly memorable relaxing stay in Hong Kong. You won't regret it or forget it.

date: Cheng L P C wrote a review Sep 2015
review_title: A frequent re-visit in Hong Kong
review_content: I travelled to HK every month, and I have a few selected hotels to suit the different occasions for meetings and leisure, for example. Most of the time, I would stay at the Regal HK for its location, pleasant service, and value for money which include discount for in-house restaurants. The Regal Palace serves pretty good Chinese spread that cater to packed lunch crowd usually. The view at the Italian Alto 88 is good too with a quiet touch in the evening. There are keen competition for tourist $$ in HK, and the hotels varied their rates accordingly. However, I returned to Regal HK most of the times for the many little friendly experiences that I find it a cut above many establishment for that price in the middle of HK island.

date: Nicola F wrote a review Sep 2015
review_content: Found this hotel to be surprisingly good considering what you usually get for your money in Hong Kong. We had a family room, with 2 double beds, which wasn't huge but perfectly fine for the 4 of us for 3 nights. Décor was a little dated, but overall we liked the feel of this hotel. For us, during the August heat, the pool on the roof was the highlight. You get a side on view of central Hong Kong and watching the sunset over the skyline whilst having a swim was amazing. The location is great, with loads of shops and restaurants as soon as you step outside, the tram right on the doorstep and causeway bay tube about a 5 minute walk. we also used taxis which are cheap and plentiful in Hong Kong. Hotel restaurants were a bit pricy for us, but there's a great cake shop in the foyer…

review_content: This hotel is very nice indeed! The staff that I have interacted with were all very professional and friendly. Better yet for me, everyone that helped me out with my stay spoke English! I only know a few Chinese words, enough to get by and be polite. The fact that the staff speaks English definetly places this hotel at the 5 star rating, at least from my perspective. The location of the hotel is next to Victoria Park, lots of shopping and train, trolley and bus service, etc.. Getting to other places in Hong Kong is very easy, especially if you sit down with one of the staff and let them know what you are interested in doing for the day, week or however long the stay. I am here on business and with a map of the Hong Kong area, there is so much to do and see after work is done.…

review_content: The location is excellent, situated near to the various transport services that Hong Kong has to offer; from MTR to trams to buses. On the service side, the staff was friendly and responsive, as expected from a 5 stars hotel. Furthermore, breakfast was provided despite the fact that our reservation from Expedia did not mention about it. Housekeeping was done quickly; by the time we returned from breakfast, the room was tidied. However, the housekeeping team only cleaned the common areas and neglected the obscure corners. date: Cherry G wrote a review Aug 2015
review_title: We always stay here when we travel to Hong Kong
review_content: For a five-star hotel, the price is already reasonable. The location couldn't be better, just 400 meters (about 5-8 minutes) from the Causeway Bay subway station. There are lots of restaurants and shopping malls around. Quite close to Times Square and SOGO too! The lobby always smells nice. It feels like déjà vu every single time. The rooms are always neat and beautiful, though the hotel has been around for quite a while. The bathrooms have bath tubs - great for dips at night after a long day of shopping and pigging out! If you arrive earlier than check-in time, the concierge can safekeep your luggage for you so you can go about and start your day already. I cannot say a bad thing about this hotel.

review_title: Staff attitude contemptuous, management attitude unbelievable !!!
review_content: Myself my husband and two children ( 8 and 16 ) arrived at the Regal at 8pm after a tiring journey. We had booked, along with our friends of two adults and two children (12 and 14), a quadruple room for EACH family for our three night stay. Whilst booking in it became apparent the hotels intention was to place all 8 of us in two rooms. They explained that the adults could share a room with two double beds (side by side) and the 4 children in the interconnecting room which had 2 single beds and a single sofa bed. I'm no mathematician but we were obviously a bed short and even though we are good friends neither of the adults wished to share a bedroom and bathroom for 3 nights!! After well over an hour of heated discussion with the booking in staff and expensive phone calls…

Food and service great, room could have been better - forehead marks on the inside of windows ( twenty something floor, bedside tables sticky with glass marks) Come on room sevice, you can do better thsn this. I can put up with a tired hotel if it is clean and spotless. Good location close to Metro. Good rooftop pool. Disappointed that there was no lounge bar - apart from Exec area and in the lobby. Would have made a great improvement to our visit Overall i would visit again - the positives outweigh the negatives, which is a good thing.

It was also situated in a good location within Causeway Bay. It's very near a lot of shops/malls/restaurants, but not near enough to hear all the craziness. The only CON (aside from the price) would be that one instance where we told the hotel our destination prior to getting a cab. review_content: I chose to stay in this hotel for the convenience since my seminar was held in one of their conference rooms. I enjoyed the gym facility which didn't have much in the way of equipment but found it adequate. There is no bar which, just a lobby which isn't very comfortable to enjoy a drink. The hotel restaurants weren't any better. Stayed here for 6 days where 1 day required a stay in due to a signal 8 storm. They were prepared for this and made it convenient for guests to stay in and just do room service. On a more positive note, location gives you great access to most shops and restaurants and only a 10 min walk to Times Square. Worth mentioning too the 1 Michelin star restaurant is just at the lobby. That was a real treat!

Finding places for shopping and eating in the area is never a problem. Jardine's Bazaar, where lots of restaurants are located, is just next to the hotel, whereas shopping malls like Sogo, Hysan Place and Times Square are located within walking distance also. Staffs are always smiling and polite. The room is relatively big (as for Hong Kong standard, of course), and also the bathtub. Those make the hotel almost perfect. review_content: The hotel is located maybe a three minute walk away from the Causeway Bay MTR, which is convenient. Rooms are small -- most are in Hong Kong -- but clean. The rooftop pool is great to relax in at the end of a long, hot Hong Kong day, but it closes at the first sign of heavy rain, which can be frustrating. Decor is more kitsch than regal -- think Versace outlet -- but that's not a big deal. Din Tai Fung, an absolutely fantastic dim sum place (one Michelin star), is located in the lobby. In-room wifi is limited to two devices if you book through Expedia; more if you book through the hotel directly.

review_title: Perfect rooftop pool but otherwise average

It's got a fabulous view and the whole rooftop area looks to have been recently renovated. The location is also obviously central and very good if your plan is to explore Causeway Bay. So worth it for the location and the pool (especially if you visit in the summer) but otherwise just okay.

review_content: Only stayed one evening as we were passing through Hong Kong however found the hotel to be very easy and effciient. Booked and paid in advance online and got a good rate. Upon check in I requested a late checkout so we could make best use of the morning ebfore our early evening flight. The staff were very helpful to provide that service without any issues. They also suggested to use express check-outto save time and asked if we needed the airport shuttle. Room was clean and effcient. Not the largest and newest, but more than adequate and great for the price. Will definitely stay again as it's price performance is great. Would recommend you go to the dumpling restaurant "Din Tai Fung" downstairs on the ground floor, just out of the back exit.

review_title: Friendliest and most professional staff ever!
review_content: I spent 6 nights at the Regal Hong Kong hotel. I stayed in room 3308 (33th floor). The view was spectacular! The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was very specious with a big bathtub and separate shower. The staff was extemely polite, friendly and helpful ... every single day of my stay. I felt really pampered and taken care of. The swimming pool at the roof top with spectacular views was a real treat. The pool in itself is one of the best I have ever seen in a hotel. Very beautiful decor too. The gym in the basement is big and very well equiped. The views from the restaurant on the 31st floor is very nice. Room for improvement: The room felt a little bit cluttered with too many details. For example, the desk had too many papers providing all sorts of information. The…

review_title: Large rooms but hotel showing signs of aging
review_content: The Regal seems impressive and when you first go into your room there's a sense of "wow" - the rooms are really large with a separate living room and a bedroom and the view from my room was wonderful. Having a welcoming bowl of fruit didn't hurt either... But then you start to realize the little things like the fact that the bathroom is quite small or the cracks in the tiles or the heavy smeall of moisture (or was it mold?). I was also disappointed with breakfast and surprised at how hard it was to get a taxi as the hotel seems a bit off the main taxi lanes. But going back to the pluses, the staff were nice, there's free wifi and a lovely roogtop pool. So when you add it all up it's a bit of a mixed bag but overall it's a solid choice.

review_content: We booked a wheelchair access room after ringing them to make sure they had one. We had a verbal and written confirmation that room was wheelchair friendly. When we went to room, it was far from access friendly. 3 handrails around toilet and 1 over bath that an 8ft giant would have problems using, so we asked for another room that was a little better. One can not complain about the staff, they are super helpful and friendly. They could not do enough to be helpful. Wifi was rather expensive until duty manager gave us free access for our stay. Meals are on the expensive side, but ok. Would most likely stay here again.

Bathroom: all okay. Roof Top Swimming pool: nice view, but too windy for swimming... just my personal opinion. This is our first visit to Hong Kong, and we will be happily staying in this hotel again. The room was pretty nice, Welcome fruits and a bottle of wine was very nice surprise. With exclusive access to the Executive Club Lounge, which opens daily from 7:00am until 11:00pm, they have deluxe buffet breakfast, refreshment, and evening cocktail, all of which were very convenient. The staff are very nice. Genuine smiles as they greeted us. They were kind enough to accommodate all of our requests…

date: amy y wrote a review May 2015
review_title: Facility good but hotel is mean
review_content: I use the hotel from May 1-3, 2015. In general the location, facilities of hotel and size of room is good, but we were told because we booked via the internet (not sure if it is only via otel.com), we do not get free WIFI service, instead we were only allowed to use free WIFI in the lobby area for half an hour every 12 hours. If we want to use their WIFI we have to pay HK$130 per day. I think this is pretty mean and I would be hesistant to use this hotel in future especially considering other 4-5 stars hotel give us free WIFI the whole time we stayed. So be careful when you book!!

The location is very good, times square is about 5 mins walk away, Sogo also 5 mins away, lots of eateries around the corner as well. If you are travelling from the airport, take the airport express to hong kong station and then take the free hotel shuttles at gate H2 when you arrive in Hongkong Station. We booked this hotel for a very good discounted rate of SGD $190 per night, from the usual $250 a night that's usually offered. Based on what we paid for, it was sufficient and functional. Room is very basic and the room is of a good size, wasnt too small to be honest. The gym however is a let down, its at Basement 3 and all the…

date: Hesti S wrote a review Apr 2015
review_content: Stayed in this hotel for 9 days in April while on a combination of sport business & family trip. I was very impressed with the decor of the hotel - the lobby is beautiful and so are the rooms! We had a room on the 19th floor and the view from the window seat was very good. The room was spacious with all the necessary facilities. Breakfast in the morning was fantastic with a wide variety of food and very polite service staff. The location of the hotel itself is superb, as it's right in the middle of Causeway Bay, close to shops & big shopping centers. The only thing that was very disappointing was there wasn't anywhere to wait in the hotel lobby as the seating area is only for guests paying for drinks. Other than that, I loved everything else about the hotel.

review_content: I had a conference in this hotel and stayed there with family. It is near to Hong Kong Central and very convenient to reach from Airport by train. Hong Kong Central is the hub for all public conveyance and one can go to any place in HongKong from this hotel very easily. Time square, Sopping Malls (SOGO) and Victoria Park are all very close to the hotel. Like most of the hotels in HongKong it is right on the roadside and there is limited space in the lobby and reception area. There is no space for your family to sit when you check in (and most of the time you have to stand in a queue to check in and check out). The little space they have in the lobby is converted to a lounge and they won't allow you to sit there unless you order something. The rooms are good but small and the…

review_content: I stayed for 5 nights at the Regal hotel and attended a conference at the same hotel. The room was neatly kept albeit a bit dated (especially the TV ). The only snag for me is the absence of a bidet or a hose in the bathroom. The hotel reception were quiet friendly and obliged my request for a room change to a higher floor as the lower level rooms get a lot of street noise. The breakfast buffet had a lot of variety to suit every taste. The location of the hotel is convenient and not far away from may of the entrances of the Causeway bay MTR station. All in all I would recommend staying at this hotel.

The two rooms that I saw (28th and 20th floor) were both in bad need of a face-lift and my main gripe was the shoddy, cheap and lumpy mattress. I moved from my first room because the queen sized bed was really lumpy and uncomfortable, the toilet hadn't been cleaned properly and the electric curtains wouldn't travel more than a third towards closing. The chair in the room was scuffed and worn out and the wall paper behind it was torn. I was moved "upgraded) to a king-sized room but this was simply two beds pushed together, also with old lumpy mattresses and the bathroom fittings were really showing their age. If I was told that this was a 3.5 star to 4 star then I would have been…

date: Amanda M wrote a review Mar 2015
review_title: Beautiful hotel, perfect location, average service at reception
review_content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights in January while on a family trip. I was very impressed with the decor of the hotel - the lobby is beautiful and so are the rooms! We had a room on the 23rd floor and the view from the window seat was spectacular. The room was spacious with all the necessary facilities, and wi-fi worked well. I couldn't figure out how to work the television - perhaps a information guide on that would be helpful? Breakfast in the morning was fantastic with a wide variety of food and very polite service staff. I love how they serve you a choice of tea or coffee as soon as you sit down. The location of the hotel itself is superb, as it's right in the middle of Causeway Bay, about 5 minutes walk to Hysan Square, 10 minutes walk to Times Square and Din Tai Fung is…

It is located just above an amazing, famous Chinese dumpling restaurant and that has fulfilled my stay here. I would not have found this place otherwise. You can see the workers making the dumplings. Just a stroll away is the Times Square area with lots of shopping and restaurants. Causeway bay is close to the Convention Center and there were shuttles to and fro. Staff at Regal were very helpful. They guided me to a nearby fruits market and fish market where you can see a taste of the local culture. The breakfast restaurant had a good offering, with a mix of Chinese dim sum. The location was excellent and easy access to the trains. Going over to Kowloon…

review_title: great value hotel in Causeway Bay
review_content: **** Location, Customer Service and Value for Money **** Our 3 nights stay at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel was really a good deal. Hotel is in a nice location in Causeway Bay and is about 3-5 minutes away (leisurely walk) from the nearest MTR Station. Lots of good places to eat and shop. The room though a bit dated is spacious and well kept. Food choices in the breakfast buffet though repetitive are sufficient, tasty and filling. Kudos to excellent service delivered by JANICE of the Housekeeping Department. She speaks very little English but her service is top notch and sincere. ROBERT of Cafe Rivoli is also very cheerful and accommodating. We will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

review_content: if you are Indonesia visiting Hong Kong, this hotel location is great. You can find some Indonesia halal food around the hotel. Also shops selling Indonesian stuff i.e. Indomie, Pop Mie, teh botol or other Indonesian brand. Indonesia consul generale next to hotel. Causeway MTR station ( exit F ) nearby. From airport, for HKD 40 you can take Citybus no A11 from Airport Ground Transportation Center & alight at Sugar Street ( 14th stop ). Cheaper than Airport Express train ( HKD 100 ). On Sunday you can see many Indonesia worker gathering & socializing in Victoria Park near hotel.

review_content: Great for being 10 minutes from the airport. The room was good and had all the things you want for a 1 night stopover. They have a very good Spa and swimming pool but I was too late for a foot massage, they don't have a drier for your swimming gear which was inconvenient having to pack wet trunks the next morning. Charging for the Internet is ridiculous and it must be a great little cash cow for the hotel. I put in an early morning call and it did not happen so that is a negative. Check in was fast although at peak times it is very slow and I saw some unhappy guests who had to wait some time to get checked in. My check out at 6am was slow as there were only 2 desks manned. Overall it was an ok experience the location is a major plus.

review_title: Great for a one night airport stopover
review_content: After a sixteen and a half hour flight it was great to be able to check into a hotel ten minutes after leaving the baggage claim area. Likewise, be able to check in a few minutes after leaving the hotel for an early morning onward flight. The rooms are large and well-appointed and, given their location directly at the airport, were very soundproofed. Reception and other staff were friendy and efficient. We found that the restaurants in the hotel were all rather expensive, even by Hong Kong standards, but there are many cheaper options available ten minutes away in the arrivals terminal.

I stayed at this hotel in January for a business meeting - it was just before the holiday season in China so the location and price combo made this hotel a good choice. One thing I liked was the free shuttle bus service that picks you up from the HK Station where the Airport Express stops. It runs every 20 minutes and is highly recommended as it saves you money from taking the cab. The hotel is smack in the middle of Causeway Bay so in terms of shopping and food, you have the pick of the best. Like most hotels in HK, it is a bit old but I found it maintained fairly well. Check-in service was prompt and efficient. We had daily buffet breakfast from the hotel and it had a decent mix of Chinese and Western spread. The room itself was acceptable and as I was on the 20th floor, has a…

review_content: It's amazing how great the location of this hotel is. It's in the heart of busy Causeway Bay, just a few steps away from the famous Victoria Park. For fellow Indonesians, this hotel could be as close to home as anyone could imagine, as there is an Indo Market right across from it. Furthermore, for Indonesians who are devoted Christians (I think it's a Protestant one) and are willing to still go to church (in Indonesian) while on a holiday in HK, you could just take the elevator to B1 and the church is right there. It is, however, one of the stingiest hotels I've ever stayed in. There is no late check-out. Basically, the check out is at midday and check out between 12.00-12.30pm will cost you HKD75, and the charge increases accordingly. How crazy is that?! Another stingy thing…

review_title: Great Location, Good staff but overcrowding in public places

The Tram stops outside the hotel and the MTR is just a few minutes away. This makes the Hotel an ideal location. The staff are also very good. Check in is very fast and efficient and breakfast staff were uniformly friendly and courteous. We had booked a premier room that was well appointed and had good views. The room was well designed and spacious which was really good for Hong Kong. There are some good restaurants too and the wifi was free - well done Regal! So why the average rating? One of the problems is that the public areas are quite small and this leads to overcrowding during the busy season. We encountered numerous bottle necks at the lifts and…

review_content: Stayed 5 nights in a superior room which was okay. We would have like an upgrade as other guest appear to have had! Service was impeccable. All staff very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for catching buses, the MTR, the Star Ferry and for exploring the great streets in Tsim Sha Sui. We did not eat in the hotel as we met friends for meals outside and explored the nearby islands for seafood, but will do so next time we are in HK and staying at the Regal Kowloon.

review_title: Great stay at the Regal Causeway Bay
review_content: Found the location excellent. 500m from Causeway Bay Metro and from there all of Hong Kong is accessible. For a bit extra we paid for the executive club and it was well worth it. Free Breakfast overlooking Hong Kong skyline, free executive lounge between 11am and 2pm coffee, pastries etc and then from 5pm to 8pm free drinks and finger food. Most of all what we found excellent about this hotel was the staff. Extremely friendly and always helpful. Big compliments to all of them and to management, we would not stay anywhere else if we come back to Hong Kong!

date: Ivy H wrote a review Oct 2014
review_title: Warning - Do not disturb button does not work when you leave the room.
review_content: We had a false sense of security when we left our room with the do not disturb light turned on. When you leave the room and remove the hotel room keycard from the power slot, this will inadvertently turn off the light for the do not disturb signage but apparently not right away. So when you leave, you still see the light on but after 10-15 seconds it turns off and housekeeping will come in and clean. This is sooooooo misleading. We left valuables out in plain view bc we thought no one would enter the room since the do not disturb sign was on. What kind of trickery is this? Fortunately nothing was taken but this could have turned out really badly. I also agree with the other review about the mold and mildew issue in the bathrooms. This hotel is pretty outdated.

If you don't want to spend silly money on a top end hotel, this one offers a high level of comfort and service at a good price.

review_title: Decent property but not five star luxury
review_content: This hotel describes itself as "deluxe five-star" and "the epitome of luxury and elegance" ... I'm not sure I would go that far. This is an older hotel with rooms that are adequate and maybe closer to four star or three and a half stars. The room was comfortable and quiet, although I did notice a lot of hairs in the bathroom, which is not acceptable. I had to have them unclog the shower during my stay as well because the water was backing up. The location is excellent and just a short walk to the Causeway Bay area and metro. It's easy to get around the city from this location. Overall, I slept well each night, so this hotel gets high marks for that. However, it's a bit dated and definitely not five star luxury.

review_title: Regal Hongkong is worth a visit
review_content: Glitzy and glam but professional and friendly. Rooms are just stunning with mirrored glass everywhere (not the ceilings in the bedrooms thank goodness). Very luxurious bathrooms. Executive floors (31-33) have their own private sitting room serving yummy snacks throughout the day when the dining room is closed. 5pm onwards they provide complimentary delicious meat and fish treats, cakes and chips and nuts together with scotch, brandy, gin and Baileys with mixers and tea and coffee also available. Staff friendly and fun and very helpful and they are stylish and good looking to boot. Breakfast is a treat with western and Chinese food in all its variety served in a glorious Italian styed dining room overlooking Causeway Bay. Some might find the decor a bit OTT but we enjoyed it…

However, it is a beautiful bur or tram ride into the heart of Hong Kong. The hotel itself is nice. It is oddly decorated - a mixture of traditional with exquisite Greek sculptures thrown into the mix. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. Staff attentiveness is superb and always attentive to your needs. However, I hear it is owned by a tyrant who has no business being in the hotel industry. In any case, the hotel is blessed with world class chefs. The hotel boasts a coveted Michelin rated Italian restaurant and Chinese restaurant. Both, I highly recommend. The cuisine is simply…

review_content: The room is clean and in good condition but the space is smaller than what I expected but the service was GREAT! The receptionists and the help desks always provide more than what i asked for. If you have any question, you can look for Joey, Becky, Anna and Violet. They were patiently answered all my questions with smile and wamrth. Besides that, train station is 5 minutes away, restaurants and shopping mall are nearby. Definitely will stay here again in future.

review_content: STAY away from this hotel, one of the worst I ever stayed. REASONS: 1) Gave me a room reeking of strong cigarette /smoking smell when the room was supposed to be "NON-smoking room in a smoke-free floor"! The entire room was heavily "smoked-out". Changed my room to a real non-smoking room after I called the front desk to request for a change. The bellboy who came up to help me with my luggage also agreed that the room smelt like a room of a heavy smoker. 2) We hung the 'make up room' sign before leaving our rooms in the morning at 10am, and upon returning to our rooms at 4pm+, our rooms were still not being cleaned! Lousy service, incredible..... 3) My friends went back to their room after shopping, and found a housekeeping lady cleaning their room. Due to security reasons,…

date: Tiddy W. wrote a review Aug 2014
review_title: Nice location, easy access, and value for money!
review_content: I stayed here last week with my friends and family for 5 rooms. We are all satisfied with hotel and staff. Able to ask for connecting room. Nice location on side of the main road and easy to access. I travelled with airport express from the airport and then use free shuttle bus for airport express customer which direct to the hotel door! Use H2 bus from Hong Kong station (AE station) and Regal Hong Kong will be at the 3rd stop. Also easy to get there or go out with taxi. Near subway exit from just 5-10 mins. Causeway bay station. Walking distance to sogo, time square, super market, and so on. Shops and restaurants are in the building and nearby. Hotel room is nice and not that small if compare to accommodation size in Hong Kong. I feel a bit bigger to kowloon size with…

date: catherine l wrote a review Aug 2014
review_content: Stayed for 6 nights here. Second stay in this hotel. The last stay was in 2007. I was impressed then for the big nice clean room, but now it is just a busy hotel in a nice location. Its within walking distance to the Causeway Bay (about two streets away, walking along shophouses so you don't really feel it), and near Sogo, Hysan Place and many other shopping centres. The best part is that the renowned Din Tai Fung is just five steps from the hotel lobby. On Sundays, one side of the hotel is packed with Indonesian maids on their off days. They are sitting on the roadsides, on the overhead bridge. There is a chinese bookstore at the basement which is quite cosy and great for picking up some books/stationery. The housekeeping service is fast when we asked for extra towels and…

review_content: Stayed in a suite in July with club facilities. After a very nice check-in on the 31st floor we ended up on the 18th floor in a very nice room, would have preferred a higher floor for views but the room was very nice. The daily stocked inclusive mini bar was a bit light on, we got 4 beers, a bottle of wine and 3 Cokes over the 6 days. We did however get great use out of the club lounge on the 31st floor where we started each evening with a snack and a glass of wine taking in the view. A comfortable couch in the club room would have been a nice addition. Breakfast was lovely and the view stunning each morning as we enjoyed it high in the club suite breakfast room. The staff were attentive and welcoming across all areas from check in to dining and the pool. Travelling with a 6…

date: Alan M wrote a review Jul 2014
review_title: Comfortable, convenient hotel for tired traveler
review_content: I stayed at the Regal for a business trip to China while I was waiting for my visa. In the HK summers, it is such a luxury not to have to leave the comfort of air conditioning. Leave customs and immigration, walk out past the Starbucks, down the hall, and you are there. The hotel is clean, the staff are professional, quick, and polite. The rooms (at least my room) are not luxurious and grandiosely large, but very comfortable, stylish, and relaxing. Little things like a nice convenient coffee machine, stereo for my iPod, and speakers in the bathroom are all quite nice. The room is extremely quiet. I must not have been a few hundred meters away from the tarmac, but I heard not a single airplane. View from my room was beautiful, bed was comfortable, room was clean. Only a few…

This hotel takes you about 10 years back. No key cards in the elevator, carpets in the room and breakfast coupons printed out! This is right at causeway bay and the main attraction as the shopping action is next door. The food at the cafe is good and the lunch buffet offers a decent spread. Service is just average. There are specified rates to be paid for early check in / late check out - even when its 30 minutes!

date: Robert M wrote a review Jul 2014
review_title: Central and comfortable with roof top cooling!
review_content: A four day stay visiting friends and the hotel was a pleasant surprise. A quaint little reception desk with service a little old fashioned and not very quick. Our room with a king bed was of an adequate size with basic amenities and a rather strangely positioned television in the window. No free wifi which these days most modern hotels do provide. The nice thing about this hotel is it's roof too swimming pool which in the early Hong Kong summer is a welcomed means of cooling down. Not a bad place for a few days, easy access to Hong Kong's subway system, the trams, and great restaurants around like Din Tai situated in the same building!

date: naydi n wrote a review Jul 2014
review_content: The hotel is a true 5 stars hotel. It has a beautiful pool, good gym, great breakfast, fast internet (which was very important because my husband was teaching a class online), beautiful room with an a/c that worked perfectly, and great concierge and front desk service. We could not have asked for a better service, even the room service lady was super attentive and helpful. The location is wonderful, with a close station by the hotel. We stayed in four cities during our trip to China and the Regal Hong Kong Hotel was by far the best. It made our stay in Hong Kong great!!!!!

Price: High, but you are in HK, and for this you have to pay. Otherwise go to a crappy Bestwestern nearby into a small small small room. review_content: Clean and large room - unusual size for HK! Some noisy inconsiderate neighbours who ddnt know how to shut their door quietly - banged and banged! I had to come out and scold them. The best was the hotel concierge team - so efficient, helpful and polite. Considering the increased number of Muslim tourists, the hotel should include HALAL choices. Too much pork dishes during breakfast. The congee should also be left plain and condiments / pickles / meat be a choice and not mixed into it.

review_title: Executive Floor or Standard when on business
review_content: Having stayed at this hotel twice in the last year I thought I'd outline some of the advantages and disadvantages of paying extra on the Exec Floor vs the Standard rooms. Advantages of the Exec Floor are that if you get one of the really large rooms they are very nice and a definite improvement on the standard rooms. However on my second stay I would not rate the room I had on this floor as any different to the Standard rooms except with the addition of L'Occitane toiletries. The room was pretty small and no different in quality. Breakfast on the Exec Floor is nice - as good a choice as the main restaurant but a more relaxed atmosphere and good view. The Exec lounge is OK - the service is great the staff really very helpful but it is pretty small and only has tables and…

date: yashi s wrote a review May 2014
review_content: Stayed at a club room 3317 last May 2-4. Two-nights stay but I could stay here forever. Excellence all the way. Breakfast buffet is great. Swimming pool really is very good for the children. Front desk speak english very fluently its a shame I did not get their names. Fast check-in and check-out, they also lead you to the room. Very courteous.
