review_content: Stayed here for 3 nights while attending a gift fair in Hong Kong. Room was pretty good value for the price with everything you would need and I would gladly stay there again. Most notable feature was mirrors! I have never stayed in a room with so many. Location was great for the island. I chose the executive floor rooms as when I travel by myself I like to sit in the lounge at the end of the day and not worry about breakfast. The lounge was just a waste of time, it was like an afterthought with 4 or 5 kitchen tables, there was no cold beer (the day I went) and it was not a place that was relaxing in any way. The breakfast on the other hand, which was served in the restaurant was pretty great with a wide selection and great service. Overall I don't think the additional cost of…

date: Frank T wrote a review May 2014
review_title: Great deal for good location and good service
review_content: I booked this hotel through their website and got a great deal for the business rooms over the long easter weekend 2014.. The check in was like a breeze, I was escorted from the lobby check in to the executive floor checkin where it took only a few minutes to do all the paperwork. The room was on a high floor with even a view over the harbour of Hong Kong and by Hong Kong standards the room was big. The value for money was great. They include in the room a free minibar with the basics, so you won't get tempted to drink yourself to sleep. Also a lounge is available, but I didn't use that. Also the checkout was quick an easy. Generally the location is perfect in the heart of Causeway bay, walking distance to the subway and shopping. Enough choices of food in and around the hotel.…

review_content: Regal Hongkong Hotel visit from 5/04/14 till 8/04/14 Free transfer from airport and back, good location, big room, all necessary things is in a room, adapter for electricity, kettle in the room, minibar, tv set, good personal,

review_title: Of all the Regals in HK, only this works.
review_content: When in Hong Kong, location is everything for both business and pleasure. Regal Causeway Bay is a walking distance to all the shopping malls, local eateries and MTR stations. Cabs are also not a problem. You just need to do your due diligence in planning your time properly. Having been to Hong Kong several times, Causeway Bay is where you want to be staying, shopping and eating. With the hotel located along the Blue Line, you can easily access Central and Admiralty stations where you can cross over to the Red Line. Compared to its sister hotel, Regal Kowloon, Regal Causeway Bay has a much higher standard of service, housekeeping and ambience. The hotel's design may be reminiscent of The Venetian in Macau but it does not feel old. The concierge service staff has initiative and…

date: David D wrote a review Apr 2014
review_content: Normally I would stay near the ladies market area. Since I was attending a conference at this hotel, I decided to stay here. Good central location, near the causeway bay MTR, Times Square and Sogo. Given the up market location, you would need to move out towards the TSIM SHA TSHI to experience authentic Hong Kong. Hotel wise, efficient although the service staff could be better. Stayed at the club floor. Unfortunately the complimentary evening cocktails at the executive club lounge closes at 8pm...far too early I thought. Otherwise had a good stay.

review_content: Very comfortable and good choice hotel in a great location. Very good value for money and well worth the extra to stay on the Club Floors if you travel for business. Check-in is quick and easy on level 31 and the staff are friendly and efficient.

review_content: Excellent hotel in a great location. Very good value for money and well worth the extra to stay on the Club Floors. Check-in is quick and easy on level 31 and the staff are friendly and efficient. Really nice drinks and snacks for afternoon cocktail hour (well more like 2~3hrs) in a calm and relaxing environment. Breakfast is included in the restaurant and was very broad choice of food and a great view Rooms are very clean and comfortable with a great bathroom including corner bath and separate shower with rain head. Wifi was included at no extra cost Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again, similar hotels I have stayed in within Hong Kong were $100~200 more per night.

review_title: value for money at corporate rate
review_content: Stayed in this hotel with a staff corporate rate which is one of the most decent deals you can get! Even without the corporate rate, this is one of the better priced hotel in Hong Kong! The main reasons for staying in this hotel are: Space I have been to Hong Kong many times and this is the first time I am reviewing a Hong Kong hotel. I think it is worth to mention because 9 out of 10 hotels in Hong Kong are claustrophobic. But for the price you pay in this hotel, the space they give is extremely comfortable. Price As mentioned, without the corporate rate, it is still very affordable Location It is just 5 minutes walk from the Causeway Bay subway which happens to be one of the main shopping district! In general, Hong Kong is not a place for visitors to stay and chill in…

review_title: Looking forward to a return visit!
review_content: I have stayed at several hotels on various trips to Hong Kong, but this stay at the Regal turned out to be the best of them. Reservation made for an Executive Room on the Executive Club floor and the extra dollars spend was well worth it. Ms Tiffany Chan and her staff in the Executive Club made me welcome from the moment I stepped out of the lift. Due to airline schedules I arrived early but leaving my bags and going out for lunch was no problem. The Executive Lounge is delightful with tea and coffee always available. Great location with easy connections to trams, buses, MTR, shopping malls and markets! The room I had (King bed) was great with views of the Harbor and Park and the bathroom and other room amenities were first class. A comfortable desk and chair for work and free…

date: Andrew C wrote a review Apr 2014
review_content: Pros: Centrally located in Causeway Bay. Ten minutes walk to rugby stadium. Two minutes walk to buses, trams and underground to get to anywhere in HK. Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel very clean. Breakfast menu extensive and good quality. Bedrooms were well equipped with TV, kettle, tea bags etc. i found the bed very comfortable though it was a bit too firm for my wife. Cons. The air in all public areas is pumped full of air freshener constantly which is quite overpowering, you can even smell it as you approach hotel. Late checkout is expensive. There is no left luggage room so you have to leave it in lobby, though it is tied up and there are always plenty of staff around. If you take more than three minutes in the shower the whole bathroom floods, this wasn't just a…

review_content: This is our 4th stay at the Regal over the Sevens weekend. The location is probably the closest hotel to the stadium. Previously we had an Executive Club room with access to the Club Floor. This time we chose an Executive Suite and really appreciated the extra space. The 31st floor check-in is a haven of peace and quiet (compared to what is going on at the ground floor reception!). All the reception staff were helpful, polite and a credit to Regal. We noticed several improvements: breakfast is now in the Zeffirino and is a vast improvement on the rather inadequate offering previously served up in the Club Lounge; better (but not great) eats during the "cocktail period"; and the "self pour" drinks (but waiter service available if required)! For those with late flights the late…

We have just checked out of the Regal over the HK Sevens weekend, and it was a great place to stay. The central location to the stadium (5 min walk) and Causeway Bay was terrific - really easy to get around! We stayed in the executive floors/ from level 31 up, and the service and amenities were great. There is a dedicated 2 person concierge, a great bar where everything is complimentary, well equipped rooms (coffee machine, nice toiletries, music player, travel adaptor, free mini bar). It was also nice and quiet on these levels - despite the partying from the rugby all over town! The rooms are, as mentioned by other reviewers, a little gaudy but perfectly adequate and I would not hesitate in staying here again.

Excellent location as it is in walk-in distance to restaurants, shopping area (Time Square), MTR station, freeway and stadium. Room is clean and neat, a lot of "gold" features but everyone has his/her own taste.... Bonus- the well known restaurant Ding Tai Fung is right next door, tasty buns and excellent food.

date: Loraine R wrote a review Mar 2014
review_content: We had a really enjoyable stay. To be honest I was very pleasantly surprised as I had read mixed reviews since we booked our trip so we approached the hotel with some trepidation. I'm not really sure what other guests experienced but we had no issues with the hotel at all. As we were staying for a week we paid extra and booked a deluxe room - so maybe those people who were complaining about room size may have had a standard room. Our room 2705 on the 27th floor was excellent, a decent size with a bed which could easily sleep 4 people. Facilities in the room were very good - room safe, large tv, i-pod dock, coffee machine, wifi free for 2 devices. Mini bar, complimentary fruit and toiletries - even a set of bathroom scales which come in handy for weighing your suitcase for…

review_title: Fantastic stay in the Exec Club
review_content: Really enjoyable 6 night stay in the Executive Club. Free airport shuttle included taking 1hr 30mins. Quick checkin on the Exec Floor and bags came to the room straight away. Room and bathroom very nice and spacious with wifi and safe. Excellent breakfast in the morning on the 31st floor with great views. Refreshments provided during the day in the Exec Club room and from 5-8pm drinks and canapes. The hotel has a very good fitness centre. The hotel is located in Causeway Bay a great area for shopping. The MTR is a 5 min walk making everywhere easily accessible. It took 1hr to get to the cable car to see the beautiful Big Buddha. The Big Bus redline stop number 4 is just around the corner and even a taxi to Central is 60HKG$. The Big Bus is a great way to see the city with 3…

spent 3 nites on the club floor.....it was our 4th stay there. Its situated near to all the places we want to go to....shopping malls.\,eatery places and next to the tram and MTR stations. Room is clean and comfy, not big...so if we3persons,maybe a bit cramp.... the club rooms come with free bfast abd refreshment thruout most of theday....great view from te lounge and you can hv light meals and wines. beers...And shuttle bus to n from airport is complimentary....

Great place to stay. Well appointed rooms, very handy to MTR, shops & WanChai. I will definitely stay there again. The staff are fantastic. Especially on the executive floor. Food was very good too with plenty of variety. The view is pretty special from the cafe on the 30th floor.

date: Aleks V wrote a review Mar 2014
review_title: Executive club room is the way to go.
review_content: I must admit that this hotel really surpassed my expectations. It is in the best possible location being in the heart of Causeway Bay and right next to Victoria Park and the MTR. There are so many good restaurants around and great shopping with Times Square just around the corner. My wife and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon in Asia, we had a room on the 34th floor it was one of the executive club rooms. The room has big windows and tall ceilings and really had a grand feel to it. Being on the club floors there really is lots of benefits, we had free airport shuttle which btw has free wi-fi. Also the breakfast was included which was served on the club floor and had beautiful views of honk kong being on the 31st floor as well everyt night from 5-8pm cocktails and hors…

Best rate in Causeway Bay, better than Park Lane and the overpriced Excelsior in the same area. Hotel décor is China meets Italy, but the refurbished room is not bad at all. Got a good rate at Agoda for executive level room. Check in at 31st floor away from the madding crowd. Breakfast is adequate but the view makes up for it. Better have congee a few blocks down at Sugar Street, Ocean Seafood. Ground Floor houses Din Tai Fung and second floor has Fu Sing. Will consider staying here again.

review_title: A decent hotel but very poor customer service
review_content: Stayed at the Regal Hotel, Causeway Bay for two whole weeks on a recent business trip. This hotel is a decent hotel which is centrally located in Causeway Bay. It's not a bad hotel possibly 3 stars with a bit of colonial feel to it possibly from the previous English rule. The problem I had was with the service. While the staff at the breakfast table were extremely friendly, I felt like all other staff were out to rip me off. Every thing me and my colleague asked for seems to be chargeable or to our disadvantage. Even things that were negotiated beforehand when we made reservations such as laundry and airport-hotel shuttle. Throughout the whole stay, all I felt was how much I disliked the money-minded staff which really ruined my stay. Without fail, the Housekeeping staff will…

review_content: After a gruelling 21 hour flight and another 4 to go, this was a welcome stop over. The hotel and amenities were very decorative just missing the New Years events. The room for an airport hotel was quiet, clean, well equipped and although a little tired looking was very good deal for this class of hotel. I must also note the selection of eateries and bars would suite any desire or budget.

date: Anand I wrote a review Mar 2014
review_title: Good Hotel for a short stay
review_content: The hotel is good since it is in a convenient location in causeway bay in hong kong. It also has got a good lobby with a restaurant and service is excellent. The best part I found was the outlet of SubWay just opposite to the hotel.

review_title: Hotel did areas bissiness dan restoration
review_content: Hotel located near subway station dan bus stop tram stop. Many shop for shopping and room charge is not too expensive. Hotel service nice also hotel shaft is friendly. Also there airport to hotel and return for free of charge if make reservation via internet.

We stayed in a deluxe room for 1 night. Our room was spacious and clean, though it was a bit dated. The complimentary WIFI worked very well, but only two devices can be connected per room. There was a small standing shower and a big bath tub in the bathroom. However, there was no shower head in the bath tub, rendering the bath tub unusable (unless you want to fill the whole bath tub). The standing shower, on the other hand, was very small and you could easily hit yourself against the wall. This hotel is a ‘Green Hotel’ and hence, towels are changed every 3 days. There was no iron in the room. I asked for it and the housekeeping had done a good job by bringing it promptly. The use of computer in the business centre cost HKD30 for only 15 min. I thought as a business hotel ,…

I have been staying at this hotel at least twice a year for the past 10 years and I would not change hotel. The personnel is unique in every department.The rooms are of an ideal size. The bathroom is perfect under every aspect. The whole hotel is very clean and located in a very good location...particularly if you like horse racing with Happy Valley nearby.

date: Loren P wrote a review Feb 2014
review_content: We got a really good rate via Agoda- 50% off and for the price we paid for, I can't complain. I would not full price though as I would rather go to another hotel for their full price. The room was ok- the mirrors made it look bigger than it actually is. I liked the couch by the window. It was clean & no signs of stains or any dirt. I liked the bathroom but I what didn't like was the bed- it was low, duvet wasn't as fluffy and size was just queen (we were a couple with 1 toddler), we requested for a room with a King size bed but they were fully booked. We were however allowed to check in a bit earlier as soon as the room was ready (12:30PM). Location wise, it's right next to my favourite Din Tai Fung- very near Sogo, MTR, tram and bus stops. Again, I loved the fact that we…

My children and I just stayed at the Regal Hongkong Hotel for a week and it was great! We slept in a room with 2 double beds and an additional fold-up bed. The bathroom was a good size, with a large bathtub. The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet. Good temperature control, lights, wi-fi. The staff were excellent, especially the hard-working housekeeper who kept our room tidy. We didn't use the facilities because the rooftop pool was closed. The restaurant was so-so, but there are many good restaurants next door (like Din Tai Fung) or within a few minutes walk. There's also a local laundry about a block and a half away. The bookshop, Commercial Press, is also right next door. In short, the location is excellent. The only negative is that the lobby was…

date: Derrick Aw wrote a review Feb 2014
review_title: A most enjoyable experience at the executive floors
review_content: Have been very happy to stay here for the first time. Check-in at executive level was hassle-free and comfortable. The luggage took half an hour to be sent up, but ok, that is minor complaint. Although the ceiling is very high, the room is small for an executive room! The speed buttons on the telephone was spoilt, even after they very promptly sent the repair man. Air-con control is erratic. They supplied a whole bunch of la'occitane toiletries :-) and there are two different bath robes (one thicker than the other) plus two yakutas in the closet - unbelievable choices. I had a large fruit platter and a plate of chocolates. Mini-bar supplies are free (executive floors only, I think)!! The staff (even the chambermaids) at the executive floors are all very pleasant. Wi-fi is…

review_title: It was a nice and relaxing vacation
review_content: We had a great time with our stay at Regal Hongkong. The staff is very accomodating specially Ms. Helen Lim. Although our only comment is the limited choices of breakfast buffet. Overall, it was very good.

We stayed for 3 nights and the only good thing about this hotel is the location. The hotel is super old so lift is super slow. No adaptor. Lots of broken lights. On our last night, there was a leak from bathroom and at 1am the lights in our room was suddenly turn on by itself and wont turn off though we pulled out the room key. We called the reception three times and finally someone came. It took about 20 mins to fix and not even an apology or explanation of what was going on. During check out, they just simply asked if we have any mini bar and then she said 'no mini bar its ok... Next!'. Not even asking how was our stay or a good bye! Not very polite!

Experience with this hotel was good overall. Good facilities of the hotel including a proper gym and swimming pool. Dined at the chinese restaurant at level 3 - service was very bad. Rooms were much bigger than your average city hotel rooms - at least there's enough space to take every item in your bag and repack your suitcase. Check in/out was extremely busy during the chinese new year period with waiting times of 40mins. Older Style furnishings but everything was present; electric kettle, fridge, TV, free water. Perhaps the decorations took up all the waiting and seating area; lack of seating area in main lobby. As we were waiting for our airport transport to arrive, Mum and Dad had to wait standing up for 45mins in the lobby. Perhaps the biggest advantage is it's…

date: kah h wrote a review Feb 2014
review_content: We were on the executive suites on level 33.We had 2 rooms. Our rooms were excellent with good views. Staff were very friendly. By the end of the stay, they were like friends.They help us to look up excellent local restaurants to eat; even helped us to book them. We went to many good restaurants. The afternoon coffee and evening snacks on level 30 were wonderful for the children. They thought that it was a wonderful treat everyday. The cakes and finger food served, not only looked excellent and well prepared but tasted good.

Nice 5 star hotel in hongkong. Very near MTR. Excellent for shopping. Attentive and helpful staff. Complimentary airport shuttle is the best. Excellent executive rooms. Very nice view from the hotel. Nice breakfast choices.

The location is wonderful in the heart of Hong Kong in Causeway Bay. We chose it initially because of its location as we were walking the Hong Kong Trail and we needed a central hotel we could return to each evening. The MTR is a few minutes walk away. The tram right outside the lobby and there are buses to everywhere nearby.. Our room is lovely and we can say that it is one of the nicest hotel rooms we have stayed in. It is not a huge room but it is big enough. The ceiling is high, the window huge and it has a city and harbour view. It is wonderful as we are on the 34 floor. The bed is comfortable and bathroom wonderful. We love the fact that we have a separate bath and shower. We booked our room on the Regal website and have free wifi for two devices which is a really good…

date: Paminder s wrote a review Jan 2014
review_content: considering the hotel room sizes in HK city, the rooms and and esp the bathrooms were reasonably spacious. we got a good deal through one of the travel sites which was a steal for this hotel. its situated in a commerical hub, so plenty of eating joints and shopping area around.

review_title: the deluxe five-star hotel? oh haha
review_content: well i loved to be here! this hotel is so pricey.. its okay but oh please why they dont give best facilities? wifi we need to pay seperated its not include for room service and must pay for adaptors.. hahah i just laugh so hard because this is my first time stayed in hotes who need to pay adaptors.. hahaha.. but well yea so far so good.. best place is true! love it^^

review_title: Helpful staff, good stay but what's with the lack of lobby seating?
review_content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 5 days. What I love about the hotel: - LOCATION! - Comfortable rooms of reasonable size - Free shuttle to and from the airport with free wi-fi on the bus - Great rates though they fluctuate a lot - Staff really try to help though there was an instance when I looked at the room pillow menu and requested for foam pillows. The housekeeping staff brought wrong pillow types a few times before finally saying they didn't have the ones I requested. It was nice of the lady answering to follow up with me if I'd received it then call me back to coordinate the right pillow. This is service! As reviewed earlier, there is free wifi but it's limited to 2 devices per room. This is STILL the case though management had replied before that they will look into it. …

We had a good group rate, very good value for money for this conveniently located hotel at Causeway Bay. Room is well equipped though the bathroom facilities are a little dated. Reception at check-in seemed to be a trainee, pretty slow with the check-in process. This is a busy hotel as there is always a crowd at the lobby area; It is popular with both business and leisure travellers.

That is aside from the convenience in taking tram and bus which is just outside the hotel and walking distance to MTR. The room is spacious.

review_content: Regal Hotel Hong Kong is well located within walking distance from shopping mecca Causeway Bay and only about 5 minutes walking distance to the nearest MRT exit. We used a free shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. Took us about 1 hour 15 minutes. We check-in at Regal Hotel booth in Arrival Hall B and issued a free voucher, and instructed to go to the lobby of Regal Hotel Airport for our free shuttle to Regal Hotel Hong Kong. Amenities include free 2 bottle water and free wifi. We opt not to include breakfast on our trip but we have plenty of breakfast option nearby such as McDonald's and Cafe de Coral. Given we came to HK during December, the room is cold during the night although we shut down the air con - so extra layer of clothes is advisable for those from the…

review_title: Near perfect stay - barring the breakfast
review_content: We had a VERY pleasant stay in Regal Hong Kong. Worth paying the extra bucks for the Executive rooms which spares you away from the hustle and bustle of other tourists hogging (checking in, rushing for breakfast, etc) the hotel. Check in for Executive rooms are up on the peaceful 31st floor and greeted by awesome English speaking staff like Helen. Rooms are not as spacious (but hey that's HK for you) and about 5mins walking distance from CWB MTR. Once you are down, its a shoppers' heaven with Sogo, Times Sq, Hysan shopping centres etc. One minus point, though, the breakfast on 31st floor could have had a bit more varieties and cater to the various diets (such as vegetarian and halal). overall, awesome place.

I will definitely stay with you again, even enrolled for the Rewards. Whether I will continue to do so will be determined by how long it takes to get a room next time.

review_title: Don't let a hotel experience spoil your stay in Hong Kong
review_content: If you are one that expect nothing paying 1000HKD per night, this hotel is for you. I expect good service, not exceptional but good. What I got was terrible. Hong Kong is lovely, the hustle and bustle in the day, with goods pushed around on trolleys across the roads. The day is always pleasant, all goes well until I step into the room. First day's return to the hotel room surprised me with an exact image of the room since I left. Presumably you have to manually call for service to make up the room. Okay, this is my fault for not requesting, this I concur. Second day, I return to a room with unfilled sheets, body gel not replaced even though there is just enough left to cleanly fingernails. I had to manually request for more body gel. Third day was another depressing…

review_title: A brief but excellent night's stay
review_content: I had a pleasant stay at Hotel Regal, Causeway Bay while on a business trip, even though it was a brief stopover. Room was spacious and had excellent comforts for a business traveller. Efficient checkin at the reception with pleasantries exchanged. Restaurant on the 1st floor served a wide range of cuisines on buffet including local food. One does not need to look elsewhere for such good food. Cafeteria on the ground floor a good place for business casual meetings. Hotel is conveniently located near the shopping precinct. Rooftop swimming pool was a big plus. Will definitely book this hotel in my annual trip to HK in 2014.

review_title: Good hotel, perfect location in Causeway Bay
review_content: Hong Kong, everyone would expect hotels here will be small and pricey. I just spent 4 days in HK recently for a business meeting. Since the meeting was held in Regal Hong Kong Hotel, Causeway Bay, I just stay here to avoid traffic congest in peak hour to come here in the morning. My flight arrived to HKIA early in the morning and I bought the Airport Express Card (Octopus Card) after speaks to the airport customer services. According to them, this is the best option as this Airport Express Card including return airport train transfer to the city and unlimited use of MTR trips for 72 hours. The train from airport to Hong Kong station took around 25 minutes. It is fast and very convenient. Once I reach HK station, the customer service direct me to the hotel shuttle bus counter as…

review_content: I'll start by saying I cannot understand the negative reviews that are based on too many mirrors in the room - they make the rooms feel bigger! We had a suite for our family of four, the youngest being our daughter aged 18 months. The room surpassed our expectations, not too expensive given its location, free wifi and soft drinks in the mini bar, cot waiting for us in the room as pre arranged, lovely décor, spa bath, corner location gave fantastic views, excellent staff in every area of the hotel and smashing location for the shopping district/cafes and restaurants that Causeway Bay offers. Absolutely loved our stay and would definitely stay again!

So hard and tasteless. Furthermore, it really didn't have a club feel, more like a dining hall with just simple chairs and tables, no sofas or anything to relax on. The most disappointing was the breakfast which really doesn't cater to international travelers. It had bacon and sausages but everything else seemed to be for local tastes. review_content: checking in is always effortless. room is luxurious. Good location, lots of good eateries around and walking distance to fashion walk, times square. the room service is fantastic. like most hotels in hongkong, wifi is not free. the room is spacious for doing work on latop. shower cubicle and bath tub rather small, but this is hongkong where is space is scarce.

review_content: The Regals location in Causeway bay is excellent. Jardines Market and times square are so close and handy! The staff are very professional, especially Mon is customer service relations! She will help you with many issues!

review_title: Comfortable rooms, shame about the inclusive breakfast debate
review_content: We had a mid-level 'deluxe' room which was very clean and comfortable, complete with both a stand-up shower and a bath. No free power sockets by the bed unfortunately, just a couple next to the desk. Location is very central, about 5 mins walk from Causeway Bay MTR and close to a wide range of shops and a number of good restaurants. A free shuttle transfer is available from Hong Kong station which makes for a quick, easy and cheap transport option to and from the airport. The pool on the roof is a pleasant space to spend a few hours relaxing, but be aware that there is no shade provided except for late afternoon when the sun disappears completely behind one of the neighbouring buildings - a minor downside of the very central location. Our booking confirmation clearly showed…

review_content: Great location, a block away from the causeway shopping districts with many shopping malls. There are also many delicious food options nearby, local or international. Really spacious room, very rare for a hotel on the Hong Kong island. Highly recommended.

date: Lin G wrote a review Oct 2013
review_content: We stayed at the Regal from 22 – 25 October 2013. We have stayed in several 4 and 5 star hotels in HK and have to admit – we were anxious about staying at the Regal as we didn’t know how it would match up (it was very reasonably priced in comparison). We needn’t have worried. The Regal is such a lovely hotel. Check-in was speedy with very good knowledgeable staff. Our room was on the 23rd floor – great views of HK. The room was a real surprise – very spacious and totally clean – huge bed! Although the rooms were decorated some time ago they are of a very high standard – and are very comfortable. Lovely corner bath and a fantastic shower (didn’t want to get out of it!). We had tea in the lobby lounge – so relaxing….warning ladies – the cakes on display are sooo tempting!…

review_content: Good service from bell boy, front desk to housekeeping. I spent 4 nites staying in Regal and have no regret. Room is clean and staff are friendly.Location is great as it is at the doorstep of Causeway Bay.

review_content: I stayed here during the Hong Kong 7s weekend because of the close proximity to the stadium. Arrived to a very busy reception area that took a long time to check-in. I was fairly underwhelmed with the room and I probably would not rush back as there are other hotels that I would rather stay at but in terms of location for the 7s weekend then it is perfect and good value for money.

review_title: A bit frantic, a bit dated, but well-located
review_content: Arriving into the bedlam of the ground floor entrance lobby makes you want to turn tail and flee : scores of travellers with bags, milling around, trying to get checked in or out. But persevere and there's a good base for a HK stay. We were on the higher floors above the 31st and you can check in there which makes a big difference. Rooms were, well, shiny with lots of etched mirror and some slightly unappealing gold leather. But very comfortable beds and good bathrooms. Plus spectacular views down onto some of the less tall buildings. Wi-fi worked OK and there was a separate "executive" breakfast on the 31st floor. A decent, if low-tech, gym but I never found the bar although may have missed it somewhere amidst the ground floor crush.

review_content: Read the tripadvisor and decided to book regal hong kong hotel for 3 nights. The booking of hotel come with free transport from airport to hotel. Hence, when we reach the airport and proceed to the regal information counter, at first, we are informed that we have to pay for the transport cost. However, after explanation and the staff contact their other colleagues over the telephone, finally it is settled that the transport is free. Hope that they can improve on such administrative works & communication in future. We will inform that the free shuttle bus is at the Regal Airport Hotel. Asked the hotel staff on hte pickup location when we reach the Regal Airport Hotel. Hope that there will be more sigboards in the Regal Airport Hotel for tourists to find the pickup location…

date: John H wrote a review Oct 2013
review_content: I stayed at the Regal 3 nights at the executive floor, very nice room. good service from the staff. The price was fair. the only thing which must be improved is the breakfast in the executive launch. I will stay there again.

review_content: Came back to the Regal hotel for a four night business trip in September. I was offered a room upgrade on arrival to the executive floors, it wasn't free but at a discounted rate, we'll worth the extra cost, it included breakfast & evening drinks. The rooms are perhaps not the most modern but are very comfortable, large for Hong Kong standards and come with all the bids an pieces, coffee machine, free wifi etc...Clean and a good sized bathroom. Actually had a good nights sleep in a comfortable bed an that's what is all about. Also liked the little roof top pool. Not sure how the basic or standard rooms compare but have no hesitation in recommending the Executive rooms if you can get a decent rate. Service was nice and friendly and location is good and very close to everything.

review_content: At the causeway regal hotel for 4 nights 13-17 sept X 2rooms. Location of hotel at causeway is very good. Hotel room is so-so. There is no rack for luggage and the tv is poorly placed at the supposed bench at the window. Check in was ok and Kenneth of hotel was helpful. This room 0921 was noisy somehow with noises from upstairs and morning housekeeping incessant noise as well! Day before we left, we asked for late check out for our two rooms for 3pm. A supposed new staff said best was 1pm. We asked her nicely to help us. She referred to another guy at the reception. Saw his name tag as Hody. He approached us with a "fierce" stance and said "yes" in a rather unfriendly manner as a first word he uttered to us. We repeated our request and asked if we could check out at 3pm. He…

review_title: Poor customer service and dated rooms
review_content: Rooms are disappointing with a dated renaissance look which does not fit in with the overall image of the hotel and exterior. Only redeeming factor was the convenience of its location near the metro station and is in the heart of the shopping district. Checking in is a nightmare at this hotel with a very small lobby that is almost always packed with guests, no queue system nor staff to manage the crowd. Front desk was rude, inexperienced and not at all helpful in handling miscommunication with reservation agent even though I had reservation print-out stating room requirements. This was resolved only when I demanded to speak with the duty manager. They offered no word of apology for the hiccup but instead sent an invitation to their royalty program after the stay. No thanks!

date: Mohamed A wrote a review Aug 2013
location: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
review_title: Does not worth to pay or stay
review_content: I've visited this hotel and stayed for one night which was so terrible due to the following: 1- A/C was not working properly 2- Curtains were not out of order 3- Water heater was not working 4- Coffee machine was not working 5- Service or operator not answering the phone. 6- No body is caring about the guest once you pay you are done. 7- Arrangements were not easy and not all people talking english. All of these Faced in executive suite so what do you expect in the other rooms. I'll never recommend this place to any human or even animal.

review_content: We had a week long stay at the Regal Hong Kong. The experience was a pleasant one except for minor hiccoughs at the front desk, where people appeared rather unfriendly and cold. The BIG advantage of the hotel is the location, as it is located at the heart of commercial center and has an easy access to subway making travel across Hong Kong easy and inexpensive. Unlike the front desk, the room service and travel desk service though was excellent. Rooms were good, gold tainted with lot of mirrors, which was disconcerting at first. Roof top swimming pool was great. Breakfast was ok and wished it had some Indian items, we being vegetarians. Overall we had a great time staying at the hotel.

date: Kerr Lee wrote a review Aug 2013
review_content: HK hotels are small, and it was tough looking for one which could accommodate 3 to a room, but the Regal HK was comfy, clean and convenient. The street across the hotel has a coffee joint and some interesting good hole in the wall cafes. Service staff are pretty friendly and the breakfast which we had daily at the hotel was not too bad. They do provide an adaptor for travelers and free wifi. Thing to improve is the shower facility, the drainage hole is not big enough and the shower floods if the water cannot be drained away quickly. Making it very slippery. Overall, decent and I would probably stay again.

We recently booked a few nights in Hong Kong on the way home from a holiday in Vietnam. We chose the Regal Hong Kong largely because of the location. The hotel is right on the tram line that runs through Hong Kong and is a short walk from the Times Square shopping area. My wife had become ill during our trip to Vietnam, but the Regal staff made sure we were comfortable and helped us with doctors and extending our stay despite being heavily booked at the time. The hotel is very busy, but the management and staff couldn't have been more helpful. Particular thanks to David Wong and Mon Chow for all their help in re-organising our room requirements. The room we had was excellent, with all we needed. Staff gave us tips on where to shop and how to get around. The regal is also one of…

review_title: Classy place with a great location
review_content: I dont usually pay as much as I did for a hotel, but Hong Kong is expensive and this hotel has a tremendous location. Just minutes from the Causeway Bay exit of the MTR. The room had all the comforts one could ask for. We didn't use the dining facilities, so I cannot describe them. The staff is well trained and pleasant. My only complaints are: 1. There is one plug (in the bathroom) to charge any appliance. 2. The minibar is so outrageously priced, that you would be a loon to use it (there is a 7-11 almost across the street that is open 24 hrs). Otherwise, a very comfortable room.

review_title: Tacky Hotel with Rude and Scheming Staff
review_content: I went to this hotel given the location and the fact that it had a pool. July in HK is very hot and this won me over. Given it was a business trip, it was paid in full by my company upfront once the booking was made on a hotel booking site. When I got to the hotel, I was told that the payment was not received (despite the booking confirmation stating the opposite). They would not accept this booking confirmation, so as a compromise they put my card down as a security in case the payment never came through. Once I got to the room, I found that they had given me a twin room, rather than the double promised by them. Everything was over-extravagant for a regular hotel, featuring heavy gold trim on everything, rather large and hideous art works on every wall of the room. The TV was…

(1) Location: Excellent - probably, the prime selling point for this hotel. Less than 5 minutes' walk to Times Square, Causeway Bay Grand Sogo and MTR Station. The tram stopped exactly in front of the hotel. (2) Room: We were lucky as the hotel was just refurbished months before our arrival. We were upgraded to a deluxe room. I liked the lighting in the room - the natural light gave a cheerful tone to the room. The room size was good for a hotel located at Hong Kong Island. We still had quite some space after adding in the extra bed. The bathroom was clean and surprisingly, with a small bathtub and separate shower. (3) Value: Hotel rates in Hong Kong are on the high-side generally. For a 5-star hotel located at Causeway Bay - the price was reasonable although I would say…

Location. It is near the MTR Causeway Bay station, probably a 5-minute walk from the hotel. It is also walking distance to SOGO where you can shop but prices are still higher than CityGate in Tung Chung. Food. Not too many selections but food is not that bad. I asked for hot cocoa every morning and they always have it ready for me. Room. Just perfect, no complaints.

Made a wrong booking here, and called immediately to sort out the problem, but the hotel was completely unhelpful and charged the full amount for the booking -- a complete absence of goodwill or friendliness shown and a real disappointment.

date: Chris J "Mohawk" Reed wrote a review Aug 2013
review_content: Loved the experience at the Regal Hong Kong, nothing went wrong and they delivered on everything said they would! Can't ask for much more than that. I stayed at the Club Executive Lounge which is great value and great service. You get high floor, free breakfast and free cocktails/dinner and exclusive checkin/out. Service is excellent though a little impesonalised but the do everything you could ask and are very polite. Room and hotel reminds me of the Great Gatsby film with Leonard DiCaprio that has just come out, all mirrors and gothic! Bling is the key and the mirrors are disconcerting when you walk out onto the main floor but very cool in the bedroom, gives the impression of more space and works. Great location in Causeway Bay, easy to shop, eat out and get MTR to…

date: james l wrote a review Jul 2013
review_content: a very smart and helpful staff ready to lend her time when you needed it most!!!..as i was trying to reserve my seats for our flight back via Cathay Pacific.....my free wifi ran out...but Ms. Mon Chow incidentally lend her time and did the reservation...what a big help!!!....not all hotel staff in hongkong do these kind of stuff......i highly recommend REGAL hotel......reasonable price and strategic in location....

date: Bo T wrote a review Jul 2013
review_title: Good location! A club floor with pleasant stay
review_content: A lobby on the 1st floor, a bit small. Even, i arrived around 3pm. there was super crowded, many guests in a very long line which took me standing for more than 30minutes and just only 5minutes for the check-in. Overall convenient and easy to approach, i recommend this hotel. All staff were very helpful, great location, nearby causeway bay shopping.. I stayed on executive floor, all included which made me feel very comfortable and safety even i was here alone.

date: Julie D wrote a review Jul 2013
review_content: The Club Level has a lounge which offers buffet breakfast (cereal, bacon, sausage and 2 other hot items but not usually eggs, juice,tea, coffee, toast, fruit loaf, pastries, cold meat and cheese) It is basic but adequate. Breakfast finishes at 1030. Complimentary beer, soft drinks and wine are available from 5pm - not full bar - again basic but adequate. 2 hot items (dim sum) cold pastries and chips and nuts are also available with some light salad type items as well. The lounge has a view of the surrounding buildings and mountains - it doesn't face the harbour but is on the 31st floor so still an interesting view. The staff are lovely. The lounge is small but is never really crowded with comfy chairs and nice furnishings. I would recommend it. There are 2 computers for general…

date: Ian M wrote a review Jul 2013
review_title: Very Pleasant staff, but hotel a little dated
review_content: We were upgraded to a room with club amenities, and generally treated very well. The hotel is dated and the staff try very hard to make up for that. Kenneth in the club in particular was very kind to our two children and offered lots of advice for sight seeing. Our room was in very good condition, although the bathroom was a little small, but some very nice artwork in the rooms and corridoors. Anything that was wrong with the room was fixed immediately. The things that make it hard for such an old hotel to come up to modern five star standard are the very small rooftop pool, spa not working, a quite restictive "free" wifi system, a very small club area and no choice of included breakfast in club or downstairs. It must be in the club with very good service but a tiny buffet…

Good points: 1) Close to causeway bay station 2) Staff are very hardworking and helpful Bad points: 1) Small room and bathroom (though that's a given in Hong Kong) Not much to comment because I did not spend much time at the hotel, I was out all day and would only come back to rest. When ever I did come in contact with the staff, I was very happy with the speed and quality of their service. Yes I would come back and stay here again!

Fantastic hotel but doggy punters. Rude punters monopolise the sunbathing chairs. The other guest not even arrive yet. thought is 1st come 1st serve basic. end up back to the room. Only 4 for whole hotel. Tiny pool.

date: sol y wrote a review Jul 2013
review_title: lobby more like a train station
review_content: When we arrive around noontime, the place was crowded with luggages, guests both trying to check in and check out, with long line crowded in the small and narrow lobby. More like a busy train station ticket counter than a hotel lobby. We were not able to get a room until 3 pm. was asked to have lunch on the 2nd floor, which end up costing about USD100 for a 4 persons dimsum lunch. Food so so, but expensive as compare to other Chinese restaurant around the corners Free wifi, great, unlike other hotel in the area that charges expensive daily or hourly wifi. Good location in Causeway Bay area. They gave free breakfast during their 20th anniversary celebration.

No seats in the lobby. You will have to wait for your tours standing. If you can not bear mirrows don't stay in this hotel. There are tons of them everywhere even in trash cans. Spacious rooms and bathrooms but poor taste. Very good location.

review_content: We stayed for 3 nights here. Likes: - Location as it was an excellent base for Causeway Bay shopping, and is near the subway and trams. - Rooms were spacious enough and comfortable though the first night we could here the TV blaring in the next room. When I called the hotel's attention, it was addressed immediately and we didn't encounter anymore noise. - It is in the same building complex as Fuxing - a Michelin 2 star dimsum restaurant - and Din Tai Fung. Literally excellent Chinese food at your doorstep. - Friendly staff. Though busy with lots of check ins and groups, they do make the effort to accommodate all your needs. - Free shuttle to and from airport! Didn't like as much: - I appreciated the free in-room wi-fi but why in the world they decided to limit this to 2…

date: Ari H wrote a review Jun 2013
review_content: The regal extremely convenient for shopping and exploring the city. The staff was always eager to asist. The rooms were spacious for Hong Kong. The atmosphere was always very releaxed and peaceful. It was a very international place. During breakfast you can always see a different nationality.Overall very pleasent stay at a very convenient place. Thanks.

review_content: We stayed at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel for a week on the executive floor. We found it to be comfortable, great location and the staff were very helpful. The hotel is in walking distance to heaps of shopping which was great.there is also a train station very close, we found this to be the easiest and quickest way to get around. The regal is a beautiful place to stay. The room we stayed in was on the 34th floor with a wonderful view. Everything was clean and we came home to a freshly cleaned room each afternoon which was lovely.

review_title: In Causeway Bay and close to shopping and public transportation
review_content: Location: Located in Causeway bay, close to times square and other stores and also to Public transportation (mtr, tram, bus) Reception: The service is typically slow in some parts of Asia or the way how they start the conversation with the guests. So nothing to be surprised about and they Just do their job with out any smile on their face. Rooms: They are pretty decent and no doubt they need an upgrade. It is always crowded for the time I stayed, have to wait for the elevators for long time, it is always packed and Lot of Asian and International Visitors. The room size is very good for Hong Kong as space is premium and had great views (20th Floor). The basic amenities are included ( Tiny fridge, wet bar, water boiler, safe, etc) No rice cooker like in Japan. Bathroom: Stayed…

review_title: good location, friendly staff, good service
review_content: we spent the last 3 nights of our honeymoon here following 2wks in Thailand. As we had booked an executive club room we had free transfers from and to the airport & seperate checkin. We were able to use the club longe where there were drinks & snacks available throughout the day. The location of the hotel was great for everything we wanted to do. Kevin in the executive lounge was a great host, asking our plans each day & enquiring if we knew how to get to our destination, providing maps if not. He then asked the following day how we'd got on. We made use of the roof top pool which is undergoing a refurb but this didnt effect us. Great view from the panoramic windows in our room.

date: David D wrote a review Jun 2013
review_content: I've stayed at the Regal Hotel Causeway Bay a number of times and it seems as time goes by service and amenities are lipping badly. The rooms desperately need an upgrade or at least a good clean - mould in the shower recess, cracked tiles and a tired feel really don't attract people to this hotel. and then there's the checkout. Nearly 30 minutes checking out while they cancelled the deposit (why do they need this when you're a loyalty member), check the bill several times by two or more staff, give you the bill to sign and then start the process of processing your credit card. And this was not a peak departure period and there were 4/5 staff!!! Can't believe it's the same chain as the Regal Airport which it fantastic. Time to lift your game!

review_content: We stayed at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel for 10 nights, and we had a fabulous stay. We paid extra for the Executive Club, and it was WELL worth it with a very good breakfast and happy hour included. We were delighted when we were assigned a room on the 34th floor (top floor), with the very high ceilings and a view of the harbour. The room was very spacious and bright, and we felt quite at home. The bathroom is spacious and we loved the shower with L'Occitane products. The vanity lighting could be brighter, and it would help if there was a plug in for a curling iron in the bathroom, but we made do. The staff in the Executive Club were absolutely fabulous! Kris Chue the manager makes a point of getting to know all of the guests by their names, and she was so helpful in many respects…

They know when is the right time to approach you when a guest need assistance. I also love their concierge services. However the constant adverse changes of the Regal Reward Program have placed dent to the superior services rendered by the club floor and concierge.

review_content: For a business trip to Hong Kong we spent about 5 nights at the Regal Hotel on Hong Kong island. The Regal is situated on the eastern side of Hong Kong Island, not far from Times Square and other shopping centres (but there is shopping everywhere in Hong Kong...). Public transport like cable car and underground is near. We got a good deal for one of the Club Rooms, which are located at the three upper floors of the hotel. The rooms were very spacious indeed, and equipped with everything you might need in a five star hotel. As a club guest, you also have access to the club lounge, where you can enjoy (free!) drinks and small snacks. Breakfast was good, staff was friendly, but not always fully professional and maybe a bit inexperienced. There is a swimming pool on the top floor,…

He insisted we booked for 5 rooms despite us showing him our prepaid service voucher showing clearly we paid for 4 rooms. He was banging his papers and mumbling in Chinese clearly in a foul mood. We had a long trip and I told him we are so tired and he arrogantly said "I am also tired " After do much insistence we booked 5 rooms, he said he will check with reservations only to find out we are correct as the voucher is for 4 rooms. He made us wait for almost an hour suffering his arrogance, disrespect and simply RUDE service. Can the management of Regal Hong Kong hotel remind their staff b about customer…

review_content: We spent 4 nights at this lovely property early this month. This was my 6th time of staying at Regal HK in the last 10 years. I've always had a very positive experience. Reception and Bell desk staff are always nice, efficient, and very friendly with a warm smile. The room is very clean and well-appointed. The location is very good as well, close to the Sogo, Time Square and plenty of local HK style cafes and a variety of restaurants within walking distance. Communication with the hotel was good also, Kathy helped us reconfirm our room type and arranged our airport shuttle transportation. Highly recommend...really enjoyed our stay as usual.

review_content: The Regal Hotel at Causeway Bay fulfilled our every need on our recent stay in Hong Kong. We spent 9 nights at the Hotel (in early May) in an Executive Room and were not disappointed. The rooms are of a reasonable size for HK and ours was very light and airy with a view at night of the lights of Causeway Bay and Hong Kong Harbour. The decor is a little glitzy but not unbearable. Our only complaint was a temperamental aircon and the water pressure in the shower could have been better. We did have a small problem one day with the toiltet plumbing and this was attended to within an hour of us reporting it. You cannot ask more than that. The highlight is definitely the staff, particularly on the Executive Floor. Check in was smooth and from then on we were definitely treated…

review_content: Nice hotel, not too big yet feels spacious. Staff are very friendly and very efficient. Great bonus is they have a free shuttle to and from the airport, which is very convenient, but make sure you pre-book your seat, especially before your arrival to Hong Kong. Rooms are quite big and very "blingy". By that I mean there were more mirrors than I have ever seen in a hotel room, but it felt tasteful. Nice window seat too, that made the room feel even larger. I was lucky that they gave me free in-room wifi for my entire stay, which I think should be included in all hotels these days anyway, but I think they normally have free wifi in the lobby. The bathroom was well fitted with a separate shower and all the usual goodies. The hotel is well located within very easy reach of the MTR…

review_content: Couldn't tell if the hotel was originally designed that way or if it was a refurbished old hotel. Anyway, rooms were spacious, service was good, can't complain about anything in the hotel. The area is Causeway Bay which is quite busy anytime. Lots of great restaurants to choose from in the area. But I still prefer Tsim Tsa Tsui area which is a bit more quiet and spacious. But if you like smaller streets, Causeway area is just fine.

review_title: Executive club floor service is excellent though the housekeeping needs lots of improvement
review_content: We had the opportunity of staying on the executive floor suit this time in Hong Kong. We were grossly surprised the bathtub was not clean when we checked in. The executive floor team was quick to action. A house maid was sent to our room right the way. The rest of the stay was excellent, the team of the executive floor sure made our stay memorable! Special thanks to Kenneth, Remy and the management team Betty and Kris. We will sure stay with this hotel and on the executive floor next time!

The Club Lounge was very comfortable, and there were always staff members around to assist. Kris, the Club Manager introduced herself on the first day when we arrived, and she was very responsive to all our needs throughout our stay. I was impressed with her willingness and ability to deal with difficult requests or questions, no problem was too hard for her to find a solution to. When she was not around, her team were kept well informed of our needs and were able to follow through in her absence.…

review_content: Stayed here with a large group of our family. The hotel staff was very very accommodating. They attend to your every need. When you need something, all you have to do is ask, and it'll be delivered to your doorstep as quickly as possible - a feature most hotels couldn't do easily. The bathroom is very clean as well as the entire bedroom. Bedroom is even big enough for a family even. Very spacious. Here are the flaws: I sort of found their twin beds a little small though. When we went down to my parents' room after a day out around the city, we found a cigarette butt in their room. Seems like the one cleaning the room was smoking. To think that smoking was not allowed on their floor or room. Our group, since most were first timers in Hong Kong, we had booked a tour to guide…

date: Kayte W wrote a review Apr 2013
review_title: Great hotel if you get a good deal
review_content: i got a last-minute deal for 7 days at 50% off the usual price so i stayed in a 4 star hotel for the price of a HK hostel ;-) I had a 27th floor room with a fabulous view of victoria park and victoria harbour. Bed is comfotable and everything in the room you could possibly need ;-) Fabulous location - 5; minutes from causeway bay station and amazing shopping all-round. Definitely go to the ground floor dim sum restaurant - so amazing i've been 3 times and luckily haven't had to line up once... occassionally i've seen massive queues. Rooftop pool is gorgeous but it's been raining and a bit cold since i arrived unfortunately! i'd probably stay in mongkok area next time but recommend this hotel if you're in causeway bay.

date: neil d wrote a review Apr 2013
review_content: Excellent room, very large by HK standards, partial view over Victoria Harbour and overlooking Victoria Park. Bed extremely comfortable, bathroom lacked nothing. Free in-room internet connection - a lot of places in HK charge. My partner was coming in from USA and hotel has free shuttle to/from airport, so was very convenient. One criticism is that unless you're spending money there's no public area to sit. My partner sat reading in what is billed as a lounge area and was told that unless she wished to order some food or drink she had to leave - very disappointing! Had the weather been less inclement she could have gone to the rooftop pool area which is very comfortable, but not practical during thunderstorms! Overall a very good hotel, convenient for the vast array of shopping…

review_content: Regal Hongkong was my first overseas stay. July 2005. It had every thing I could wish, in a good hotel. Beautiful room, good view from the room, very good privacy, good location.Only problem was the room service menu. It did not indicate the complete details. Being Indian and first overseas visit, that too in Asian country, needed an Indian food. Its one dish, Indian vegetable curry, did not indicated, that it is served with rice. On first order, I ended up ordering the rice seperately.It was huge quantity. But the Food was good. I enjoyed the stay. Never got an opprtunity to stay again, there.

review_content: We moved to The Regal after 2 nights in another hotel(which was unsatisfactory )..The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the service provided could not be faulted especially,Kris on the 31st floor reception, and the waiters in the executive room.We were pleased to sleep on a comfortable bed after having what felt like a slab of concrete in ShenZen. We would definitely stay there again..A very pleasant stay..

review_title: Perfect for Sevens, hard beds and Din Tai Fung (Yum Cha)lovers!
review_content: Recently renovated the Regal is ideal for the HK Sevens otherwise its probably not high on my list of hotels. A major drawcard is the Din Tai Fung restaurant in the lobby level - if you haven't tried this Yum Cha restaurant chain then you've missed something - highly recommended. Club level is a bit disappointing with a very average breakfast and limited drinks selection in the evening. Staff are very friendly and do make an effort. Beds are very hard even by China standards.

review_title: Beautiful Room, Free Wifi, Good Breakfast, but, Bites on Legs in Bed
review_content: Pretty room, free Wifi, breakfast included, but, I had bites on my legs for the 7 nights I stayed, and so did a colleague three doors down from me on the same floor (23, I believe). I didn't see any signs of bed bugs (no dead bugs or bug casings or tiny bits of blood on sheets), but, the bites and itching went away when I checked out. I thought I was just allergic to the detergent the hotel uses to wash the sheets, but, I didn't have any marks on my face or neck, just my exposed legs in bed; and, BBs didn't occur to me until I checked out. A colleague a few doors down had the same experience. So, I don't know if i had BBs, but, what I experienced certainly seems close to it.

date: M C T wrote a review Mar 2013
review_content: First of all, very unfriendly personal at the reception desk, and very deposite for a short stay. I arrived at 10 a.m. and was told that their check in is at 2 p.m. (at least they took care of my lugage. Everything is on extra charge they even the charge for internet use and don't forget the electrical outlet adapter (international adapters don't work here) It took them almost 45 minutes and three calls to get one. Room was very small for the very high price. Air condition was not working properly and therefor the room was running at a very low temperature, caught a cold. I never will book this hotel again and will tell the company also not to do so. The only positive are the nearby transport facilities.

review_content: Good hotel on Hong Kong Island, 10 minutes walk from the Rugby Stadium. Clean and comfortable rooms. My major gripe is that they charge HK$130 per day for wi-fi when many hotels offer this for no charge. The breakfast is good and plentiful.

review_title: Good location, fine for a short stay
review_content: I stayed here on business from 19 to 22 March 2013. I paid extra for a room on the executive floor. This gives access to the exec lounge, which is OK for a quiet drink after a long day, but the breakfast is very limited. I dont understand why they dont give you the option of taking breakfast in the main breakfast resturant. The room was a fair size and comfortable, but there seemed to be a lot of mirrors, everywhere which made it feel like the "bling was overdone". Coffe making facilities, etc are provided. On my second night I noticed a strong smell, that was like sewage, but running water and closing the bathroom door seemed to contain this. As I had a busy schedule I was not in the room other than to sleep and wash / change, but had I had some leisure time, i would have…

response_content: Dear Guest, Thank you for sharing your experience with us and worldwide travellers. We are glad to read your positive comments about our location. Once again, thank you for staying with us and we hope to serve you again in the near future. Sincerely, Glynis Chan Marketing Communication Manager

review_content: Recently stayed at the Regal, Very centrally located if you want the Hong Kong side. Easy access to trams, buses and inexpensive taxis. Amenities include beautifully well appointed rooms, luxurious bedding, modern baths and all amenities, coffee maker, toiletries, robes, slippers, etc. Lobby is outstanding and beautiful roof top pool. Staff very firensdly and speak Engilsh!

review_title: Ok, but probably will not return
review_content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights. Decor is a bit gaudy (- then again, we tend to prefer more sleek and modern) and while the room was large by Hong Kong standards, it showed signs of aging. Shower leaked all over the bathroom floor and so it was no surprise that the room smelled a bit musty. Stay here if you need to be in Causeway Bay and you get a good rate; otherwise, look somewhere else.

review_content: Booked this hotel through Agoda. Recommended if looking at value-for-money accomodation in CWB HK especially during peak periods. The hotel costs only half of those just across the road. Rooms are huge by any standard. Equally convenient near MTR, ding ding tram and surrounded by food and shopping.

review_content: A good stay in the executive floor. A warm and kind assistance from the front desk staff (Joyce) makes a good start in accommodate in this hotel. The room setting is good and the view is excellent and I can have a good view of the Victoria Park and its neighbors.

date: jfssss s wrote a review Mar 2013
review_content: We spent few nights at the Regal causeway bay, was shocked by the queue of check in and check out. The front desk girl Joyce is sweet and helpful, she also invited us to join their rewards program so that next time I can book from the regal website to enjoy free in-room internet (this hotel charge $130 for internet per day which is a bit pricey!!) Overall, this is a nice hotel with reasonable price and good location, MTR station is just nearby. The only complain why there are no seats at the lobby to rest.

review_content: Conveniently located from Causeway Bay MTR with a good view of Victoria Park. Hotel is served by bus H2 if you were to take the airport Express service; trip took 15 mins to/fro despite the Sat afternoon traffic. Hotel lobby was very crowded with a lot of Chinese guests which meant check in took a long time. However once you are up to the floors, the place seems quieter. Room is spacious with a large rest room. Basic TV channels with a roof top swimming pool (which I didn't use). Hotel is a good launch pad for traveling around Hong Kong island but beware the crowd at Victoria Park. Super packed!

review_content: Despite the price of this hotel is quite expensive, they however charges for everything!!! 20 Euros almost just for using the internet within their room. Everything in this hotel is controlled by their horniness for money!

review_content: We spent one night living in the Executive Room before our wedding. The hotel room is located at the corner area on each floor, with one large bedroom and one living room insides it. The view is great, looking at the Victoria Park as well as the HK Central Library. The bathroom is a little bit old renovated and some color faded away. However, the hotel did provide its compliment gift, L'occitane shower gel and shampoo, for our use. In general, the staff at the hotel provided their services quite swiftly and politely. Given the good hotel services and its convenient shopping location in Causeway Bay, we would recommend other tourists to try this hotel.

date: Nares K wrote a review Feb 2013
review_content: After so many year of staying at Regal Hong Kong, I have decided to give a club floor a try. To be honest, I did have my doubts if the Executive Club Floor would be as good as other Executive Club Floor in other 5-stars hotels. After 3 days and 2 nights, I have realised that, Executive Club Floor at Regal Hong Kong is a whole lot better!!! Ms. Angela Mak has been very helpful to me. Whatever I need, she would try her very best to fulfill my needs. The best impression, I have from her was the stitching on my trouser became undone and I didn't know what to do. So I bought it down to ask for help. Ms. Angela took my problem trouser away and immediately start sewing. Within minutes, my trouser was hand back to me and it was a good as new!! What an experience to remember! A highly…

review_content: My experience was a business trip. I escorted about 20 people for 4-6 nights in HK. The staff were excellent in general, however the management wanted to argue over every little thing. Great location, rooms are ok for HK as they can be small generally in the 4 star hotels. Definately not a five star. To summaries, staff were very friendly, hotel was acceptable, but would I stay there again. Probably no, as you have a lot to chose from and I found there management very unfriendly and not easy to work with especially when you are looking after a group. There was no flexibility at all.They need to learn or take example from there own staff.

review_content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel as I was attending my Aunt's funeral. I booked the 'Free breakfast offer' that was, ironically, a pop-up window here on Tripadvisor. Whilst the hotel is in a convenient location (Times Sq, Victoria Park and the C'way Bay MTR station just a stones throw away), it's the complete lack of inflexibility, pettiness and quite frankly appalling customer service that lets this establishment down hugely. To cut a very long and boring story short, I simply wanted to use 2 days worth of breakfast vouchers on one day, for myself and my family on the day of the funeral. We had all traveled from different parts of the globe (Singapore, Perth and UK) and it seemed to make sense to eat together that morning. I was told…

Arriving at this hotel and how the shuttle had to negotiate entry to the front, plus seeing the frenzy in the lobby on entering, with all the "in your face" lights, glitz, and colour, made me shudder and ask myself "Why did my wife and I book in here?" My first shock was compounded when I saw where the registration desk was situated literally "off" the lobby, and in the area's relative smallness, one had to line up to check-in, with quite a wait. Then I remembered it was the Chinese New Year, hence everyone rushing around. Also, I was reminded how long it has been since last being in Hong Kong/Kowloon. Things certainly have changed somewhat over the years, so this Westerner had to make some changes of approach to how life functions, for sure. My concerns were allayed when the…

date: Rahul S wrote a review Jan 2013
review_content: Stayed at the Regal for the first time in the 3rd week of January; slightly old decor with mirrors everywhere in the rooms except for the ceiling; but comfortable stay - nice clean beds and a fair sized bathroom. The Aircons are old and are noisy, but again they are effective. Cabs were a bit of a problem, but it was morning rush hour, so no major issues. I liked the paintings of Paris along the corridor.

review_content: Hotel is located on the edge of Causeway Bay but a 5 minute walk to the station. Rooms are a little dated and were designed with 80's "bling" in mind - similar to what I see in mainland China. The room overall was clean but my room safe did not work and I asked housekeeping to fix it while I was out but it was still broken when I got back for the night. Lastly, I don't think this would impact most people but if you have internet access included in your rate, it is only for 2 devices - they charge for the 3rd without telling you.

Stayed a night, the people at reception where clever enough to tell me whether I wanted a late check out package plus some extras which came in very handy. Hotel is a bit old, but rooms are well kept and staff is friendly and ready to help, specially Angela, Andy, Kit and Kristy.

review_title: Big, impersonal and in need of an update
review_content: Big rooms with lots of Chinese bling-bling, but in need of an update Indifferent, unwelcoming staff; good chinese restaurant in-house, but for drinks go across the street to JIA's Drawing Room; Close to SOGO

review_title: Beware of your belongings in room closet
review_content: If you think that your clothing would be safe in the hotel room closet, you are wrong! My favorite pair of jeans was stolen from the closet. Yes, brazenly stolen from the hanger in the closet. It wasn’t an expensive pair of jeans nor was it branded. I for once, would not have expected anyone to lay an eye on it but such things do happened at this hotel. So beware folks. Report made to the housekeeping department meant chagrin on our part from their security manager and 2 other manager who searched the whole room, ran through our belongings and even turn the bed up to find, to our amazement, someone’s swimming trunk or the like of it was wedged against the wall. And for that brief moment how I’d enjoyed watching the look of embarrassment from the manager who tried to fish…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Jan 15, 2013
response_content: Dear Guest, We were concerned to learn about your missing pair of jeans during your stay with us. We have conducted an immediate investigation and regret to inform you that your missing item could not be retrieved. We would like to stress that only one room maid has entered your room for make-up service. This particular room maid has been a loyal and long-term associate of our hotel with impeccable records through her employment. We have taken this interrogation very serious and believe that your pair of jeans may have gotten lost elsewhere, but in our hotel. We have taken note of your comment regarding the way your room search was conducted by our associates and apologize, if this was not carried out in a tactful manner. We have meanwhile conducted training on how to assist our guests during such situation in a more discrete way in the future. In the unlikely event your missing item will be recovered, we shall of course inform you immediately. We take this opportunity to wish you a belated Happy and Prosperous New Year! Sincerely Alexander Haeusler General Manager Regal Hongkong Hotel

review_title: Stellar property with some minor gripes
review_content: First of all i'd liketo say that this is a great place to stay. The amenities are top notch and if yu book directly you can get free roundtrip shuttle service from the airport and free (fast!) wired and wireless internet. The bed in the deluxe room is sublime and the room is big enough to accomodate an extra bed. Location is good, very near sogo, times square and if you navigate the sidestreets also near a 24hr wellcome supermarket. However, i'd like to call out to management to please put some waiting areas in your lobby. I did not appreciate the face that we were shoo'd away by the waitstaff at the Tiffany Lounge despite the fact that nobody was dining there. And to add insult to injury they promptly informed us that we need to consume at least hk$300 to be able to sit. …

review_content: Comfy rooms but small (considering the price). About 7-10mins walk to MTR station, depending on "human traffic". My hotel stay included buffet breakfast. Choices of food are plenty but the restaurant is understaffed - my coffee only arrived once I have finished my meals, and that was after many requests and finally, found and asked the head attendant who was "hiding" behind the coffee booth with her handphone!! Refill very slow. Internet connection was slow and for each device, you can get 15minutes of free connection at the lobby every 12hours, strictly. Want more, pay more!! There are no seats at the lobby to rest, for waiting. Suggest looking at alternative places to stay unless you're really desperate

review_content: Stayed here for three nts in November in the club rooms. Having stayed here before we basically knew what to expect and we weren't disappointed. Check in for club rooms is at the top floor of the tower and is very efficient. After going to our room which looked very familiar, I checked with our receptionist who confirmed that we were actually in the same room as our last stay. Breakfast has changed since last time and is no longer in the restaurant but in the club lounge. Bit disappointing as limited options but no real problem. Afternoon cocktail hour is fun with great service from Andy who remembered us from our previous visit. Good location, MTR station nearby and great park across the road for walking. Plenty of shops nearby. The only downside is that it takes two lifts to…

review_content: We recently stayed at the Regal in a club room for 6 nights. The room was large by HK standards, clean, and serviced regularly. The view of Victoria Park and the Harbour was great. We partook of the club lounge each day, and although small, was very adequate. The staff in the lounge were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble for them. Dolphin, Aya and Andy, and the rest of the lounge staff made our time there very enjoyable. The Causeway Bay location is great for shopping and the MTR is only a short walk away. In all, our stay at the Regal Hong Kong was very enjoyable and I would recommend the club rooms.

review_title: A gaudy-looking hotel in a relatively good location to food, shopping and MTR!
review_content: About the hotel space: This hotel is too busy and noisy, as it services big tour groups. Every time I am in a public space of the hotel, there's always hotel patrons shouting and kids running amok. Very very chaotic! About the room: The room is of average size and is rather comfortable. About transportation: It's tough to hail a cab from this hotel. I had to wait for 45 mins at 9am, and I was 4th in line. Very few cabs turn into this hotel. The MTR is about a ten-min brisk walk away, and that is much more reliable than the taxis. About connectivity: Free wifi is available in the lobby, but you have to pay anywhere else. I would not return to this hotel again because of the chaos I saw. A holiday is about relaxing and going back to a place that's quiet to rest, so this…
