Then I have taken up the cleanliness of the Fitness Centre with the team that looks after it to ensure they keep the machines in good order at all times. The carpet is shampooed on a regular basis but we will take special note of your comment. Please accept my apologies for the shortcomings you experienced and we will work harder to become more consistent in our service delivery. I look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to Hong Kong. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: Catherine C wrote a review May 2012
review_content: Modern and spacious room, location near Sogo and Time Square shopping centre. Nearby area many HK cafe and other eating place etc wanton noodle house and porridge. Very unfriendly Lobby area no sofa or chairs to rest or sit for family with children's or infant while waiting for check in or check out. Taxi to Disneyland HK 200 dollars around 45 mins or Ocean Park HK 60 dollars 20 mins.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded May 6, 2012
response_content: Dear Madam Catherine Thank you for your comments about your recent stay with us and I have noted your reference to the unfriendly Lobby. It is something that we are looking into in order to make some improvements but I do hope it did not affect your stay with us too much. I look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to Hong Kong. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: ken n wrote a review Apr 2012
review_content: Got to stay in Regal Hotel, one of my company's panel hotel! Location wise, it's end of the Causeway Bay, a very short walking distance to Sogo and Times Square! The room was a standard room, with a huge LCD TV, fridge with drinks (not free!), same goes to the Internet which is not free, but if you need to use it, go down to the lobby which have free wireless. The room does not have ironing board and iron, so if you need one, call housekeeping. The one down thing about is their room safe, which was out of battery, I didn't bother to get that change as I didn't use it. Bed was comfy and clean. I had good night sleeps all the time, as my room was away from the lift. There are 7-Eleven stores just 3 minutes walk away, so if you need to stock up your food supply, plenty of them…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded May 1, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir Thanks for the nice review on your recent stay with us. I noted your comment on the safety box in the room not working and I am sorry about that. They are normally checked each day but it must have been overlooked. Then for the internet, please book through our website next time and you can enjoy free internet in the room and also free use of the shuttle bus from the airport! Then for the taxis, I know it can be a problem at Peak times but we are working on improving this service. Please accept my apologies for these shortcomings but I hope we will have the pleasure of welcoming you back again soon. Best regards Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: The worst and most overpriced Hotel in the WORLD...
review_content: In all my travels abroad- This is by far the Most overpriced, worst hotel I have ever been to IN THE WORLD. 300$ USD a night, beds that are hard as rocks, small old rooms, internet costs 20usd and up, The hotel's restarurant charged 45$ USD for a crappy salad and soup. This place is the beggest EFING Joke I have ever seen. It's so bad it's like a parody from an SNL skit on absurdly crapy overpriced hotels. It's unreal how bad this is.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded May 1, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir/Madam I am disappointed to read your comments about your recent stay with us but would at least like to respond. All mattresses were replaced last year in the hotel. Yes they are firm and we generally get good comments about that. If a customer prefers something softer, we provide additional bedding on top of the mattress to help. We have completed the refurbishment of well over half the rooms in the hotel and continue to refurbish more this year. I am sorry you were allocated a room that had not yet been refurbished. During peak periods when there is a Trade Show taking place, rates are higher and we do try to allocate guests paying a higher rate to a refurbished room. I am sorry this did not happen in your case. Then for your restaurant visit, I am sorry you did not enjoy the food we served. If you can let me know when you visited and what restaurant you used, I can review the costing. If you have a soup and salad in Café Rivoli, all day dining room, then you would pay no more than US$33 but if you ate in Zeffirino’s, the fine dining room, you would have spent at least US$45. Please let me know so I can check if you were charged correctly. I would like to apologize for the poor experience you have related on line but hope you will give us the chance to make amends on a future trip to Hong Kong. Please contact me directly for the arrangements so that I can make sure you are well looked after. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: We stayed for 4 nights with a baby ( 18 months). We had great pleasure in this hotel. When you come in, there is a very comfortable smell of a fresh parfume in the lobby. When we arrived, there was no queue and could check in very quickly. The room was nice with an outstanding bathtub in the bathroom ( round and very big). I enjoyed it particulary. The location is also very good, in the heart of the very animated Causewaybay, with lots of restaurants and shopping in the neighbourhood. We had breakfast everyday in the coffeeplace in the lobby ( we had no breakfast included), with very kind staff, especially with our baby. We did not test the pool because of the weather.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Apr 28, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir Thank you for posting this positive comment about your stay at Regal Hongkong Hotel. We really appreciate you taking the time and it does act as an encouragement to our associates as well as potential customers! We look forward to welcoming you back again on your next visit to Hong Kong. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: John S wrote a review Apr 2012
review_content: I woke to find no hot water in shower. No apology, not sure if they have fixed for tomorrow. "free Internet" in lobby is only free for 2 hours total from the time you first access it. If you are there 4 days & access when first arrive, no free Internet for the next 3+ days! When it doesn't work don't think they will waive fee for room access, the Mgr showed no concern at all for the lack of the lobby Internet working, forcing me to use the paid service for a few minutes. He refused to take charge off, even knowing from employee I complained to & showed the service not working. Another note, the food in this hotel is mediocre for a high price. The area of Hong Kong offers little so if you want shopping or dining, try another area. Will update further when I try to get I Prefer…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Apr 16, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir I was very sorry to read about the problems you experienced during your recent stay with us. Hot water should always be readily available at all times and I must apologize that you were inconvenienced in this way and that no one got back to you with an apology. For the internet service in the Lobby, this should have been handled better and I have taken this up with the department concerned. Please let me know which outlet you experienced mediocre food in as we work very hard to offer good quality food in all our Restaurants and without more information it is difficult to take corrective action. Please accept my apologies for our shortcomings. Causeway Bay is known for its shopping and dining and as a result is a very popular destination for both visitors and locals alike. Please do give us the chance to make amends for the disappointment of your last visit and get in touch with me directly for better arrangements at the hotel. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Good but not exactly 5-star quality except for the Club Rooms.
review_content: The moment I arrived at the Regal Hong Kong, I was overwhelmed with the crowd at the lobby. Boy, was it crowded and noisy! Thankfully, I was booked on the club floor so i was immediately guided to the private check-in on a different level. I felt like I entered a different hotel altogether. The floor was more tastefully decorated and all the staff were extremely attentive and helpful. The room was a good size given that this is Hong Kong and the hotel is located at Causeway Bay! Bed was very comfortable. Location is excellent as the hotel is located just about 5 minutes walk to the main shopping belt in Causeway Bay. Food is never a problem with many cafes and local eateries around the hotel. For the Karaoke fans, there is a huge Karaoke just across the hotel to croon…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Apr 16, 2012
response_content: Dear Ms. Aileen Thank you for your very positive comments about the hotel, especially the Executive Club Floor. I have noted your comment about the Lobby and yes, it can get very busy when we have a lot of functions going on, people accessing the Restaurants and then of course arriving and departing guests sometimes clash! We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Hong Kong. Best regards Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Basic 5 star hotel suitable for older uncle
review_content: Plus : - The size of rooms was okay - Facilities in rooms was quite nice, coffee machine, automatic curtain Minus : - The design & style are more suitable for my 60 years old uncle :D - Bed was terrible, 160 x 200, too small for 2 persons, I couldn;t really sleep well as I could feel the spring on my back. - service wasn't so great, no one is greeting us when we arrived, and no smile on the receptions. - Waited for about 1.5 hours for hotel shuttle bus to take us to the hotel. -Many things are for sale in the room iincluding mouthwash :) On my next visit, I will not choose this hotel again and I will not choose Causeway bay Area as it is too crowded, think this area has been dominated by mostly maids in the weekend
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Apr 16, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir Thank you for the positive comments about our hotel! However, I really want to address the areas where you were not happy. Can you please let me know which room you stayed in? We replaced most of the beds last year so they should all be in excellent condition and it sounds as though you were allocated a room with a queen sized bed. There are plenty of rooms with a king size bed and we would be happy to allocate you one should you change your mind about visiting us again. Yes the design in some of the rooms is maybe a little old fashioned but we do try and keep them in good condition and I am pleased you have rated the cleanliness of the room quite highly. Then I have spoken to the Front Office team again about the importance of making our guests feel welcome especially on arrival and this will be reinforced with them. For the shuttle bus, we run the service every 90 minutes or so and I am sorry your arrival at the airport did not coincide with a regular departure. We are looking into improving the frequency of this service. Then I am sorry you did not enjoy staying in Causeway Bay and yes, it does get quite crowded especially over the week ends. Please accept my apologies for the areas where we did not meet your expectations and do let me know if you change your mind about returning to the Regal Hongkong on your next visit to Hong Kong. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: Robert A wrote a review Apr 2012
review_content: A perfectly located hotel with an excellence of service. Specially recommend staying at the fabulous executive floor rooms! You will have a very preferential service and their manager Ms Angela Mak is the most helpful and efficient person you will find in the business. Excellent views from the rooms as well as from their Zeffirino restaurant. She go extra miles to show me the Suite and bok thru Regal web is good price. Thanks
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Apr 18, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir Thank you for taking the trouble to write-up your comments after your recent visit to the Regal Hongkong Hotel. We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed your stay with us and your feedback helps motivate us to continually work on improving our standards. In particular we appreciate your comment about our services on club floor and location. With the well-developed transportation network around the hotel, it provides great convenience to our guests for getting around everywhere in the city on their leisure and business trip. Also, we are pleased to inform you that a credit has been awarded to Angela on her appraisal for their good and professional services. Please do have a look at our website for more details about Regal Hotels International, especially the great deals offered when booking through our website. The promotion that you enjoyed is still on which included complimentary internet in the room and free use of the shuttle bus to and from the airport. Thank you for your support of the Regal Hongkong and we look forward to welcoming you back soon. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: GUEST INJURED - 1Star Treatment by supposed 5Star Hotel
review_content: I stay in Hong Kong regularly and the standard of hotels is excellent. Personnel in Hong Kong hotels can never do enough for you. However, at this hotel I sustained an injury by falling in the shower. The floor of the shower is not suitable for the purpose it was designed - extremely slippery when wet. They do provide a small bathmat that is inadequate for the area of the shower floor. As a direct result of the hotel's failure to secure the safety of the shower for their guests, I fell and severed an artery in my wrist (I am only 34 years old so this is not expected). The injury was of a serious nature and all Duty Manager’s showed concern and agreed taht the bath mat was too small for the shower area when they inspected it. I had to attend the hospital and a Doctor gave me…
response_title:
Response from Isabella L, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Mar 25, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir With reference to this report I would like to comment as follows. You allege that the showers are not suitable for the purpose they were built for but they have been in use for many years without any incidents like you have reported. We provide a bath mat for the shower so we do in fact show concern for the safety of our guests. As you well know, our associates went out of their way to assist you when you had your accident but you have misconstrued our willingness to help as acceptance of liability. I spent some time with you going over exactly what happened and it was an unfortunate accident but it was not caused by any negligence on the hotel’s behalf. I do hope you make a speedy recovery from your accident and you are of course welcome to return to Regal Hongkong Hotel. Best regards Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: This hotel is about pay and pay! I booked with a early check in option and arrived from US a the hotel around 10am, and had to wait at the lobby until 2 pm to be able to check in. Internet access, have to pay extra I took the shuttle to airport on return, I have pay extra 130. Because I booked the room with 3 people, I got one with king size bed, but the shuttle say the room is for 2 people, so had to pay for another head to take the shuttle.

Stayed five nights on a business trip/convention. Arrived early and got the upgrade to the Exec. Floor/Room. So I could get into my room a little earlier. Good size room & bathroom (for Hong-Kong). Had all the bids and pieces You would expect and it all worked. The décor is very interesting, Some of the best quality vinyl seats (lounge and lobby) I have seen In years, that combined with the décor of tons of marble, crystal chandeliers etc.. makes this place somewhat funky – Retro. Anyway the staff at reception were typically efficient but cold (check out the painting of the hunting scene at reception that might explain it) The upstairs Exec. Lounge served coffe and drinks, day/night, basic but nice view ( I liked it) The breakfast, included with the Exec. Upgrade was very…

Regal Hong Kong Causeway Bay The non-smoking room on the 16th floor that we had was very spacious; their version of a queen sized bed is substantially smaller than a North American queen sized bed. Some of the room features are a 40” flat paneled TV, in room safe, stocked mini bar at very high prices (10+ times the cost of the local 7-Eleven and Welcome Grocery stores that are within a 5 minute walk of the hotel). The bathroom comes with a decent sized tub and separate shower. Typical amenities: shampoo, bath gel, shower cap, tooth brush and paste, and bar of soap. In other words the room is quite acceptable and comfortable for two, with room to spare. Ying, who was responsible for maintaining our room on the 16th floor, was outstanding, very efficient and thorough at her…

review_title: Cigarette butt and turd got us a free upgrade...
review_content: Friendly staff. Rooms feel quite cramped. We got upgraded because of the prob mentioned in title. I was at a loose end and needed to use the Internet... Which costs 15 euros (170HKD) just to connect!! It's ok... But I wouldn't recommend it given the wide range of choice out there. It was ok value for money because we only paid about 75 euros a night - and for an upgraded room. Any more than that and I'd say "bad deal!!!"
response_title:
Response from Isabella L, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Mar 12, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir / Madam Thank you for taking the trouble to write-up your comments after your recent visit to the Regal Hongkong Hotel. We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed your stay with us and your feedback helps motivate us to continually work on improving our standards. In particular we appreciate your comment about our friendly staff. And we wish to assure you that credit has been awarded to our team on their appraisal for her good and professional services. On the other hand, we regret to learn that a cigarette butt was found in your room assigned. It should not happen in any cases. Follow up action had been taken by the team and the issue was brought up to our management’s attention. We shall ensure that nothing similar should happen again. Please do have a look at our website for more details about Regal Hotels International, especially the great deals offered when booking through our website. The promotion that you enjoyed is still on which included complimentary internet in the room and free use of the shuttle bus to and from the airport. Thank you for your support of the Regal Hongkong and we look forward to welcoming you back soon. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: One of the staffmember fooling me while I wanted to extend my room
review_content: First, I am little bit disappointed, because of the chorus of praise for the staff members which you can read here. Most of them are really friendly and helpful, but what I find out today I never seen in a 5 star hotel before. While wanting to extend my hotel room for another 7 days in the executive lounge as a executive member, the lady on the front desk asked me for the room number and checked my status, seeing I was booking with an travel agency, she didn´t know exactly what to do, so she asked a lady sitting not at a front desk but two seats beside of me, I think she was one of experienced staff doing a break, this lady doesn´t even talked to me, instead of it saying something on Chinese to the front desk lady. So the front desk lady told me I would better book with the…
response_title:
Response from Isabella L, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Mar 12, 2012
response_content: Dear Sir Thanks for bringing this experience at our hotel up and I am sorry to hear that we did not handle your request properly. This has been taken up with the people concerned to ensure these requests are handled correctly and politely. Our customers are very important to us and I am always disappointed when we let someone down like this. We should have taken down the booking straight away and settled the matter. This is our loss that we did not do this. Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience you were put to but do give us a chance to be of service next time you visit Hong Kong. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: Alan B wrote a review Mar 2012
review_content: I am disabled and have found the staff of this hotel very, cheerful and helpful they are only too willing to be of assistance. I must say also my stay at the hotel was very pleasnat and would recommend it as a stop over for travel as I used it.

Whats good? The staff were fabulous. I loved my glorious room (but not the location). I will be back and have learned which rooms not to stay in! (not right next to the lift) Whats not so good? Long check in and out. The internet was pricy when I only used 3 hours of internet. I think they should have an hourly rate. My room was right by the lift and the local chinese speaking ladies were shouting in the corridors at 3am at the top of their voices without a care for other sleeping guests. (although I realise that the Hotel cannot be held responsible for the inconsideration of some people)

I stayed at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel for five nights last week. I won't be going back. It's ok but there are better places to stay. We had four rooms and found the rooms just ok. The beds were small (double). Air conditioning was dodgy ie you couldnt really get it right. The breakfast was ok, but not great. The staff were mostly ok but our experience was ruined by the rudeness of one staff member (Angela Mac) when we arrived. She spoke rudely to us every time we encountered her and when checking in, she spoke rudely about my friend to her colleague several times. All while my friend was still sitting at the desk in front of her. Rude. And very odd. The gym was fine and the location was good. My overall view is that it's an average hotel. I'd only recommend staying there if…

Stayed in October last year for a week. Have been travelling to HK for 4 years on business, usually staying in Wanchai, was looking for something less central and better value. Regal Hong Kong was a great find. Location, service and the executive club facilites all exceeded expectations. I have already booked again to stay in April and will likely stay here again whenever in HK.

I arrived after a journey of almost 24 hours and just wanted a shower, a change of clothes and something to eat. It took about ten minutes to check me in even though I had booked and they kept trying to upsell me to a more expensive room, made me sign about four different credit card vouchers and took about five minutes just to explain how to get the internet to work. All of this when I was so tired I thought I might fall asleep before the process was completed. I ended up going for the upgrade and am not necessarily sure it was worth it. My view was of the boring (ie mountain) side, the free breakfast was pretty pedestrian and the waiter gave away my table while I was waiting for them to fix the coffee machine. When I brought this to his attention he invited me to go and sit…
Breakfast was good so book with this included! Uprgrade definately not worth it.

review_title: Great Services,Nice General Manager and Managers
review_content: We need a special care because of my wife fell down in HongKong and breaking her hip and The Executive Club Floor Manager Angela so caring and so details,The Front Office Manager Ricky so helping with all our special needs because of all our situation and every staffs in The Executive Club went beyond their service. Very special thanks to Mr and Mrs Farmer helping us to make special arrangement to airlines for seat arrangement because of my wife medical cirrcumstances,very caring and good guest services General Manager,he spend over half an hour to slove to problem for my wife, offer good rate for our extend and stay at the same suite room . Only the operator and 88 need to train up for picking at the emergency call I will refer this Hotel to my friends and Hong Kong Trade…

date: Stephen J wrote a review Jan 2012
review_content: We recently stayed here on a business trip in a club room. It was very comfortable and enjoyable. Breakfast was quiet good, though the club room was very basic at night for a drink and service was slow. Overall though we very much enjoyed our stay.

1-block away from Causeway Bay station. relatively large room and bathroom for hong kong. very well maintain. clean. staff helpful despite being very busy that weekend. good sound barrier, can't hear outside traffic nor hallway conversations. same building as Din Tai Fung restaurant, one of the best restaurant in hong kong famous for their steamed buns. very close to shopping areas. in center of hong kong. would stay again. good hotel choice for family, couples, business, or leisure.

date: Stevie S wrote a review Jan 2012
review_title: Great location, excelent services, nice room.
review_content: The hotel is near to 2 malls, a lot of local restaurant, MTR station, free internet access at lobby, delicous breakfast and the room's perfect. It's very convinient

1/ Front desk over selling for an upgrade 2/ Location very noisy 3/ Room very 80's 4/ Internet connection not working but charged! 5/ 20 min hard negotiations at the check-out to get compensated 6/ Curtains in the room must have been hanged 20 years ago 7/ TV light was heavily aggressive and could not be switched off 8/ mouthwash being charged at HKD 18, for a room of HKD 2,450 a night!

review_title: Great 17 day stay at the Regal Hong Kong
review_content: We had 2 rooms (24th floor and recently renovated) here during our entire 17 day visit to HK. I would say for the types of hotel we normally like to stay at, rates went up ~50% to 100% from our last visit 4 yrs ago. Regal Hotel HK offered us a very competitive rate. Glen Farmer, general manager, personally greeted us and asked a few times during our stay whether everything was OK. Hotel even sent a complimentary B-day cake to our room. All staff encountered were helpful and friendly esp Barry (assistant front office mgr) and all the breakfast buffet staff, who knew us quite well since we were up there every morning. While public transit is not directly connected to the hotel, everything is within 5 to 10 min walk. Times Square, Wellcome store, Victoria Park, MTR, trams,…

I stayed at the Regal hotel for business, and found their website very easy to navigate and book a room. I chose the hotel since it was close to my client, and the Causeway Bay MTR train stop helps in terms of connectivity when you feel like a tourist. The hotel is across the street from Victoria Park, and has a north view towards the Harbour. The room was small, but so are most of the rooms at the HK rooms that I stayed previously. The staff was courteous, and the check-in/out process was well managed. The hotel serves a nice breakfast buffet. They have a pool at the rooftop, and a gym in the basement. They have a small business center too for use.

review_title: Nice causeway bay location, beside the tram stop
review_content: Stayed here for a week in Nov11. Room was clean and bright, though a bit small. Just 2 hiccups after we got to the room - the safe did not work, and the toilet seat did not stay up. We had 2 staff come in to repair these, the safe was fixed after 15 min, while the toilet seat would not cooperate even after around 30 minutes of being taken apart, hammered, poked, etc. other than that, housekeeping staff were very friendly and helpful. Check in and check out was very quick and efficient. Best part for me about this place is its location. Its a very short walk to sogo, windsor house, the mtr and victoria park, and around 10 min to times square. It is also right beside the tram's causeway bay terminus and 2 minutes from the general tram stop. When travelling with young…

Booked with Wotif and paid an extra HK$990 for an extra bed. Correction, it's a plywood board with a 2 inch mattress on it. They ran out of rollaway bed that night. Asked housekeeper to put another 2 layers of the same type of mattress but she refused to comply. She can add only more blankets to cushion it. We had to speak to manager (Edgar) whom we must appraise him for making an effort to search for a proper rollaway bed. Room is extremely small and as there's no other bigger room for that night, we make do with it for a night since they are changing room for us the next day. We are pleased with a more decent-sized room but again, the 3rd bed is missing. Here comes the housekeeper again with her plywood board and 2 inch mattress. We were so fearful of going thru' the hassle…

I checked in this hotel on 15 Dec and checked out on 18 Dec. The location was wonderful with a food street nearby, metro in 3 minutes walk and Times Square just across the road. The room given to me was great too! Huge and comfortable. Only flaw, but disturbing, was the super slow reception service. Despite only a few of us in the queue at 4ish pm om a Thursday, I waited close to half an hour for my turn to check in. And to my horror, I was told the room was not ready. No apologies and no explanation. I was told to go for my shopping and returned later. Worst still, they didnt seem to smile at all. I didn't expect Disneyland service, but sometimes a smile was all it needs. I was half joking to my sister, perhaps the company is not paying any bonuses or has a budget cut on…

My favorite hotel if nearby Park Lane hotel gets really expensive. The price is always right and the hotel is near shopping , near mtr and a lot of restaurants. I stayed at the executive floor this time booked through expedia or was it booking.com. Anyway I paid lie usd 220 per night average. The rooms at the executive floor is nice and clean and executive floor manager Angela was very nice and accommodating and so were the staff at this floor . Tracy was also very nice and helpful . The lounge has wine, hot food , sweets and of course coffee and tea. I has the pleasure of meeting glen farmer the general manager .very hardworking and friendly guy. When I complained about the slow wifi, they fixed it immediately . That's service. I will be back in this hotel from dec. 29 to 31…

I stayed at the Regal Hong Kong for 8 nights at the beginning of November. After arriving on a 15 hour flight from Toronto I used the Air Express train to get into the city then connected to a free shuttle bus for the 10 minute drive to the hotel. Everything worked seemlessly. I was so pleased at first with the ease and gracious check-in, then with the large and well appointed room, One of my pet-peeves about hotels is guest rooms with windows that do not open. After inspecting my room, I noticed that the windows could open but were locked. I contacted the front desk and within 5 minutes staff were unlocking the windows. The hotel is well located near the Causeway Bay underground station and on the main tram line. The surrounding area is filled with restaurants, shops and…

I like the fact that it is close to all the buzz of shopping havens! Nothing less for ChicChick! The hotel provides a free shuttle service to Hong Kong station where you can check in your luggage. One negative point is that the shower stall pools up. And I noticed a strand of hair stuck on the wall -- this shows that the housekeeping is not as thorough as what it's supposed to be.

I just returned from a 7 day stay at this hotel, and I can recommend it. The location is almost perfect. It's a 10 minute walk to the subway stations, 2 minutes to the trams and 2 minutes from lots of eating places, and shopping. I highly recommend taking the Trams as they traverse the length of Hong Kong island and are amazingly cheap at 2.30 HKD which is about 30 cents US (!!) and offers a slow, relaxing view of the city. The tram stop is just outside the front door of the hotel. The nearby area is very busy at all hours of the day and is, I suppose, part of the Hong Kong experience. If you prefer Starbucks or McDonalds, they are also closeby. A public sports field and the Hong Kong Central Library are about 5 minutes away. There's a jogging track at the sports field…

This hotel, like most of Hong Kong, is bustling and not friendly place, even the concierge seems to be rushed and have not time to make a person feel comfortable in HK. The rooms are very small and all services, including food, are very expensive. Room was freezing cold and it took 4 hours to get a portable heater. The floor butler did not speak english and was of no help. They charge $20 for wi-fi and the service was impossibly slow speed. The front desk manager was not helpful when I tried to change my reservation. About the only positive things I can say about this hotel is that it is in a decent location and the room was clean. I will not return here.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Nov 29, 2011
response_content: Dear Mr. Ross I am very sorry to hear of your unsatisfactory experience during your recent stay with us. Room sizes in Hong Kong are not as generous as some locations and the size of our rooms is in line with other properties in Causeway Bay. You should not have had to wait for a heater for the room and this has been taken up with the department concerned. English courses are conducted for our associates but from time to time you will come across non English speakers but we are trying to improve this situation. Hotel food prices are also in line for our area as a hotel but of course you can find less expensive options in the area. In the key card you received upon check in, there were also some discount cards you could use in our outlets. I regret that the Front Desk Manager was unhelpful regarding your booking and this has also been taken up with him. We can offer you free wifi if you book through our website and then you will be pleased to know we introduced free wifi in our Lobby from 1 December 2011. Please accept my apologies for the shortcomings you experienced during your stay. Do please give us a chance to show you that we can do better on your next visit to Hong Kong. Please contact me directly for the arrangements and we will do our best to look after you. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY but not good enough breakfast..
review_content: Whenever in HK I would stay at The Excelsior. But it was full so I booked Regal using Agoda.com. I should have booked it through regal's own website because the have better rates & offers. I managed to negotiate with agoda and finally got free shuttle & breakfast for two. We missed the free shuttle and took a cab instead from the airport. We paid around HKD 300. The lobby is really nice. I like it very much. Very elegant & bright. The people were also OK. However, when we showed the voucher, the receptionist did not honor our 'free' breakfast. It is written on the voucher but she said it's not the deal with agoda. So I had to call agoda call center and sorted it out. First day, I didnt get my bfast, as agoda didn't sort it out with Regal. Second day, I was really mad this…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Nov 29, 2011
response_content: Dear Madam Thank you for the positive comments you made about your recent stay with us but I am obviously disappointed that you did not get a good breakfast. I am not why the chef who cooks the eggs for breakfast in the Restaurant was not able to provide you with what you wanted. As you say sunny side up is not hard to do. We will make sure that he is fully versed with this for the future. Please accept my apologies for this shortcoming at breakfast. I do hope you will give us another chance to be of service next time you come to Hong Kong. Please do not hesitate to get in touch to make the arrangements. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: Eric L wrote a review Nov 2011
review_title: Caring hotel and GM, friendly staff, highly recommended
review_content: My wife and I decided to choose Regal Hotel Causeway Bay this time instead of Excelsior to feel a difference on this trip, we read the comments here and was so worried as we wanted to enjoy ourselves and when we come back from our day out, to rest and enjoy the evening together. Mr. Farmer is an excellent host with a strong team in the executive club, special praises to Angela Mak, Minah, Andy, Oscar, Billy and Edgar (very good man - made me felt so welcome with a phone call and then setting up the wifi booster for us) and the rest of the team that made our stay so warm and friendly. We really felt at home with a lot of support and help from the team. The rooms are being refurbished, so there will be noises. When we checked out, the room next to us was having its carpet…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Nov 27, 2011
response_content: Dear Eric Many thanks for the lengthy report on your recent stay with us. The positive comments are an encouragement for us to work harder at looking after our guests and where we got it wrong, we will work harder to make the necessary changes. Please be assured that all the people you mentioned will be commended accordingly. We have now completed the refurbishment work on the rooms for this year and are just finishing the Executive Lounge as well. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit. Best regards Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Great hotel in a fantastic location
review_content: Ok... So I'm just back from a two day night stay at the Regal and despite all the bad trip advisor reviews I read before my stay I must report that I was not only surprised with the hotel but was absolutely delighted with it! First of all the hotels lobby is lovely and I was impressed the moment I entered the hotel doors, then after an easy checkin I made my way to the room where I opened the door to what was simply a gorgeous bedroom - very 5 star indeed. There was a plate of complimentary fruit and chocolates left for me too which was a nice surprise also. The next morning I used the roof top pool which boasts great views of the city. The pool area isn't massive with just a few longers so it I could imagine it could get very busy in the summer months. Its probably important…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Nov 27, 2011
response_content: Dear Pamela Thank you for your positive comments about the hotel during your recent visit to Hong Kong. However I was very sorry to learn of the problems you experienced at the Regal Palace Restaurant. This has been taken up with them to ensure they are more responsive and welcoming. The Restaurant was renovated earlier this year and we have received a lot of positive comments about the new look. Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience you were put to as a result of this experience. I hope we will have the opportunity to welcome you back on your next visit to Hong Kong and we will do our best to ensure you a better dining experience. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: G O wrote a review Oct 2011
review_content: I wouldn't come near this one, there is no way on earth this is 5 star! My shower was full of black hair and shampoo lids. Obviously had not been cleaned in a while. The carpets are stained and dirty and the whole hotel is in need of a massive make up. I would certainly never stay here again and oh internet is HK$170 per 24 hours - crazy rate. I am really annoyed I have even paid for this room at all. You can feel the wires on the bed mattress.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Oct 31, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir I am sorry to learn of the problems you experienced during your recent stay and I apologize for the inconvenience you were put to. The cleanliness of the bathroom has been taken up with Housekeeping and an extra effort is being made to improve our standards. You will be pleased to know that new beds are now being installed in all guest rooms and this will be finished by the end of November 2011. Then next year the balance of the rooms not already completed will also be refurbished to a much higher standard. You should have been allocated a refurbished room for your stay and I am sorry that this was not done. Please do give us an opportunity to serve you better on your next visit to Hong Kong. Kindly let me know when you will be coming so that the necessary arrangements can be made. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: Stayed on 34th floor club floor included breakfast. Booked online for discount. From arrival to checkout service is horrible. Everyone is rude here. I have stayed here many times always on club floor because regular rooms stink and are dirty. Do not book club floor because breakfast is horrible as well. There is nothing to choose from. I keep coming back because I can find a good price online but every time I stay, it pisses me off how rude the staff are, especially on club floor. This is the only hotel in hk that I know of that charges you for an adaptor. Shower has no water pressure. Staying on club floor requires u to exit on 31st floor and take another elevator to 32-34 floors. In the second elevator you have to swipe room card to use elevator, it takes an average of five…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Oct 30, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir / Madam Thank you for bringing to my attention the shortcomings you experience when staying with us. As you are a regular guest here, please contact me on your next visit so that we can address the issues that you have written about. I am aware that we do not always get it right but we are trying to improve the standard of service in the hotel, especially on the Club Floors. You do not have to buy adaptors from us! We are happy to provide you with one for use in the room. If you want to buy a travelling adaptor set, we are happy to sell you one. I will check on the room card issue in the Club Floor lifts as this is the first time someone has brought this to our attention. I hope you will give us an opportunity to make amends on your next visit. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hong Kong

review_content: Same as "Contraidentukl" (A previous regal hong kong hotel reviewer), I am not sure how REGAL HONGKONG HOTEL can be rated as 5-stars!!! It turns out that most people had bad experience with staying in this hotel, including myself!! I'm only staying for 1 night, which is 30-31 Jul yet it turns out to be the biggest nightmare of my life!! I do not have an enjoyable stay in this hotel at all!! According to the hotel check-in regulations, it should be 2pm to check in. We reach the hotel at 2pm+ and after the long winding check-in process..it became 3.13pm, yet WE ARE ONLY GIVEN A ROOM (ROOM 1119) BY 5PM after waiting in the hotel lobby for few hours and somemore is after we screw up your front desk only we are given a room!! The first thing we went into the room, we saw hairs of…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Oct 11, 2011
response_content: Dear Madam Reference is made to your recent stay at Regal Hongkong Hotel and I would like to apologize unreservedly for the shortcomings you experienced. A thorough review has been made about the problems you encountered and I would like to comment on them briefly. We always try to accommodate arriving guests on arrival but sometimes due to the late departure of previous guests, we do not always have the room type available. I realise most guests want to get to their room as soon as possible but when there is going to be a longer delay, we do encourage guests to leave their luggage with us whilst they make better use of their time rather than waiting. I am sorry that we did not alert you to this possibility. The hair in the bathroom is not a standard that we are proud of and more effort is being made to ensure all rooms are properly checked before arrival. Then for the minibar charge, we made a mistake for which I am sorry and the amount has been credited back to your credit card. Should you be returning back to Hong Kong, I would be pleased to make better arrangements for you with us so that we can show you that we can look after our guests well. It is out target to reduce the negative complaints and build a stronger positive image. Judging by the rating provided on the website we have lot more positive than negative comments but still have some way to go to turn this around completely! Please do let me know if I can be of any further assistance. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: I recently stayed in this hotel during a business trip. My colleague booked me a room on the eight floor, which is the first floor with rooms, as I want to stay as close to the ground floor as possible. Other members of our party slept on the top floor. Checking in was very difficult as the receptionist wanted us all to check The room was small, dark and very smelly because of years and years of accumulated cigarette smoke. It showed its age and was screaming for a renovation.The carpet was stained.The bathroom was also small with only a bad (and cheap curtain), basin and toilet. Breakfast in this hotel is even more disappointing than my room was. I opted for an Espresso together with a doughnut. The espresso turned out to be a huge cup of normal coffee, while this was my first…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Sep 22, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir, Thank you for bringing to our attention the shortcomings you experienced during your recent stay. I have checked the room with the Housekeeper and asked him to change the curtain to the bath/shower. This is actually the only room with this arrangement, all others have a separate glass shower enclosure. As the 8F is a smoking floor and you wanted to be on the lowest possible floor, I can understand that there was a lingering smell of smoke. Sometimes quite difficult to remove. You will be pleased to know that we have purchased 2 new machines to help clear the smell of smoke from these rooms. We will also pay special attention to bring this room up to standard as best we can. And yes this floor is scheduled for a refurbishment next year. Then I also went to the Coffee Shop and ordered an espresso and doughnut. I got the espresso so I am not sure why the associate who served you failed to serve you with one. Then I tried the doughnuts and I agree with you they are not very good so we are sourcing better ones. Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience you were put to and if you should be coming back to Hong Kong again, do please let me know so that we can make some special arrangements for your stay. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: I agree with another review that this is a nickel and dime hotel. There is a fee for mouthwash - very tacky. Why even offer the mouthwash in the bathroom if it's not for free? Also, there are only 2 power outlets in the room, which are located next to each other in the corner of the room by the desk. They are 3 prong outlets that my universal travel converter would not fit (and it fit previously that week in another Hong Kong hotel). They have an adapter FOR SALE in the room. Housekeeping had to bring a black box converter, the size of a shoebox, for me to use electricity. It's a joke that it is so challenging for me to just recharge my phone. I would not recommend this hotel for business travel. The rooms are clean and basic, but I think the hotel considers itself a top…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Sep 24, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir I agree the mouthwash should not be put in the bathroom unless it is free. So it has been moved back to the mini bar. Then we have placed 2 power points at the desk for the convenience of guests wishing to work there. We do not have universal plugs in the hotel because they are not approved by the Hong Kong Government department that manages this sort of thing, apparently a safety issue. Yes, we do have an adaptor in the room for sale but we are equally happy to provide one for your use free of charge. Yes, we do have some old transformers and we will be buying some newer ones that are also smaller. And we have also ordered some new multi chargers that will fit most types of mobile phones. We are constantly striving to update and improve our services and your comments have been most constructive. I do hope you will consider staying with us again on your next visit. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: I am not sure how this place is rated at 5-stars. I booked and prepaid for a room through booking.com. When I arrived at the hotel, I was greeted by a receptionist who was quite rude. On booking.com, I had booked a room for two adults with a request for a third bed. For an unknown reason, there was confusion between booking.com and your sales/reservations office. The receptionist told me that I had not booked a room with two beds, nor had I booked a room with a third bed. I tried to explain to her the type of room I booked, the third bed I had requested and prepaid for, and the total US Dollar value I had prepaid - in order to explain that I had already paid for three bed accommodation. As I tried to explain this to her, she interrupted me several times, and her body…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Sep 12, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir Thank you for your comments and I am most disappointed to learn of the problems you experienced upon check in. A thorough investigation will be made but it will help if you can let us have your name so we can trace your stay and who checked you in. I also regret that you did not get a proper welcome from the doormen and Concierge staff. This is certainly not the way you should be treated and I would like to apologize sincerely for what happened to you. We will work harder to improve our standards in these areas to ensure a better experience for our customers. Please get back to me with your name and date of stay so that we can complete our investigation. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

date: Steve S wrote a review Sep 2011
review_content: This is the nickel and dime hotel. They have mouth wash in the rooms with a small tag that has the price to use it, very Sleazy. They have no power outlets in the room to run Computers. But will charge you and arm and leg for internet access.Very Sleazy Hotel. I am not sure why anyone would go to Hong Kong. If you have to DO NOT STAY AT THE REGAL HOTEL HONG KONG Location: 0 (Hong Kong) Staff: 4 ( The people do speak some English) Clean: 7 The Good: Staff The Bad: Sleazy business practice. The Ugly: Business practice Over All: Do not stay at this hotel.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Sep 12, 2011
response_content: Dear Steve Thank you for posting this note and here a some comments on your observations. The mouthwash is clearly marked with a price and so it us to you if you want to use it or not. We do make a lot of other amenities available to you in the room free of charge. I do not know which room you stayed in but all rooms have 2 plugs at the writing desk where you can plug in a computer and you have the choice of hard wire of wifi for internet access. And if you book through our official website for further internet promotion!! I am pleased to note that you found the room clean. Most of our front line staff speak English but often the associates who clean the rooms have a limited knowledge, quite common in Hong Kong. If you did consider staying with us again, we would be pleased to make your stay more enjoyable! Please do contact me direct or simply make your booking through our website. I hope you will give us another opportunity to be of service to you. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Ok experience with not so friendly staff
review_content: It was very busy travel season in HK and this hotel was no exception. Check-in was slow as the line was long and room wasn't ready at 5 PM. Took us 30 mins to get the room. Room features were within our expectations, and room itself was clean. Staff was not friendly, I suppose this is because they have to deal with large crowd of travelers. Other than that, everything else is fine.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Sep 11, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir/Madam Thank you for your comments about your stay and I am sorry you did not find our staff friendly at the check in desk and that you had to wait for your room. Please accept my apologies for this lapse in our service. We are working hard to improve this area of our service and have just opened an additional Desk in the Lobby to help deal with busy arrival and departure periods. Despite this, I am pleased you had a good stay and I do hope you will come and stay with us again next time you visit Hong Kong. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife for 3 nights from 17/8 based on a recommendation from a friend. Booked an Executive clubroom via the hotel website. This deal included airport transfers, breakfast, free in room wi-fi and club lounge facilities. The airport transfer runs on a schedule with the 1st bus at 7.45 am which when you arrive at 5.30am means a fair wait. Whilst the transfer was fine we opted for the airtrain for the return journey as the return schedule meant sitting around the airport for far too long. We arrived at the hotel at approx 9am to be advised that our room would not be ready but we were offered access to the gym to change and then our bags were held pending our room availablity. Plentiful ideas for a local area exploration were offered by the staff. We…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Sep 4, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir Thank you for taking the trouble to write-up your comments after your recent visit to the Regal Hongkong Hotel. We are delighted to learn that you enjoyed your stay with us and your feedback helps motivate us to continually work on improving our standards. In particular we appreciate your comment about our Executive Club Floor room, swimming pool on the roof and the service of our personnel. And we wish to assure you that a credit has been awarded to the team for their good and professional services. In regarding to the location, with the well-developed transportation network around the hotel, it provides great convenience to our guests for getting around everywhere in the city on their leisure and business trip. And with all kinds of restaurants inside the Hotel and at surrounding area, it provides our guests with so many choices to pick their favour cuisines. Please do have a look at our website for more details about Regal Hotels International, especially the great deals offered when booking through our website. The promotion that you enjoyed is still on which included complimentary internet in the room and free use of the shuttle bus to and from the airport. Thank you for your support of the Regal Hongkong and we look forward to welcoming you back soon. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Too gaudy for my taste but some great eating places
review_content: I must qualify this review by saying that my opinion was hotly debated by my colleagues. Still, it is my opinion! The hotel is done up in Traditional Chinese style but is over decorated with Red and Gold. The check-in staff weren't the most friendly I've met and while the rooms were spacious and comfortable, the taste in decor was consistent (gaudy). There was also this annoying music that was in a loop from the elevators as well as in the room until I figured out what caused it. The fitness room was tiny. Breakfast was rather ordinary by any standards. Now the good parts: Room service was terrific; the food was awesome. There's a great ice-cream cafe in the hotel itself and a fabulous dim sum restaurant in the hotel complex. They also have lovely banqueting facilities if…

Please do have a look at our website for more details about Regal Hotels International, especially the great deals offered when booking through our website. Thank you for your support of the Regal Hongkong and we look forward to welcoming you back soon. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Great hotel, great location, great food!
review_content: The title says it all: great, great and - once again - great! Some minor points for improvement would be check-in time, the front desk would give us the room key before 2pm (we arrived at 1.15pm) and told us to come back later. Also the choice of dumplings for breakfast was a bit limited, as was the rest of the breakfast buffet - especially compared to the JinLing hotel in Wuxi, China, that we just came from. Other than that the hotel is just good, albeit on the high side of the price range. Then again, the location is great and the rooms are clean and comfy, so all in all a good stay.

review_content: I stayed here twice within a few weeks and had very different experiences. Common to both visits: You can take the MTR from the airport, then a free MTR bus to the hotel - this works well. Check-in and out can be lengthy, very, very lengthy at peak times. Rooms are small, like most HK hotels but reasonably well appointed. Differences Visit 1, the staff service and all round experience was really good - there was no doubt I would return. Second visit quite the opposite - everything was a hassle, I was over-charged, room cleaning was missed, it goes on and on. Not sure why the difference, but I'd be loath to chance this place again, sorry.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Aug 13, 2011
response_content: Dear Michael Just read your note about the 2 recent visits and am obviously disappointed that you had such different experiences. Without more information about you details I cannot find out about the overcharging or the room cleaning being missed but if you want to share this information with me, I would be happy to get back to you. Was the overcharging issue resolved to your satisfaction? I can understand your reluctance to stay with us again but I can assure you that we are working hard to reduce the check in time and generally provide our guests with a good all round experience. Please do contact me when you next plan to come to Hong Kong and so that we can offer you something as a result of this last experience. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: Great location with lots of good food and shopping around the Orel. Easy and convenient to get to from the airport. Just take A11 Airbus and it stops just opposite the hotel in less than 60 mins. Paid HK$40 one way. Hotel also provides free shuttle every hour or so. All these were marred by poor and inflexible service. Booked a deluxe room for two with free breakfast. Upon arrival, told that breakfast only for 1 pax?!? Asked for two card keys as I need to work while my wife goes shopping. But the front counter would only issue 1. Could not explain why not two keys. Overall nice hotel but poor service.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Aug 16, 2011
response_content: Dear Rogtan Thanks for your review and I am sorry about the problems you experienced at the Reception counter. We have looked into your comments but without further details, ie. Your full name, it is difficult to find out about the breakfast issue. For the key, of course you should have been issued a 2nd one upon request and I am sorry this did not happen. Please accept my apologies for these shortcomings but do get back to me with your booking details so that we can find out about the breakfast issue. Thank you for your support and I look forward to hearing back from you at your convenience. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: Rooms above 31st floor are suites with exceptional view and a lot of space (compared to HK standards). One entire side of the room is a glass wall that faces Victoria Harbor. Personnel is caring , kind and always willing to help you. Bed are enormous, the bathroom mixes design with functionality. The entrance hall of the hotel is spectacular. Silence is perfect.

review_content: The hotel is always priced lower than nearby Park Lane hotel. During peak season I usually stay here as the other hotel gets pretty expensive. My room is nice and clean and quite big compared to Excelsior nearby. Near Sogo dept store and Time Square . Restaurants are abundant. There is a michellin rated restaurant beside the hotel

review_content: After just a short time of waiting for check in, we saw the receptionist. Totally cold and rude person ,she took my credit card away, she said that she would charge me fully of i can't remember how many days does she mentioned , as a guarantee. she seems like she was busy doing things here and there.....anyway that is not the mean problem ,well the problem was comunication me and my husband got poor english as we are from France,we asked her does any one speaks french ,and she said we should wait and after an half hour she came back and said "no one can help you everything was in chinese or english",si we called my friend( in paris) to help us for check in by phone because no one could explain us in french the rules that was disapointiing from a 5* hotel ,about the room…

Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel

response_content: Dear Sabrina Thank you for your report about your recent stay in Hong Kong and I am pleased the overall experience was a positive one. I am however sorry to hear of the difficulties you encountered at reception and in your room because of the language. Even when these problems arise, our associates should try to be more helpful and this has been taken up with their respective teams. I do speak a little French and I have alerted them about this so that in future they can contact me for assistance. I do hope you will consider using our hotel next time you visit Hong Kong and please feel free to contact me in advance for any assistance. A bientot! Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Excellent stay at the Regal HK, Causeway Bay
review_content: We had a great stay at the Regal Hong Kong, Causeway Bay on our recent trip to Hong Kong. The hotel is a very busy hotel in a very busy area of Hong Kong, and was very convenient to the MTR Subway, restaurants and shopping. The staff was mostly very friendly and helpful, which is easy for me to say since we were upgraded to a 32nd floor executive floor room with a harbor view. The rooms and lobby are a little gawdy for my tastes, but definitely very clean, roomier than most HK hotels with a gorgeous bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. In the same building of the hotel is a Din Tai Fung Restaurant, which has received a Michelin Star and rated by the NY Times as one of the ten best restaurants in the world. We ate there twice and was very impressed with the food, prices…

review_content: We have traveled to Hong Kong many times and decided to give the Regal a try due to the value for the money. After having read the mixed reviews for the Regal, we were a bit nervous about our reservation. We fortunately only experienced a very positive situation. Our check in on the Royal Lounge floor was immediate and our room (as promised) was renovated and had a beautiful view. The bathroom was completely redone, with a "rainfall" stall shower and new bathtub. The staff, especially Angela, Flora and Sam were extremely helpful and nice. Oh, almost forgot, the rooftop pool is quite awesome. We look forward to our next trip to Hong Kong and staying at the Regal.

review_title: Great location. Struggling to update and modernize. Amazing pool
review_content: I stayed at the Regal in 94 when it was probably a year old and much more up to date at the time. That said this hotel is in a fantastic location and even the standard rooms are large and not cramped. The downsides of the Regal I would say is that it is in the midst of trying to better itself. One afternoon in dire need of a jet lag nap i discovered that the room above me was having it's floors drilled or something. A call to the manager had them stop work there and he even offered to move me to another room for my nap ( I wouldn't have had to move rooms just nap somewhere else which I thought was a creative solution) I echo the comments made by some others, the non-updated floors have that musty smell that happens in the tropics when the carpeting has been around too long. My…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Jul 9, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir/Madam Thank you for your comments about your recent stay at Regal Hongkong Hotel. I am sorry you were disturbed by noise during your stay. We have just completed upgrading a further 5 floors in addition to the 8 floors completed in 2010. Corridor carpets are all being replaced on these floors and by the end of October all these guest rooms will have new carpets, 13 floors in total. The balance of the rooms will be completed next year. Most of the tent cards in the room are for information, mini bar and room service is not usually a free service. With regards to the internet service, the bandwidth was doubled in April this year but I realize that more needs to be done and we are working on it. If you book your room through our web site, you will not be charged for internet usage! Point also taken on the quality and choice of the in house TV system and we are working on improvements in this area as well. Then the overall standards of service is an area we are very focused on and improvements are being made in many areas but we will continue to work hard to provide a consistently high standard of service for all our guests. Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience you experienced during your last visit and do let me know when you will be returning to Hong Kong so that we make it up to you on your next stay. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: I stayed here for business trip during March and booked this just because Parklane has been fully booked, and this was completely a wrong choice. After nearly an hour of waiting for check in, I have incurred the most painful process with the receptionist. Totally unfriendly, cold and rude, she took my credit card away, warning that she would charge me fully for the 5 nights I stayed there in one go, as a way of guarantee. Then, pretending that she was busy doing things here and there, she left me there alone waiting for another half an hour while she was doing something else. Then, just as a way to lure my attention away, she rushed me to sign the credit card charge. And to my surprise, it was charged for 10 nights plus the usual charge of HKD2000 for deposit. When I spotted…

They are thoroughly cleaned everyday and this incident has been taken up with the Housekeeper. As we do not have your name or know when you stayed, it is not possible for us to make a more in depth investigation. Please accept my apologies for the inconvenience you were put to and kindly contact me directly so that we can make amends on your next trip. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: We just got back from a trip to HK. This time we tried staying at a diff hotel for our anniversary trip. I wrote in advance to inform the hotel about it but didn't get a reply so I thought the email didn't go thru. We requested for a renovated room and was gladly given one. They even provided fruits and chocolates just not sure if it is a common practice or something special due to my previous email. I assume they read the email and acted upon my request. Didn't try the internet cuz I find 140hk quite expensive. The rooms are big and bed comfortable. Overall it was a nice stay. Will definitely stay here again. had room service at 1am. Service was fast. There are still some renovation work going on at the top floors, but we were informed thru a letter in the room that there…

review_title: A very disappointing stay, will give this hotel a miss in future
review_content: Have travelled to HK many times but this was the first (and will be the last) time we stayed at The Regal HK. We only chose this hotel because of the swimming pool and close proximity to Causeway Bay shopping district. While the hotel is in a convenient location with tram stop out the front and short walk to MTR, this is probably the only saving grace. Hotel is in dire need of refurbishment and this extends to the rooms. The hotel is suppose to be 5 star - perhaps back in the 1980's given the mirrors, glass, marble and gold/brass fixtures and fittings now bordering on tacky. Our experience was more like 3 stars. We had pre-booked and paid for a 3 night stay in a non smoking deluxe room which we had subsequently confirmed by emailing the hotel. When we arrived we were told…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Jun 25, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir/Madam Thank you for highlighting the problems you experienced during your recent stay at Regal Hongkong. I regret the inconvenience you were put by not having your room preference available on arrival and am only sorry that the upgrade to the suite was not handled better. I have asked Housekeeping to have another go at removing the stain on the carpet. Then we have also investigated the smell in the bathroom and are working on a solution. Yes, I agree that the style of the room is a bit old fashioned but you will be pleased to know that 8 floors were upgraded last year and a further 5 floors will be completed in July this year. New carpets will also be fitted to all these rooms before the end of October this year. Then for the WiFi service, we are working with our supplier to upgrade this facility in order to strengthen the signal in all rooms. I am so sorry that you were inconvenienced by this problem. Most rooms have a good WiFi signal, but from time to time we do experience some problems. Please do contact me direct for your next trip to Hong Kong so that we can make your stay more comfortable that the one just experienced. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Never Ever Stay in The Regal Hong Kong!!!
review_content: We regretted every second since we stepped into this hotel, we booked 2 rooms and planming to stay here for 3 days 2 nights, and our stay was started with rude treatment  and totally unprofessional local hire. We arrived at the hotel at around 2:45 pm,and our room was not ready, the late check out time was at 1 pm and in 1 hours 45 minutes of cleaning time the room was still not ready. So they made us linger in the lobby, unfortunately,there are no seats for us to sit on and wai t for the slowww service, there are empty chairs in the lobby lounge but the sitting hostess said that we cannot sit there unless we consume, which i think is so dumb, they have a group of waiting guests (waiting for their slow housekeeper to clean the room) and we are not allowed to even sit on their…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Jun 14, 2011
response_content: Dear XoMartel18 Please accept my apologies for the poor treatment that you received on arrival at the hotel and the unhelpfulness of the associates. This is certainly not the standard we want to offer and every effort is being made to address the shortcomings you experienced. As a rule, if you have to wait for your room, we will offer you a drink voucher that can be taken in either Café Rivoli or Tiffany Lounge. I regret that this was not handled properly. I am also sorry that you found the rooms not to your liking. We are in the process of upgrading them, 7 floors were completed last year and a further 5 floors are under refurbishment. It was also unfortunate that we were unable to offer you a room from the refurbishment taking place at that time. I realise how disappointed you are with your stay but if you are prepared to give us another chance, we would be happy to make some special arrangements for your next visit. Please contact me direct at your convenience. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: The hotel overall is a very nice hotel and it is located not too far from the Metro. The rooms aren't large but are pretty good all around. The buffet restaurant on first floor is OK but not if staying for a week! The Chinese and Italian are Michelin star level and priced accordingly. Still, there are lots of restaurants within 10 minutes walk and a really good Itlain about 3 minutes away opposite Victoria Park. I agree with the complaints about the internet. The wired internet runs around $150 HKD and the Wi-Fi runs at $170 HKD - both exhorbitant for what should be free service for guests. Would i stay here again (the acid test) ........ yes, but there are better hotels.

I am sorry about the problems you had with the internet service and these are being addressed by the service provider. Please accept my apologies for this but do please contact me for your next visit so that we can ensure you a better experience. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: Nice Friendly Hotel at Causeway Bay Area
review_content: The price for the room is at HK$1500 per night with breakfast and Internet, I find it reasonable for what I am getting. Room is comfortable clean and coz we have 3 pax, it has enough space for me to add an extra bed and don't find it too cramp. The staff that we encounter were friendly and helpful. The chef at the cafe was nice and detail. When I order a scramble egg, he actually check how well done I want it to be. Not much chef does that when they do your egg. Just opps you have Windsor shopping mall and near by SOGO, of coz near to Causeway bay MTR IF there is an event at the Victoria park, you just have to cross the room and you are there. There are enough eating place from good restaurant to simple cafe that you can have breakfast for HK$70 for 3 pax. (of depend on…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Jun 14, 2011
response_content: Dear Sir Thank you for your generally positive review on our hotel, especially for the egg service at breakfast. We look forward to welcoming you back soon. Best regards Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_title: I will never stay here again
review_content: On checking in, staff insisted on charging 2000 dollars for incidentals to my credit card - that worked out at 500 dollars per night. I was told it would not be charged to my card. On checking out, I was told they would refund the money they had taken from my card. What did they think I was going to do? Steal the television?
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Jun 11, 2011
response_content: Dear Karen, thanks for posting your comment after your recent stay with us. It is a normal practice for a hotel to ask for a deposit to cover the cost of incidentals during a guests stay so that the check out procedure can be quicker because we have already asked for authorization from the credit card company. All you have to use is internet each day, breakfast, maybe some laundry or mini bar usage and you can run up an extra bill quite quickly. I am sorry you find this practice unacceptable but if you would like to give us another chance, we will make amends on your next visit. Please drop me a line and I will handle this for you. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: Was on a holiday in May 2011 with family. This one in Kowloon city was quite far from the airport. took around 1.5 hrs to reach there.Check in procedures were cordial. Helpful staff. "Always on the move" housekeeping. - do not spend time with you much to answer any questions other than the one you had called them for. Good location with easy access to banks, restaurants, etc. one problem faced was the usual one in some developed countries.Good food with a decent variety - Some cons - No lockable doors for the attached baths- just a sliding glass door and a curtain--- gave a shock initially!!! Restaurant - The indian one did not have any fruits - only juices. Too small rooms. A small lobby for the no,. of rooms available People from INdia need to carry adaptors of mobile…

date: Carl S wrote a review May 2011
review_content: The hotel overall is a very nice hotel and it is located not too far from the Metro. The rooms are fairly small but aren't too bad. My main complaint is the internet. The wired internet runs around $150 HKD and the Wi-Fi runs at $170 HKD. If you need internet go with the wired, because the only place the Wi-Fi works is in the hotel lobby. In the rooms is a different story. I called the front desk and they patched me through to a tech who basically told me to refresh my computer. Clearly its the rooms if my laptop can hold the signal in the lobby but FAILS when you get back to the room.

review_content: Positives: good location, efficient housekeeping, old style but kept in okay maintenance, decent size for basic room. Negatives: cold reception at check in, old style if it does not suit your taste Overall this is a tour group/business type of hotel. So therefore this hotel does not go out of its way to make your stay memorable. On the other hand, if you can get a good deal e.g. under 1400 HKD with internet and breakfast included, then it's a very good deal for a clean room in a nice location for Hong Kong.
