I am pleased you generally had a good stay but I was sorry to learn that you did not get a warm reception at the Front Desk. This has been taken up with the Front Office team to remind them to be more welcoming. The hotel has quite a lot of old style features to it, some of which we will keep but many of them, especially in the rooms, are being updated to reflect a more modern look. Next time you visit, ask for one of the newly refurbished rooms and I hope we can give you a more memorable stay. Yours sincerely Glen Farmer General Manager Regal Hongkong

review_content: First time writing on trip advisor but had to give an update on this hotel. Stay in Causeway bay at least once a month and have stayed here numerous times. Bottom line is this hotel is dirty and has terrible service. If your desire is to wait in line at the check in counter for thirty minutes plus or clean your bathroom upon arrival then this is the place for you. One of the positives is the price, which is reasonable for the location. Noticed they will be doing some remodeling soon, but that will not fix the service level at this place. Best bet to stay across the way at Lanson Place Hotel or at the Crowne Plaza.

review_content: It's my 3rd stay in Regal Hong Kong. It's close to everything and good for shopping as it's in the heart of causeway bay. Only one thing as a turn off is the hotel interior. It's a bit too garish for me, with its european style. However, it's very spacious, especially for HK standard. With 2 single beds, you can still have an extra bed and space to move. It's a little too pricey for me, so it's always be my last choice when I run out of options with my other favorite hotels.

review_content: I travelled to Hong Kong with a booking at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel. I had booked for 13 day but changed it to 5 as some of the ratings here were not good. What a waste of time as I was to discover the hotel is wonderful, clean, very helpful staff and very good rooms. The difference from the reports is incredable as I can say nothing bad about the Hotel. it is well positioned to have access to the metro system and has wonderful local eating places close by with good shopping areas around the hotel. This Hotel is so good I am going back 0n the 27th feb after a few days in Macau. Keith Wilson

review_title: friendly staff make this hotel a pleasure
review_content: I travelled to Hong Kong as my daughter was having surgery there and had a few reservations as the reviews were a bit critical. I found that this hotel was lovely and in a great location. The staff are a credit to management with perfect English, enthusiastic smiles and great attention to detail. On day one the maitre d' in the restaurant asked why my child was on crutches and we explained that she was having surgery, so on day 3 when we returned for dinner he immediately asked after her and made a real fuss of her. She was thrilled. The rooms were spotless, beds and pillows comfortable. I'll definitely return soon. Also to any fitness addicts like myself the gym is great - all well maintained machines and plenty of choice.

review_title: Great location, clean room, firm bed and good shower
review_content: Regal's last minute deals offer great value for money. Besides discount of 18% discount off Hot Deals room rate, guests also receive complimentary in-room internet service and shuttle bus service to and from HK Int'l Airport. The best thing to do in HK are eat and shop and I love Causeway area, hence Regal is my top choice in that price category. MTR and Jardine Bazaar is 5 mins away and so are 3 of my fav restaurants - Dining Room in Jia Hotel, Mak noodles and Bleu restaurant serving awesome claypot rice.

review_title: good quality hotel for the rate i got, not international 5 star level, horrible elevators
review_content: This is a hotel in Causeway bay in HK island. The location is near the subway station causeway bay and they offer a limousine service from the airport which i found very convenient. staff is eager to help and attentative, but could speak better English. Although the hotel claims 5 stars, this is in no way in the league of an international 5 star hotel. the breakfast is very nice and sports a large selection of dishes. the other restaurants however, are not worth going there. the hotel is mainly populated by chinese people (mainland and HK). the elevators take ages to arrive, it drives you mad. once inside you are tortured by generic music that makes you go crazy. the rooms are average. size is nice for HK but they could be more modern. we had a meetinroom booked too. service…

While the location is fantastic - close to tram, MTR and shopping centres, the hotel is awful. For starters, the toilet was filthy - like a public toilet at the end of the day. After having that cleaned, I then found belongings of previous guests under the bed, in the cupboard. The internet for my stay of 10 days cost more than if I signed up for a 2 year plan with one of the local phone companies. It was also sooo slow (about 1-2 secs to type each letter). Everything is extra whereas in other hotels in HK (where I travel 1-2 x per year), there are little things such as newspapers, internet, laundry breakfast included. I had pre-paid my stay and was unable to move. Not good value for money and staff seem unconcerned with rectifying any deficiencies. My advice - stay away!
response_title:

response_content: Thank you for taking the time in writing your comments on Jan 19, 2011 about Regal Hongkong Hotel services experienced during your recent stay. Your comments on our services are motivations to our working team and you could see the moving efforts of upgrading on service on your next visit to the hotel. In this regard, we regret and share your dis-satisfaction with the service that you experienced. Whole room should be cleaned all time according to the hotel’s standard while this is a short fall obviously. On the other hand, we have brought to the attention of the internet provider to ensure a smooth flow and better services to be rendered to all our guests. Please be assured that your comments have been a topic of discussion with our Management concerned and we will make every earnest effort to improve. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your opinions. Regards, Ivan Pau RM of Regal Hongkong Hotel

review_title: value for money with good location
review_content: booked 2 superior rooms / Check in : 16 Dec 2010 stay for 3 nites. Despite poor comments on this hotel, decided to book as found it good value with good location. Was given connecting rooms. Service staff at the reception counter was good Rooms are bigger than usual Hongkong room Room serivce was good - had put up the DND sign through out my stay, they left slips under my door informing us to contact them should we need any service from them as they could not clean up our room since the DND sign was on. Concierge staff need much improvement, could not provide good knowledge on travlling option when we approach them for help.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Jan 18, 2011
response_content: Thank you for taking the time in writing your comments on Jan 02, 2011, about Regal Hongkong Hotel services experienced during your recent stay. Your comments on our services are great compliments and motivations to our working team and you could see the moving efforts of upgrading on service on your next visit to the hotel. And, we are pleased to learn that you had enjoyed your recent stay with the convenience location, our room and rooming services. We wish to assure you that our team has been made aware of your comments and appreciated being recognized for their efforts. On the other hand, we are looking into providing enhancing programmes to our concierge team in order to raise the quality of service. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your appreciation. Regards, Glen Farmer GM of Regal Hongkong Hotel

review_title: Four star hotel that failed to stay up to it's name and standard
review_content: Duration of Stay (28Nov - 01Dec2010) Room No.1614. Twin room with a roll- away extra bed. Paid for rate at HK$1702.25 nett per room night. Upon arrival, bell boys were very friendly and helpful. Check in by Mr Herman of concierge, but he doesn't seems knowlegable and pro in his job, but was friendly. Housekeeping needed much improvements, we were given only 2 sets of towels daily with 3 of us staying in. Have to ask for extra set everyday. Ask for razor from day 1 but was never even there till check out. Asked for tissue paper replacement, but don't see it after 2 days later. we were given a fairly good extra bed from 28 - 30Nov, but only that i realized after when I settled my full payment of my total hotel bill on 30Nov morning, my roll-away extra bed was changed for no reason…

For the price, I expected better. I am not a fussy traveller but a Hyundai LCD TV in the room is not what I expected. Nothing much to complain about the room except the price. I think the hotel could do better for the price they charge. Breakfast is nothing to shout about, pretty standard everyday. Some variety would be nice. The free airport shuttle service is a great add-on service, provided your flight time coincides with it like mine (lucky me). My room package came with FREE INTERNET ACCESS so that is a plus, but if you are not on the package, your internet would be charged.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, Resident Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Dec 20, 2010
response_content: Thank you for taking the time in writing your comments on Dec 20, 2010, about Regal Hongkong Hotel services experienced during your recent stay. Your comments on our services are motivations to our working team and you could see the moving efforts of upgrading on service on your next visit to the hotel. In this regard, we regret and share your dis-satisfaction with the in-room facility. Also, with the free scheduled airport shuttle, we understand that may not be able to benefit all of our guests with individual departure time. Nevertheless, please be assured that your comments have been a topic of discussion with our Management concerned and we will make an earnest effort to improve and to provide a better service in the future. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your opinions. Regards, Ivan Pau RM of Regal Hongkong Hotel

date: udo s wrote a review Dec 2010
review_title: Nice facilities - lousy service and greedy charges makes this a bad choice
review_content: I stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. It's an odd mix of good value for money (ie the room, location), but then the staff stuff up everything. My aircon didn't work oroperly for three days, yet there was no serious follow-up. It was either freezing cold or boiling hot, but no chance to adjust the thing. At the same time they blast you with advertisements, for wrongly priced - but useful services - like their airport shuttle bus. They advertise it on their house TV channel at 65HK$ (max), when really the charge is 120 HK$. Despite prior booking you can't be certain whether you'll get on the bus you booked, because they overbook the bus as they see fit. I was on a trip where the luggage blocked emergency exits as well as the driver's sight. In case of an emergency we would not have…

I stayed here with my husband and 3 year old in Nov 2010 and would stay here again in future. Pros: - clean room/bathroom - 5 min walk to Times Square, Sogo etc and eateries - close to Victoria Park which has a great playground for kids and running track - courteous staff - nice rooftop pool, however water is not heated so was a bit cold for a swim in November. - good value for money We requested for an extra single bed for our son, and it was provided without any extra charge. This hotel seems to be a popular place for tourists from China and also airline pilots and the lifts may get a bit busy, but we were on a holiday and not on a tight schedule, so didn't mind the wait.
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel

response_content: Thank you for taking the time in writing your comments on Dec 5, 2010, about Regal Hongkong Hotel services experienced during your recent stay. Your comments on our services are great compliments and motivations to our working team and you could see the moving efforts of upgrading on service on your next visit to the hotel. And, we are pleased to learn that you had enjoyed your recent stay with the convenience location and our room. We would provide the extra bed for child under 12-year-old, who is sharing the same room parent(s), free of charge during their stay, so that parents can easily take care of their kids. We wish to assure you that our team has been made aware of your comments and appreciated being recognized for their efforts. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your appreciation. Regards, Yoland Perras GM of Regal Hongkong Hotel

review_title: Best location and value for money
review_content: I stayed there in August and September on my business trip. Located in Causeway Bay next to Jardine crescent, I reckon that this is one of the best tourist shopping spots in Hong Kong. It is about 5 minutes' walk from the Causeway Bay MTR station. I come to this hotel by chance. I actually booked Regal iClub hotel in Wanchai but was given a transfer because the rooms at iClub were under renovation. Since then, I grow to love it. I especially like the airport shuttle service. You can board the shuttle bus at the Regal Airport hotel which is within a few minutes' walk from the airport terminal which will run through a route to Regal hotels in Hong Kong and Disneyland Hong Kong. You can save about HK$600 on taxi fares for a two-way trip to and from airport. The hotel staffs…
response_title:
Response from RegalHongkongHotel, General Manager at Regal Hongkong Hotel
Responded Nov 29, 2010
response_content: Thank you for taking the time in writing your comments on Nov 29, 2010, about Regal Hongkong Hotel services experienced during your recent stay. Your comments on our services are great compliments and motivations to our working team and you could see the moving efforts of upgrading on service on your next visit to the hotel. And, we are pleased to learn that you had enjoyed your recent stay with the convenience location and our room. It is also our honor to receive your comment on our free round trip airport shuttle services running between the Airport and the Hotel. We wish to assure you that our team has been made aware of your comments and appreciated being recognized for their efforts. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your appreciation. Regards, Yoland Perras GM of Regal Hongkong Hotel

review_title: Pretty good for the price, and not as bad as other reviews led me to believe.
review_content: I spent a few days at Regal Hong Kong. I booked for value then saw some bad reviews on this site after booking, so was prepared for the worst. Turned out that my internet was free unlike reviews claimed, guess it depends on the rate. Also breakfast was free and very nice. No smoky smell in my room. The location isn't great for me although if you like shopping then it is good. Room was a little small, but bed was fine, bathroom was clean and all in all a good room. The gym is 24 hours which I find essential, and was decent with weights not just some bikes and treadmills. Free shuttle from the airport is long as mentioned in other reviews, but they also have a free shuttle from the airport express station if you want to speed things up. Staff was kind, also found them above…

response_content: Thank you for taking the time in writing your comments on Nov 7, 2010, about Regal Hongkong Hotel services experienced during your recent stay. And, we are pleased to learn that you had enjoyed your recent stay with our gym facilities, breakfast and services. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your appreciation. Regards, Yoland Perras GM of Regal Hongkong Hotel

date: Christian K wrote a review Oct 2010
review_content: I have staid in the Regal already 10 years ago. It has not changed since. And this is not meant to be a compliment. Rather the rooms have still the same faded retro style, as if Lous XIV tried to build Versailles on the cheap. My room had a slight smell problem. The bathroom also did not really reach modern hygiene standards anymore - a wall hanging toilet rather than a large floor standing monster would have already significantly improved hygiene. The worst was certainly the gym. Windowless in basement three, with old and poorly maintained equipment, no headphones for the TV sets in front of the running machines, no remote control for the TVs either and decked out in mirrors and black, this is not the most inspiring place for exercise. In Hongkong and for that money there are…

Please be assured that your comments have been a topic of discussion with our staff concerned and we will make an earnest effort to improve and to prevent such happenings to be happened again in the future. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your opinions. Regards, Becky Lui. (On behalf of Mr. Yoland Perras, GM of Regal Hongkong Hotel) Secretary to Executive Office

review_content: I booked this hotel through internet with a fixed rate prepiad....that's what I thought until I check out. I booked for 140$ a night and then they said they had to charge 10% more + romm fees + mini bar that I didn't use at all (8$ us for a coca cola X 6 = 48$). wifi was 25$ us per mobile and per laptop for a total of 100$ more per night. Furthermore they charged even for laptop that I didn't use. Not possible to talk with the reception at any time. the pool was close for no reason. the rooms were in a horrible condition. leaking shower, small beds, broken windows, etc. I don't recommand this hotel which cost me the double of expected!

The location and appearance from the outside are nice but it was downhill after that. My complaints include the fact they bill you TWICE for the internet if you access it both from your computer and phone. - Each device gets charged (and it's not cheap). The room was showing a lot of age. The bathroom needed a serious renovation and the bed was very uncomfortable. About my only positive comment for this hotel was their restaurant, Zeffirino, which has a very good Italian chef.

This staff at this hotel were very friendly and efficient, they were very accomodating and good for tourist information. The hotel rooms were very floral and old school decor but still very comfortable and clean. In the toilet you can have the option of the lift music playing whilst your in there which is always novel, pan piped westlife anyone? Room service was very quick and tasty I had the japanese meal which was gorgeous, but if you are after a quiet room then think again, you can hear the taps from other bathrooms and people in the surrounding rooms above and below and you cannot turn the air con off and it is very loud in the night. The hotel is in the heart of the designer shop area and there are many shopping centres surrounding it. The hotel is very close to the world…

After arriving at this hotel in the morning (my travel agent had told them it was an early check in) I was told by some very disinterested staff that I was too early and I had to go away for a couple of hours. Not an offer of breakfast or anywhere to sit, just go away. So after a couple of hours walking around Hong Kong I went back to the same staff members who were trying their best to appear busy even though there were no other guests around (and of course making me wait) I was given a room. This came with a single key, and when I told them I was there with my wife and could I please have two keys I was told "no, this isn't done here". So even with this odd reception I headed up to the room as I was tired and in need of a shower. The room however was so bad I didn't even sit…

review_title: Nice hotel.. greal location - right in the heart of Causewaybay
review_content: I recently visited Hong Kong, and was having problems finding a hotel which fits in my budged due to some Jem and Jewelry fare going on in HK.. Most of the hotels only had premiere and executive rooms available, which were priced really high. Then I went through my corporate travel agent, and managed to get the superior room at Regal Hong Kong hotel at a decent rate. They had a free shuttle service from Airport to Hotel which was very convenient.. though it took like 1.5 hrs to reach Regal HK hotel as it visited all the other regal hotels (kowloon and city) enroute, and dropped/picked other people. Once we reached Regal hotel, to my surprise, I was upgraded to Deluxe room which was wonderful. I was taken to 31st floor where they have a personalized concierge and visitors desk,…
It's old building but staffs are nice and room is comfortable. I've enjoyed staying there.

review_content: Regal Hong Kong hotel is a business class hotel for the executives. Excellent rooms, good food. Service is very good. It is close to many big suermarkets and can do a quick shopping too. Cabs are always available and the bell desk is ever ready to assist.

review_content: I stayed here for a few days last week & found this place conveniently located. The train from the airport took me to the HK station terminal where I caught the free shuttle bus to the hotel (just look for the H2 signs for the free shuttle leaving every 20 minutes). The free shuttle bus also took me from the hotel to the HK station terminal. There's renovation going on so there's hacking, drilling & loud noises but I wasn't in the room long enough to be bothered (you encounter such things from time to time). My room was clean, comfortable, bright & spacious enough. Sogo department store is only a 2-minute walk to the left & across the road. The Causeway Bay MTR is also very nearby (different exits dotted around). And there are lots of eating places to choose from.

In this regard, we are pleased to know that you find the alocation of the Hotel allows you an easy access to places that you wanted to go and the room you stayed was in good condition. We wish to assure you that our team has been made aware of your comments and appreciated being recognized for their efforts. Once again, thank you for taking the time to share and express your appreciation. Regards, Becky Lui. (On behalf of Mr. Yoland Perras, GM of Regal Hongkong Hotel) Secretary to Executive Office

review_content: u get what you pay, even it is not luxury, still is fine, i stayed here for one night

I really had a bad experience in this hotel. Starting with the longest check in time ever... ... then that strong cat smell of an extra old room... ... one bathroom towel per guest... ... a duvet with a sheet on top and another one underneath instead of a decent cover... ... a hair in my bed... ... slow room service... We chose this hotel because of the location and that is true if what you intend is to shop all day long. But if you wish to visit the City center, Kowloon, go to Macao or any other activities, other areas are much better than this one. Conclusion: I would never stay again in this hotel.

I recently stayed here during a business trip. The hotel is very close to the Causeway Bay MTR station and is a few blocks from Times Square Shopping Centre. The Airport Express bus stops here and provides easy access to the express train. Overall the hotel was a bit dated and smelled very strongly of mothballs. The bathroom was a bit musty. The staff was friendly and all spoke English. Overall I would stay again.

review_title: The only Hotel supplying coplimentary drinks for only one person
review_content: The provision of shuttle service is convenient The location is okay The charge for third person riding in the bus cost $110, too expensive This is the first time we experience limited supply of coffe, teas, just one pack each The showeroom is a bit small but everything quite okay

date: Elizabeth N wrote a review Jun 2010
review_title: Good value if you can get a good online deal
review_content: I booked this as a secret hotel on "Wotif". Based on this price, the hotel was great value - the location is one of the best on the Island - especially if you like shopping. The rooms are very richly furnished and seemed very clean - my only complaint would be that the non-smoking floors are quite clearly not non-smoking. My room smelled strongly of smoke, and one of my pillows was so pungent I couldn't use it - out in the hallways the smell of smoke was quite bad. The staff were fairly attentive, but overall it's the location that would make me come back to this hotel. It's just a short walk from the MTR, and close to all the great shopping areas of Causeway Bay.

review_title: Good location, hotel was descent for the price!
review_content: Regal Hong Kong Hotel is located in a very central location close to the main business locations of Hong Kong. The hotel is quite old and seems to be well past its prime! But i cant really complain because the value for money staying at this hotel is great!! They even included a free pick up and drop from the Airport in the price through their shuttle! The room service was quite bad and I didn't like the food at all! Wouldn't recommend anybody eating in the hotel! Also they cinluded Free Internet for me which was awesome!

This is a good hotel located close to lots of shopping. The buffet breakfast was nice and the room was clean. I found the bed extremely hard and I do have a firm mattress at home. Also, the in room safe did not work. Everything else was good, and service was friendly.

This hotel was absoloutely brilliant. We had initially booked into the airport hong kong by mistake (which was in the middle of nowhere!) but the hotel was kind enough to help us transfer to the Regal HongKong which was perfect. It was walking distance from all of the shops and Time Square which was a great place to go and eat. Service was amazing and staff in the lobby were so helpful with recommending places to visit and giving directions. Taxis into the city were really cheap and available right outside the hotel if you don't fancy walking. And there is an underground station located within walking distance to go to kowloon (or you can get the star ferry, an lovely experience!). They also had a free shuttle bus to the airport which was fully air conditioned. They had a…

The bad: 1. The checked in area I find it rather messy. There is only one queue for both check in and check out. Thus, when the check out counter calls, guest standing at the back for check out is always been seen as cutting queue when the front guests queuing are all checking in. 2. The lobby is always very busy and filled with people. 3. MTR need to walk a bit 4. Price might be a bit steep The good: 1. The location is good for shopping. Short walking distance to Sogo and Times Square. 2. Airport bus stops outside the hotel 3. Staffs are rather helpful 4. Room size is decent

review_title: Stay only if you need to here....
review_content: I was on a week long business trip to Hong Kong and was booked in to Regal Hong Kong Hotel. After a long 10 hour flight the last thing you would want is to have a coach pick you up instead of a car, which effectively meant that I ended up spending nearly an hour and a half to get to the hotel from the airport after 2 scheduled stops...pretty frustuating. The check in wasnt a pleasent experience either. The staff kept on pestering me to sign with the loyalty membership even though I didnt want it. FInally after threatening to walk out of the hotel, they relented. The room is strictly ok albeit you could see signs of ageing while food is might expensive. A stand continental b/fast would set you back by HK $ 270...not worth it. All in all stay here only if you have run out of…

We got a great deal on thid hotel during a holiday period ... so it feels unfair to say anything negative. The hotel is in an excellent location for shopping & sightseeing. Level of service is acceptable. However the entire hotel is past its best and looking tired. The rooms are what you would expect from a two or three stae hotel. The hotel seems to specialise in tour parties, particularly from China. These guests seemed to get particularly poor service from the hotel staff. However we were our sightseeing all day so the quality of the rooms was not a major issue. I would not recommend this hotel if you value a high quality room & high level of service. I would recommend it as an inexpensive night time spot after a long day of sightseeing / shopping.

I was on business trip on 24-27 Mar 2010. This hotel was chosen because my usual hotel ( Excelsior Hotel) expecting full occupancy … there is a Ruby Seven during this period. The hotel offered free airport transfer . This is a good point if the traveler has spare time to spare to wait for their van set off at fixed scheduled. The trip from airport to Kowloon took 1 hr ( stopping by Regal kowloon) There were 2 staff attended at the Reception.. resulting a long queue in checking in . We waited for almost half an hour because the staff s were frequently interrupted by guest queries. We wondered how the hotel operates with only 2 staff at the reception. As we booked the deluxe king room, it come with a big bath tub and a small shower room. The toilet provide essential soap ,…

review_title: Great service, convenient location, all around great trip
review_content: We were in HK with a family group of adults from Dec 09 - Jan 10. We stayed at the regal for 2 weeks and found it a fantastic hotel in a great location. It was decorated beautifully for Christmas and the New Year. It was an easy walk to the MTR station (causeway bay) and surrounded by some nice authentic local eatteries, as well as it's fair share of 7/11s! Taxis were always at hand and easy to get to. The staff were very helpful, especially the room service staff. We ordered room service on a number of occasions and it was always prompt and tasty. Twice we ate the buffet breakfast downstairs, which was a fairly standard breakfast buffet for asia although still nice. The pipe duct replacement didn't bother us as we were usually out in the daytime, although we had one small…

The location is great if you're on a business trip like I was, good service, friendly and warm overall. Hotel looks a bit tired and could do with some make up/refurbishment. Would recommend the hotel to any business travelelr and would return.

I was in Hong Kong for BUsiness with colleagues and was decided to book the Regal. Location close to my company office and with shopping all around. You can move aorund the city nicely with the Hong KOng Tram just at the door. Rooms are comfortable but needs more light. People at Regal are very helpful and always try to guide you for whatever you ask. Their Italian Rrestaurant on the 31st is great with an authentic Lady Chef with good service and great views.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jan 2010
review_content: Our rooms were upgraded to Deluxe... very satisfied with room size and cleanliness... very courteous staff... One block away (short walking distance) from Causeway Bay MTR subway station... situated near Tram stop too... near Sogo and Times Square of Causeway Bay... area full of people even up to past midnight... Shuttle to airport offered by Regal Hotel very affordable and convenient too... got us at the airport right on schedule... Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Regal Hong Kong and would not hesitate to stay again on our next trip...

review_title: Beds are uncomfortable, location is good though
review_content: I was upgraded to the executive room on 32nd floor as the hotel was full and I stayed with my spouse who was in HK on a business trip. OK I don't normally complain on this forum but let's start with the things I didn't like about this hotel : Firstly, the hotel design is flashy and overly ornate without taste - think mirrors on every conceivable wall surface, chandeliers hanging from all ceilings, elaborate "baroque" carvings on cornices and columns, and gold paint on everything else. There is a general muskiness in the air and the hotel seems dated (though clean). My room, despite being an executive room on one of the highest floors, was rather small with a queen sized bed, small work desk and cupboard and a 42 inch flat screen tv. The whole room somehow looked ridiculously…

I stayed this hotel in Jan 2010 for two nights. The room is ok on a first look. But you find very soon how poor the cleaning standard is. I spotted precious gusts hair on the room floor, bath room and the window area. I wonder whether they even vacuum the room floor after every check-out. The front desk staffs are not professional. They speak in such a manner that they are just there to finish the task. They seldom smile and seem not at all to be ready to help you. The hotel pretends to be a good or great hotel. But it is a third class hotel with old facility.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jan 2010
review_content: Generally satisfied despite of the small room size, but this is the first hotel I had ever stayed that does not provide you with free mineral water bottles. So, if you are traveling with kids, make sure you bring or buy some water, if you don't want to spend additional money for using a lot the mineral water in their mini bar. The housekeeping staff is not that nice when you ask something delivered to your room and don't speak proper English. The concierge are good in giving directions, reliable and helpful.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jan 2010
review_content: The hotel is located at Causewaybay area(the heaven of shopping) As soon as you get out of the hotel, you encounter lots of shopping places. But the room conditon was worse than I expected. The room was smaller than I saw in the picture on this site and the bathroom was a little dirty. But the hotel staff was well trained and hospitable. If the room was renovated, this hotel would be a pretty good place.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jan 2010
review_content: We enjoyed our stayed in Regal Hongkong Hotel. It was very accessible through the tram. We like the European design of the room. The room is small but the space was well utilized. It is near the shopping malls and restaurants. We enjoyed the swimming pool which gives us also a great view of Causeway Bay. While the location is near the commercial spaces, one can still enjoy a peaceful environment.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jan 2010
review_title: A good location closed to mrt & shopping center
review_content: its very nice hotel to sty in , although Some area under renovation. This is my 1 times experience staying in this hotel, very closed to MRT & major shopping center. around the area a lot of small restaurant that open until late at night especially during weekend. Very nice experience to stay here

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Dec 2009
review_title: I made a goog choice to stay in Regal Hotel
review_content: very good price for a five star hotel, Location is very good, quite but close to major shopping areas in Causeway Bay Trams and bus stops are just outside the hotel, very convenient to other parts of Hong Kong. The free shuttle service helps a lot to or from the airport. Definitely Regal Hotel will be my choice again for my next visit.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Dec 2009
review_content: Not happy with stay as it was supposed to be for 2 persons.instead no comb,shaver blade, no hand towel only one sachet of coffee for 2 person No english newspaper. Dis illusion for a supposed 5 star hotel.

review_title: Good hotel, well located near Causeway Bay Station
review_content: While they are currently renovating the 'pipe duct' system, this is a relatively good hotel. Renovations are between 10am and 6pm, so should be okay for those who don't need to sleep during the day. Staff are very attentive and accomodating of requests. The rooms are a good size (although some may think they are a little too 'ornate'), and the location is great. I didn't try any of the hotel restaurants.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Dec 2009
review_content: We arrived in Hong Kong in the morning at around 07h35 and caught a Shuttle from the airport to the Hotel. We have often passed through and had short stopovers in the city but have never stayed, so this was an exciting and first time experience. Upon arrival at the Regal, we were informed that we would have to return later as there were no rooms available, the young lady at the reception suggested 13H00 some 4 hours later, we were dissapointed, but realised we had no choice and left to explore the city, however, having just arrived from South Africa, were pretty keen to return to get settled in a room to freshen up and have a rest. We arrived back at 14H30 and were informed that we would now have to wait till 15h00 as Housekeeping had not finished cleaning the room earmarked…

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Dec 2009
review_content: We loveee this hotel. We stayed at the Regal Royale Room, at the upper level. The Room is brand new, it's very small, but it has enough space for the two of us. The lounge provide us with free refreshments almost all day long (closed at 8PM), free internet service, and free printing service. So after a day of long long walk it's great to have all those perks. Breakfast buffet is mediocre but acceptable.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Dec 2009
review_content: We stayed at the newly remodelled upper Regal Royal Room, The rooms are extremely small, but it's functional enough. We especially love the free refreshment all day long (up until 8PM) at the regal Royal lounge. The Pillow Menu is also an excellent additional feature that we love. Location wise it's perfect, very closeby to shopping, as well as the business district.

Our stay in the hotel was comfortable . The room was not quiet big but very cozy for two people but it cant accomodate children .The scene from the window was not very encouraging as it was in the main kowloon market area. the rates were bit high compared to the quality .

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Dec 2009
review_content: the hotel is very clean and the staff are friendly.strategically near the nice places to shops for clothes and electronics stores. food are plenty to choose. rooms are spacious and beds are comportable to sleep. the lobby are is not as big as some other hotels but its not a big deal. its just the couches are not many to accomodate the guests. but over all, all is good in this hotel.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Nov 2009
review_content: The place is great considering that its near the mtr station, across the hotel is the best Western union money changer (because among others it has the highest exchange rates),near 7 eleven groceries and its just 10 min walk to Time Square, Sogo and World trade Center, and if you're looking for a good place to eat at a reasonable price its just 2 blocks away form the Delicious Kitchen.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Nov 2009
review_content: - Arrival was quite fast but it is noted there was nearly no queue - Room was fine and clean - The general aspect of the hotel is fine and might require renovation in about a year - Check out was a bit longer than expected but the service was generally good.

review_title: Regal Hong kong is a top Hotel in a very good area.
review_content: The Regal hong Kong is well located in Causeway Bay, close to MTR, Harbour, shops, markets etc with easy access to many attractions on the island. We took the Royale Platinum option which includes an extensive range of add ons including, free airport shuttle, free late checkout, breakfast, afternoon tea, cocktail hour, executive floor, dedicated checkin etc. very good value.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Oct 2009
review_content: Never see any hotel like this, they charge me with extra bed but I have to wait until 9.00pm. to have it. Besides, this extra bed is as comfortable as sleeping on the stone. With the price they charged, I expect much more than what i've got. I swear to god I will never visit this hotel again.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Oct 2009
review_content: I stay in regal hotels a lot,everything in this hotel was extra, no bottled water, internet was expensive, bathroom toiletries were bare, I was not able to check in till after four and was only allowed late checkout till 2 Nice location, good value, would stay there again .I think that as a 4 star it would be good but dosent act like a five star

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Oct 2009
review_title: Regal Royale Was Great Except for That Noise
review_content: Initially reserved Superior room, but I was offered paid upgrade to Regal Royale at the check-in counter. So, I took the offer. The room was non-smoking room, and quite modern. It would have been helpful if the chair was ergonomically designed. Even though the desk was quite modern, I couldn't work with my laptop for more than one hour. The Regal Royale lounge was ordinary. The breakfast served in the lounge seemed mediocre at first, but I changed my mind after eating. Although the selection was limited, the foods were rather satisfying. Smoked ham, smoked salmon, a variety of breads, congee, orange/apple juice and even a sophisticated coffee maker. I wish they change the bread selection from time to time though. Eating same pastries day after day is rather painful. Everything…

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Oct 2009
review_content: Will return and recommend others to stay in this hotel Good variety of local eateries are close by within walking distance Suitable for both business and leisure travellers Staff are friendly and well trained, service is prompt Difficult to catch taxi at times, it's better to give yourself more time when using the roads around

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Oct 2009
review_title: Perfect place to stay in Cuseway Bay!
review_content: We had a wonderful stay at Regal Hotel Hong Kong this late summer. The hotel is located in a very good spot and not too far from the Causeway Bay MTR Station. The room is clean and the staff are friendly. One other thing, it's located perfectly in the center of Causeway Bay's shopping and dining area. Looking forward to staying at this hotel again in the future!

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Sep 2009
review_content: Over all the hotel is very much near the place for the shopping in causeway bay. It is very centrally located and easy to get transport to go to any place. The area is very busy even in the late hours of the night and you find every kind of shops in the areas. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean. Nice hotel for travelers.

Stay for a week with my 13 yrs old daughter. She loved everything about this hotel - teenage girls are hard to please. Excellent value, this hotel was one of the highlights of our holiday. Pros: Service - bellboys were helpful & friendly, used their services with directions, guilds, taxis etc daily. - the room attendant was excellent, clean & friendly. - granted 2pm late check-out with no problem. Room - big for HK std, great view & tasty decor. We just loved it. - we never heard a thing, it was so quiet. - it was a haven from the heat & people outside. Location - hundreds of shops & restaurants just outside. - the street housed some great eating places, we tried a new one everyday, food was cheap & quality…

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Sep 2009
review_content: Our party of three stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in April 2009. It is expensive because it is located in busy Causeway Bay. We stayed there because we wanted a central location to go around town quickly. The hotel suited our purpose but nothing more. Staff was polite to everyone, the room is comfortable but not luxurious. We had a big room right by the elevator but the hallway was surprisingly quiet and we were not disturbed in any way. Everything in the hotel was expensive, but there are plenty of stores and restaurants right outside the hotel. The sizeable lobby was always filled with tour groups waiting for their rooms or for their buses. Overall a very efficient hotel and you are treated with standardized politeness.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Aug 2009
review_title: great hotel 2 min walk from center
review_content: i enjoied our stay in the hotel, seams like the location is the most advantage of the hotel. very close to the rush center of caswaybey rooms clean water hot air conditioned not so cold at day time that was very hot and we needed it to cool us.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Aug 2009
review_title: Okay Hotel for Price we paid
review_content: Overall, our three days in the hotel was mediocre. I would give Regal 5/10 rating. This is a good area for cheap shopping and local food. I probably won't stay here the next time I visit Hong Kong. I think I will pay a little bit more for better service and hopefully a newer hotel.

I was impress when I check-in, The girl at the Reception desk Panffy (not sure) with big eyes gave me a warm welcome with smile, after checked-in she gave me a map to show me where is the best place to shop. My room was on the 28/F facing part of the park and part of the harbor. What a view.......

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jul 2009
review_content: the second day of my stay at the hotel i had some health problems[upset stomack]and the help from the staff [assistant manager] was excellent.He's help in organising a doctor and following my health after was much appriciated.they handeled the mater excelently and i will return there again

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jul 2009
review_content: A clean prestigious hotel. I love music while I eat and the pianist during lunch buffet was excellent musicien with a nice repertoire.The room temperature was superbe. We were provided with tea and coffee for our convenience. Enjoyed the beautiful and complete GYM. The location couln't be any better. Surrounded by lots of shops, a market . Excellent concierge service.

While not disagreeing with some of the negative comments in recent reviews, I give this hotel 5 stars because it is a very comfortable hotel that can be had for a reasonable price. If you reserve a room on the internet, you can get a spacious, clean, quiet room for about 1,100 Hong Kong dollars. We had absolutely no problems during our stay. The staff was attentive and very fast. We put the "do not disturb sign" on our door whenever we were in the room to avoid room checks whereby someone might open the door at anytime. The decor of the room and the hotel does not suit my taste, but it wasn't enough to bother me. The room was very clean and comfortable. By reserving the room on the internet, the internet access was provided at no extra charge. Both ethernet and wireless…

review_title: I loathed this hotel - but it was good value!
review_content: My real issue with this hotel is a matter of taste. Dated 'Renaissance' isn't really my thing and I found the whole decor an affront to the senses. So if you like this style - you are much more likely to like this hotel. In terms of pros: the hotel is in a good location, close to the MTR, has decent sized rooms and is clean (housekeeping were lovely), safe and was really good value. On the negative side - there is no bar; nowhere to relax unless you are in the 'club floor' (which didn't seem worth the bother to me); the wi-fi didn't work in the room; the internet was expensive (in many hotels internet is free nowadays); the toiletries are minimal (I spent the first few days going out to buy basics); the bathroom grout needed re-doing; the 'free' newspaper was indeed a free…

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jun 2009
review_title: Nice Hotel but Staff Not Overly Friendly
review_content: I would say that this hotel rates about average. The hotel was classy and had a nice feel to it. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The location was within walking distance to the nearest MRT station and other shops/restaurants. The staff weren't really friendly and most didn't offer a smile or greeting.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Jun 2009
review_content: This hotel has good service, well located in the heart of Causeway bay. It is recommended for a any trips in Hong Kong, either professional or for leisure.
It was my second stay in Hotel regal hongkong. It was nice experience.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: i enjoyed my 14 day stay at this hotel.The rooms were spacious and the pool on the roof top was a great way to spend an hour or 2 each day relaxing.It is very central and only 5 mins walk from Times Sq where there are super malls for shopping and also eating out.The bar area was poor and empty every time i passed it.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_title: A good hotel to choose for shopping and dining
review_content: The hotel is located in Causeway Bay, where are many restaurants and shopping centers like Sogo, Seibu, Times Square etc. The officers in the hotel are friendly, helpfull and efficient in service.
We liked it very much, service was very good, rooms big and clean, location super many shops, restaurants, and metro near by. Convenient bus from airport to hotel.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: The hotel is located in one of the best location with easy access to the mtr station (causeway bay) which allow tourists to travel throughout Hongkong/kowloon easily. Shopping is very convenient with plenty of food outlets. The shopping outlets in this area include top class shopping complex (Times Square) which carries many top brand product and various other cheaper shopping outlets. Food outlets ranging from fastfood to local food are plentiful and very affordable.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: The location of the hotel is excellent.. Lots of shops, malls and restaurant around.. The Causeway Bay MTR station is just a short walk.. The hotel has a nice pool at the top floor and is open till 9:30pm,, but the water is very cold,, so i couldn't swim in the evenings.. Room size are okay when compared to the hotel room sizes in Hong Kong..

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: If you've done enough researh on main sections of Hong Kong & you have chosen the Causeway Bay area - this is a safe choice to stay at. You are smack at the heart of Causeway Bay (near Sogo). Food & desert outlets open till 1am (some later). Transportation is convenient - MTR station (5 mins from back of hotel); electric tram (1 min from lobby); 10 mins taxi ride to Lan Kwai Fong, 20 mins to Ocean Park. 30 mins bus ride to Stanley. The rest...MTR gets you there. Check in early so that you can request for room change (only if you're the picky type), else most rooms are nice.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: This is a good value hotel in a fabulous location at a a pretty reasonable price. The rooms are pretty reasonable sized by Hong Kong standard and basic equipped. There is no water in the room except for over priced mineral water so be warned. The decor is a bit strange but not really off putting or critical to me at least. Overall given the location and the price it is a very well run and good value hotel.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: Like it very much, Located 5 min walk distance from sogo and many shops, restaurants just right next to the hotel lobby. Rooms are very luxury, and big (compare sizes in HK), they also let you have really late check out like 6:00pm, a great feature if you leaving at nite or late afternoon.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: The hotel provides an excellent location: not only it is centrally located but plenty of neat little local eateries (great dai pai dongs!), Victoria Park around the corner and Causeway Bay MTR only short walk away. But the hotel interior, including the lobby, is modeled after some French’ baroque décor is garish and outdated. I could live with that but what was completely unacceptable is very inadequate shower / bathroom w/shower water trickle – a very different from my experience w/other HK hotels. They have not even provided shampoo/conditioner and the soap is gym-style wall-mounted dispencer – very suspicious considering hotel 5-star claim…I am giving it 4 stars.

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review May 2009
review_content: Because of 5 stars hotel and its location,I chose this hotel but,instead of the location, staffs are not nice,room cleanigs were not enough,breakfast of roomservice was not good, so the next day I decided to take breakfast by myself,and then when I was going to make a cup of coffe,I found a hair in the kettle to make boiling water. Disgusting!

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Apr 2009
review_content: I gave this hotel an overall satisified rating given the good location, clean rooms and generally friendly staff. However, with the exception that our room was not ready when we checked in at 3:30PM. This is the second time this has happened for the same hotel. We only felt it was reasonable to request a late check out due to the late availability of room but the receptionist reacted strongly and gave us an unreasonable answer. It made me and my wife feels very bad.

On the new business side of Hong Kong it has a great accessible location. We were a part of a large group visiting Shanghai and HK and so stayed for 3 nights and were able to do all sight seeing and even go kowloon easily from here.
Hotel is located in down town, I can see part of the harbour from my room. I got a warm welcome by the Bellman when I check-in, staff at the front desk are friendly and helpful. Worth trying

review_title: Comfortable hotel but comes with very noisy hotel guests!
review_content: The hotel is decorated back in the Renaissance period with mirrors and lots of gold around the hotel and the rooms. It was comfortable and clean. The biggest off putting thing of this hotel were the other hotel guests. They would be shouting to each other from their hallway and their children would be running up and down! I have stayed here at least 3 times and all 3 times it has been like this. It is even more annoying when you have to rest before going to work. In addition the housekeeping staff who double check if the rooms have been cleaned, knock on the doors on the floor, shout "housekeeping" open the door then slam the door shut. This would go on till all rooms on the floor have been checked! This was very very annoying indeed! Never have I heard this before in any…

date: A Tripadvisor Member wrote a review Feb 2009
review_content: I was under the impression that Regal Hong Kong hotel has been recently renovated when I book but I can't be more wrong. I was given the 'old' room and the 18th century modern Rome decor is indeed eye-catching!! I hope there are plans for updating the rest of the hotel and not just the executive floors! Room is nevertheless clean & tidy but noise level is unacceptable. I was on 15th floor and traffic can still be heard at 3am! Also the shouting at the corridor from the fellow travelers is making my stay even more unbearable. Needless to say I didn't get a good night sleep at all for my entire 5 nights' stay. Consider this is a 4 star hotel, I was shocked to find my room hasn't been cleaned (ok, just once but still...)

review_title: Two star service at a Five star price.
review_content: After having to endure a half-hour wait to even approach the check in counter, we found ourselves confronted by possibly the slowest and most frustratingly inept staff in all of Asia. No mean feat given the competition for this title on the Chinese mainland. The English spoken is pidgin at best, the staff have no consistency whatsoever as regards upgrade fees, etc (it differs depending on who you speak to), the simplest of requests or questions are met with baffled silence, and the manager is harder to pin down than Spring-Heeled Jack. For the price paid it was altogether a disappointing experience.

We stayed in this hotel for one week and very much enjoyed our stay. Staff were pleasant and friendly. They had already arranged a late check out for us as we had a late flight home. We also ate in the two restaurants and thoroughly enjoyed our meals. We also had breakfast one morning and the buffet was out of this world. We were unfortunate in that we only got 3 days of good weather and so only managed to the rooftop pool once. My one criticism would be that while we were there, men were working at the poolside and made me feel slightly uneasy. Other than that the location was great and we would happily stay in this hotel again.

Very nice, tidy hotel. Very centrally located and only a 5 minute walk to timesquare. Unfortunately it was cold when I was in Hong Kong so it to cold to take a swim in the pool which is situated on top of the hotel. The view however from the top is amazing! The only small problem I had was when asking for an aspirine (tough night in the dragon-I club). Hotel staff could not get me one.. :-( Other things which I can recommend is going to a place called Stanley (only 20 min by taxi). Close to HK but very peaceful and beautiful. Remind my of Mallorca in Spain.

The location of the hotel is not bad. 10 minutes walk from the causeway bay mtr. The property is decorated in a rather over the top psuedo french renaissance meets baroque meets bad taste peachy pink everything style ! Still the rooms are large and the beds are very comfortable and pillows etc of high quality. The bathrooms are large too. The problems are the mainly the reception - cashier department, the cleaners for the rooms and the operators. The RECEPTIONISTS are unfriendly unhelpful and inefficient. Some girls are very pretty but just that.....perhaps they should hire for performance and attitude rather than on looks. Checking in took me 10 minutes despite my having a a voucher passport etc and I was the only client at the counter. Check out was a little quicker but…

A very comfortable hotel in a good location. (a) Service Without exception the staff of the hotel were friendly, helpful and responsive. Check-in was fast and efficient, check in staff provided information on hotel facilities, found an available room to meet our requested configuration, and were professional and friendly. Concierge provided us with good recommendations for restaurants, shopping and information on surrounding area. F&B staff were attentive without being obtrusive. Housekeeping provided us with extra towels and made-up room on request. In fact, I have never stayed at a hotel where housekeeping responded as fast as at the Regal Hong Kong (and I stay in hotels around 45 days a year). (b) location In Causeway Bay the hotel is located near MRT stations,…

Reached hotel at midnight due to my flight. The check in was a breeze and the counter staff who assisted my check-in took less than 5 mins to settle me to my club floor. Before I left the counter, he assured me mine is facing a seaview. The hotel lobby looked ok to me, not that bad after all when I was walking towards the lift. It is indeed the old european style but I think it is still acceptable for Hong Kong standard. The Club floor is from Level 31-35, where level 31 is the club floor lounge area. I was pretty impressed as they have 2 exclusive and private lift access to club rooms. You will require a key card to go to your floor, unlikely the rest of the non-club floors. I presume they have renovated fully their club floors as the carpeting and lighting are different…

review_title: An average hotel for business travel
review_content: Stayed two nights for business in Hong Kong. Overall an older property with older bathrooms, OK for a business trip but probably better suited as a tourist hotel, with a its great location in Causeway Bay. Pros - Fitness center has new equipment, is reasonably sized for a hotel and has been recently renovated. Includes 3 treadmills as well as other cardio equipment and some free weights and machines. - Bell service efficient for arrivals and catching taxis. - Served by airport express bus from Central or a HK$40 taxi ride from the airport express train station at Central (at HK$100 the airport express is generally the fastest way from Hong Kong airport compared to HK$400 for a taxi). Regal also has a bus direct from the airport but that only runs every 60-120 minutes and can…

We stayed at the Regal Hong Kong hotel for 5 nights in March and paid £58 per night with BA holidays. At the time most of the 4 star hotels were at least double this price. After reading the tripadvisor reviews I was a little unsure of what to expect but as the price was so cheap I decided to go ahead with it. On reflection I was pleased I did. The staff on the reception was polite and friendly, but apart from checking in and out I didn't have any need for any dealings with them. I'm not sure if it's general hotel policy but upon checking in I was asked if I wanted to upgrade to a suite for approximately £50 extra per night. It provided numerous extra benefits such as the suite (!), free Internet access, buffet breakfast and a shoeshine service (!) amongst other things…

I stayed at this establishment last summer with my wife for about 5 days. First off, when we arrived at the entrance, no one offered to help with our bags, even though there were several bell boys standing around chatting - a first sign of doubt for a supposedly 5 star hotel. We went to check in, the staff at the reception were trying to avoid contact with the guests - forget smiles and hospitality, we waited for 10 minutes just for them to "get around" to us, even though there was no line. The girl that checked us in clearly had her mind somewhere else, as I told her at least twice I wanted a smoking room, and she had to ask me again as if she had not heard what I said. So we got to the room, to be fair, housekeeping was not bad, the room was clean. However, just when we…

review_title: There are better hotels at better prices
review_content: Service is awful. Housekeeping sends extra pillows and doonas without their cases or separate from their cases. Takes them about half hour to get these things to you. They also have a tendency to go into your hotel room everytime you leave it. Checking in took a long time. Cleaniness is average. Spa tube in the room needed to be recleaned before we could use it. Rooms are older than what they look on websites etc. Does not live up to the number of stars it claims to be. There are much better quality hotels at lower prices in Hong Kong.

I stayed at Regal Hong Kong Hotel with my family for our vacation in Hong Kong last week. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city and is surrounded by a number of shopping malls, which is the reason why I made my reservation as both myslf and my wife love shopping. We were offered a newly renovated room with a great view of the harbour. Unfortunately the swimming pool was under renovation otherwise it would be a perfect stay!

This is one of the strangest hotels I have stayed in. The reception is a disaster, incredibly busy and shambolic. The decorations are flamboyant to say the least - think Louis XV meets the 1980s. I arrived at midnight to check in and waited fifteen minutes before being seen. I then had to sign an acknowledgement of a change to room rates. My agent had advised it was a flat HKD1500 per night but the rate changes were all ofver the place for the two weeks that I was staying. I agreed to the rate changes since overall they worked out to be HKD1500 per night. To my room, the swipe card didn't work so again down to reception to face more chaos. The room itself was great. Quiet, good bath but the internet didn't work despite not being free. The breakfast buffet is extensive and…

Regal Hotel was a good experience. It was part of the package we bought along with the tickets, to save some money (and spend it shopping in Hong Kong!!!) Located in Hong Kong island, next to Victoria Park it was comfortable and clean. The location was very close to trams and subway station ( Causeway Bay ). Causeway Bay is a very animated area, plenty of buzz, shops and restaurants. The hall was grandiose, a little on the tacky side, with chandeliers and always buzzing with activity. Allow me to invent a word "Trumpesque" (I have been a tad too much in Atlantic City, I am afraid...) The staff was friendly and a lot of different services were offered, like massage and fitness center, as well as a terrific swimming pool in the last floor with a great view of Hong Kong! They…

I travel all over Asia/Pacific for my work, and see different hotels almost every week. This one takes the cake: the absolutely worst experience ever. I stayed in this hotel for only 1 1/2 days and hated every minute of it - and checked out as fast as I could, switching to a much more service-minded and better hotel. My secretary booked this disaster for me, probably thinking it was a 4* hotel, for a week. The issues started immediately while checking in. Despite them having the full details of the company creditcard (and thus 100% guarantee of payment, limit 25.000 USD) they came up with all kinds of lame excuses why that was not good enough and subsequently DEMANDED a USD 1000 "security deposit" in cash! Guess what? Even after depositing that rediculous amount they DEMANDED,…

review_title: WARNING "IN ROOM MINI BAR / EVIAN MINERAL WATER"
review_content: As a business traveler who aways travel staying at the different hotel around the world this case is the worst. I have just returned from REGAL HONG KONG after checked out I return to the reception desk for some inquiry where I was told, there is mini bar bill that has not been paid. I was quite surprise as I didn’t touch anything, but I was told that I had open two bottle of EVIAN WATER and the bill is around HK$120. I asked whether I can see the actual bottle that I was accused of opening. For the second time I was shock to see two bottle of EVIAN still “FULL” BUT THE SEAL CAP WAS ALREADY BROEKEN. was speech less. This scam made me look like a fool or a low life who drank the Evain water and have it filled back with tap water. After a long battle with the reception…

review_title: Good location, easily to get food and shopping till late...
review_content: My sister and myself stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Despite the hiccup during the check-in process, we got a nice room that is quite large (by HK standard) with a queen's bed. It is definitely a plus with the free shuttle service thru/fro HK International Airport. The location is great as it is within 5 mins walk to MTR and along the way and within the vicinity (if you do venture/circle far), you can easily find food and they are quite reasonable. We tried breakfast, lunch, dinner and supper (~ 10pm) there and truly enjoyed them. Our varities range from porridge, egg tart, dim sum, noodles to goose meat rice! Most, if not all, shops surrounding the area opens quite late into night, so you can do late night shopping too, however this depends what you are looking for. …

Bad idea to visit Hong Kong during the convention weeks, where hotels were either fully booked out or charged exorbitant rates. I stayed for a week at the Regal Hong Kong hotel at Causeway Bay, due to the unavailability of the very highly rated Conrad for a business trip at the end of October. Plus point: The hotel is situated conveniently near the centre of the Causeway Bay area for a variety shopping and dining options. It is about a 5-minute walk along Yee Wo street which was filled with characteristic local eateries to get to the middle of the action. The size of the room is definitely bigger than some of the Hong Kong hotels I've stayed. Minuses: This is subjective, but the Parisian-inspired deco makes one feel like being back in the 80s (crystal chandeliers, orange…

date: David H wrote a review Sep 2006
review_content: I am staying here as I write. My local secretary booked this because all desirable hotels were booked out this week and I gave zero notice of coming. This place is tatty. It tries a baroque'ish style, but then has items in the room that try to be 21st C modern in design - eg the room service menu stuck in a holder. While it has been repainted etc, there are many shortcomings such as getting into the lift, and the light on the button for my floor doesn't work, the cracked tiles in the bathroom, no phone on the desk, safe deposit box doesn't work, ac which is turned up to 26 degrees on the display, but is really about 17 degrees in the room. I tried the gym yesterday. $50 HK entry fee for a tiny room with 6 machines, one of which was broken. I tried a treadmill, but the controls…

I highly recommend the Regal Hong Kong hotel. We stayed there for 9 nights from 24th March – 2nd April 06. We had actually wanted to stay in a hotel on the Kowloon side, but most hotels were full due to the rugby HK Sevens. However, it turned out we were very happy with Regal HK’s location. It is in the busy centre of Causeway bay with many shops (eg. Times square, Sogo) and restaurants nearby. An MTR station is just two minute walk away. Our stay in the Regal HK included breakfast. It was an excellent buffet with a choice of western and Chinese food. We noticed Cathay Pacific flight staff (dressed in uniform) also regularly taking breakfast. We were disappointed that the hotels swimming pool was closed due to renovation. Instead, we used the hotels fitness centre. It was…

Regal Hong Kong situated at the quiet end of Causeway Bay, a major shopping area on the island. It's 10-min walk through elevated footbridge from the subway station. The room is standard and the room is kind of worn out. Our room had a dampen odor which we gathered is from the carpet. It claimed to be a 4-star hotel, at most I can rate it as a 3-star judging from other high quality 4-star hotels in other Asian cities that we visited. The grave disappointment was their flagship restaurant --Zeffrino on the top floor. We treated friends from California who stayed at the Hong kongPeninsular Hotel for lunch there. The restaurant is extremely short of staff. We arrived at 12:25pm The restaurant was 1/3 filled with only two servers running around as reception host and…

Stayed here because most of our other regular hotel choices in Hong Kong were not available. Overall the hotel was alright, the location, as was mentioned early was excellent. Just a stone's throw away from the Causeway Bay shopping district, there were also many excellent local food outlets nearby. One main gripe about the hotel is the decor. I got the whole idea of the "Regal" hotel, but the decor was a bit too much to take. There were simply too many paintings hanging around--both in the corridor and in the rooms. One thing the rooms could have done more with was lighting. The room did not have a central light, so even with all the lights on[foyer, bedside, table and standing lamp included], the room was still rather dim. The hotel room is also covered with mirrors--just…

review_title: A good standard hotel with excellent location.
review_content: Being a well travelled travel agent, I have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world. For example, the last two times I was in Honk Kong for work, I stayed in both the Shangri La and the Peninsula. I moved to the Regal after being displeased with a previous hotel for a 4 night stay, and although its not anywhere near the standard of some of the other higher rated hotels, it is still worthy of its 4* status. The location is excellrent, within easy walking distance of Causeway Bay. The gym is need of a little work but I have seen a lot worse. The rooftpop pool is very pleasent. The decor is not old-fashioned, it is in a 'Regal' style. It is the way they want it to look and I felt that although it was nice, it was trying to be a little too opulent for its own good. I…

date: Jo K wrote a review Oct 2005
review_content: We visited The Regal Hotel in Hong Kong in February and thank God it was only a short stop on our trip. The Hotel is rated as a 4* hotel but I have stayed in better hotels that were only rated with 2*! The decor is so terribly out of date, the rooms are incredibly small and every time we turned the lights on they blew. The gym was located in the basement of the hotel and was in a tiny room that consisted of about 4 machines. In fact every aspect of this hotel was old, grubby and needs a huge overhaul. The only positive asecpt was the staff, they were friendly, polite and extremely helpful. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Stayed at the Regal Hong Kong Hotel for 6 days from 1st - 7th March 05. It was an excellent hotel with a good location on Hong Kong Island. Our room on the 25th floor had a glimpse of Hong Kong harbour and Victoria Park. Getting to the hotel from the Airport was a breeze. On arrival at the airport we located the information desk where a girl who spoke excellent English told us the train would leave from the airport and the trip to Hong Kong Island would take 23 minutes! The train departed on time with announcements in Cantonese, English & Mandarin (in that order) and very efficiently took us to HKI in 23 mins!! She also told us a bus would take us to the hotel and it would be waiting for us on our arrival at the train station in HKI - It was! The whole trip cost about £7…
